title: Construction of the holy town, Touba (duplicate: 1947)
description: Since the resumption of diplomatic ties between China and Senegal in 2005, there has been acceleration of cooperation in all sectors between the two countries.As a friend of China in the 1960s and 1970s, Senegal then benefited a lot from the Chinese support.Senegal's former presidents Leopold Sedar Senghor and Abdou Diouf had facilitated the arrival in Senegal of Chinese investors.The Chinese agricultural and medical missions were highly appreciated in several Senegalese localities because of their expertise.The construction by the Chinese of the 'friendship' stadium in Senegal which later became 'Leopold Sedar Senghor' stadium in 1980s, helped to take this friendship to a higher level.The breaking off of diplomatic relations between the two countries in 1996 created some inconvenience to their people. However, Dakar and Beijing later decided to resume their diplomatic relations in October 2005.In January 2006, the signing of the first agreement after the reopening of the Chinese Embassy in Dakar marked the return of a 'big friend' in Senegal.The two countries have adopted a new model of cooperation which is christened 'the win-win partnership.'REVIVAL OF POLITICAL RELATIONSThe resumption of Sino-Senegalese relations was materialized on the political front through the revial of talks between Beijing and Dakar.The missions, visits and exchanges between the senior authorities in the two countries increased.President Abdoulaye Wade and members of his government made several visits to Beijing. Chinese President Hu Jintao also visited Senegal in February 2009.Several accords were signed between the two governments for the completion of several large scale projects such as the construction of the Grand National Theater, the rehabilitation of the 11 regional stadiums and training of Senegalese farmers.In addition, the Chinese government, through the Import-Export Bank of China, gave Senegal several preferential loans to carry out projects in several sectors such as energy production.CONSTRUCTION OF QUALITY AND MODERN INFRASTRUCTURESituated in the Dakar city center, the Grand National Theater has been an attraction to all passers-by.Constructed by the Chinese through aid from the Chinese government, this cultural building will enable Senegal to have a modern cultural infrastructure.During the official opening of the building in April 2010, Senegalese President Wade said it was a demonstration of the depth of ties between the two countries.China is in the process of revolutionizing Senegalese sports with the construction and rehabilitation of 11 regional stadiums. Two stadiums were already been completed and handed over to Senegal in 2009 while nine others are still under construction.Another example of Sino-Senegalese cooperation is the construction of the holy town of Touba (East) by the Chinese group, Henan China.In the health sector, Senegal's Health Minister Modou Diagne Fada and Chinese Ambassador to Senegal Gong Yuanxing recently laid the foundation stone for the construction of a children's hospital in Diamniadio town, 40 km north of Senegalese capital Dakar.The health minister said that this modern hospital which will have a 130 bed capacity, will cost 70 million yuan.CHINESE SUPPORT FOR SENEGAL'S ENERGY SECTORConfronted by a crisis in the energy sector with frequent power cuts, Senegal has benefited from the Chinese aid to resolve this problem.China will participate in the modernization of Dakar's electricity network. By 2015, the Senegalese capital city will have sufficient energy supply.In 2010, the Senegalese national electricity company (SENELEC) signed two agreements worth 69.1 billion Fcfa with the Chinese electricity company CMEC to improve electricity distribution within Dakar and its environs.DYNAMISM OF BILATERAL COMMERCIAL EXCHANGESA Senegalese newspaper Le Soleil recently reported that China has intensified bilateral commercial exchanges with the country.Chinese products are visible in almost all Senegalese markets and China has now become a destination of choice for Senegalese economic operators.FIGHT AGAINST FOOD INSECURITY AND IMPROVEMENT OF LIVING CONDITIONSOn the agricultural front, Chinese agricultural experts who settled in Senegal in 2006 have helped Senegalese farmers on ways to fight against food insecurity.In the transport sector, China and Senegal signed a cooperation accord on the opening of the Senbus bus park. This accord also envisioned the setting up of a car assembly plant in Senegal.During the same year, theSenegalese authorities announced the arrival of 200 buses assembled in China to help resolve difficulties that were being experienced by the public transport company, 'Dakar dem dikk.'China also helped Senegal in the organization of international meetings. In this regard, China gave Senegal 50 vehicles during the 11th session of the Organization of Islamic Conference (OCI) which was held in Dakar between March 7-14, 2008.The vehicles were handed over to help in the transportation of foreign dignitaries.During the third edition of the Global Negro Festival which was held in Dakar between Dec. 10-31,2010, Senegal received additional 50 vehicles from China.For the past several years,China and Senegal have maintained good momentum in further developing bilateral ties.
donor_agency_count: Henan Guoji, Private Sector
recipient_agencies: Henan Guoji, Private Sector

title: TAZARA - Grant (Duplicate of 1364)
description: China grants over 10bn shillings to Tanzania-Zambia Railway Authority.152 words19 July 200111:11 AMBBC Monitoring Africa - PoliticalBBCAPEnglish(c) 2001 The British Broadcasting Corporation [date of publication]. All Rights Reserved. No material may be reproduced except with the express permission of The British Broadcasting Corporation.Excerpt from report by Tanzanian radio on 19 JulyThe Chinese government has donated over 10.5bn shillings to Tazara [Tanzania-Zambia Railway Authority] in order to improve its services.The Chinese [assistant] minister of foreign affairs, trade and economic cooperation, Mr He Xiaouuei, said the donation will be used to buy spares. He said the money will also be used to improve the technical department and to improve the status of Tazara.Speaking after the aid was given, the minister of communications and transport, Hon Mark Mwandosya, thanked the Chinese government and added that he believed the assistance would help improve Tazara's operations. The aid was granted at the 11th conference of cooperation between Tanzania, Zambia, and China. The meeting was held today in Dar es Salaam...Source: Radio Tanzania, Dar es Salaam, in Swahili 1300 gmt 19 Jul 01.

title: Construction of power stations (Duplicate)
description: The Shandong Electric Power Construction Corporation, a subsidiary of the Chinese Shandong Power Group, has recently signed a letter of intention with the Sudanese authorities for the construction of three electricity power stations. It concerns a coal fired 500 MW power station in Port Sudan and two 300 MW gas fired power station, situated respectively in El Bagair (suburbs of Khartoum) and Al Fula (Kordofan). These projects represent an investment of $483.3 million and could be supported by the Export Import Bank of China. However, the negotiations have not yet been completed and a number of problems remain to be settled (the precise nature of the contract, cost of the project and conditions attached to the credit). There is one important point of disagreement between the government of Sudan and the Chinese company. Khartoum wants Shandong to build these power stations under a BOT (Build, Operate and Transfer) contract over 25 years.The Chinese company for its part considers that running these power stations for 25 years involves taking a risk on the future political stability of the country and on the conditions of their economic viability. It does not want to take such a risk and therefore proposed building them under an EPC (Engineering, Procurement and Construction) arrangement. Discussions will therefore have to continue for some time between the Chinese company and the authorities of Sudan before this project can be materialised.
donor_agency: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency

title: Preferential Loan for uranium project (Duplicate of 256)
description: 'NIAMEY, April 24 (Reuters) - China has granted Niger a $95 million preferential loan to boost a uranium mining project the two countries have in the West African state, Niger's government said late on Thursday. Niger's government is a 33 percent joint venture partner with the China National Uranium Corporation (SINO-U) in the SOMINA uranium mining operation, due to come on line by 2010, with an annual output of about 700 tonnes. The entry into Niger of Chinese miners and Cameco Corp , the world's top uranium producer that now has a stake in GoviEx, a company with local exploration rights, follows years of dominance by French nuclear group Areva . 'China has agreed to the Export-Import Bank of China granting Niger a preferential loan of 650 million yuan ($95.22 million) with a view to supporting the SOMINA uranium exploration project,' Niger's government said in a statement broadcast on state television late on Thursday. Niger will have to pay 2 percent interest on the loan, which must be paid back within 15 years, a government source said. China has committed to investing some $300 million in the project, which is at Azelik, in the northern Agadez region, where Areva has mining projects but the Niger government has also been battling a two-year uprising by Tuareg rebels. Niger already has two significant uranium mines providing 7.5 percent of global output from Africa's highest-grade uranium ores, according to the World Nuclear Association website. Earlier this year, Areva said it had won a licence to operate the Imouraren mine, which would more than double Niger's uranium output to make it the second largest producer in the world. ($1=6.826 Yuan) (Reporting by Abdoulaye Massalatchi; Writing by David Lewis; Editing by James Jukwey)''

title: Reduction of debt (Not a sepecific project)
description: Beijing, 29 March: Chinese Vice-President Hu Jintao said China and Sudan have maintained good momentum of bilateral relations since the two countries forged diplomatic ties 42 years ago.Hu made the remarks during talks with visiting Sudanese First Vice-President Ali Uthman Muhammad Taha here Thursday [29 March]. He added that Sino-Sudanese relations have withstood the test of time and change, and the two sides have conducted good cooperation in all fields. China appreciates Sudanese government's one-China stance and its support for China's reunification cause, Hu stressed. He also expressed gratitude for the support by Sudanese government towards China on the human rights issue, and said that China is ready to improve the relations with Sudan in the new century. On Sino-Sudanese trade relations, Hu said the trade volume between China and Sudan has increased and the cooperation has expanded in recent years. He particularly mentioned the successful cooperation between the two countries in the petroleum field, and cited it an example of friendly cooperation among the developing countries. Hu said that China is ready to expand areas for bilateral cooperation on the basis of equality, mutual benefit and effectiveness. Taha said the Sudanese government has attached importance to developing relations with China, and thanks China for its support to Sudan's national independence and territorial integrity. He also expressed gratitude for China's economic and technology assistance towards Sudan, and its reduction of debt owned by the African nation. Sudan hopes to further its cooperation with China in all fields especially in the area of petroleum, he added. Taha reaffirmed Sudan's one-China stance, and expressed his appreciation for China's efforts in promoting Sino-African cooperation. Hu Jintao said the international situation tends to ease on the whole, but hegemonism and power politics still exist, thus peace and development face challenges. Globalization is bound to intensify, Hu said, adding that economic globalization promotes the world economy, and will widen the gap between the rich and the poor. The Chinese vice-president urged the developing countries to work together to promote the establishment of a just and reasonable international political and economic order. He said that China is ready to work with Sudan to improve peace and development of mankind. Source: Xinhua news agency, Beijing, in English 1247 gmt 29 Mar 01.

title: (NOT A PROJECT?) China to invest further $3 billion in Nigeria
description: 'The global economic crisis may have forced other nations to put their African investments on hold, but not China.This week, the Nigerian government announced that China would double its current direct investment from a total of $3 billion to $6 billion, most of that in Nigeria's oil sector. Last week, the government of Guinea - where a coup brought a military captain to power last December - announced that a Chinese firm planned to invest $7 billion in oil and mining infrastructure in return for preferential treatment in all mining projects in Guinea.China's increasing investment in Africa has raised concerns among human rights activists and others who warn that Chinese money props up regimes such as those in Zimbabwe, Sudan, and the Democratic Republic of Congo who are either undemocratic, corrupt, or carry out mass-scale human rights crimes, or combinations of the above. Yet many African leaders applaud Chinese investment, saying that they create jobs, infrastructure, and business opportunities in African countries where Western companies fear to tread.'Huge Chinese investment in African companies and infrastructure is helping Africa develop. The Chinese bring what Africa needs: investment and money for governments and companies,' Rwandan President Paul Kagame told reporters for the German business daily Handelsblatt earlier in October. 'European and American involvement has not brought Africa forward,' President Kagame added, complaining of trade barriers erected by the West.China's long-stated policy of non-interference in the domestic affairs of its African partners plays well here in Africa and is a stark contrast to the starchy human-rights focus of many post- colonial European nations and of the United States. While Western nations balk at investing in a country like Zimbabwe, where state security agencies round up, beat, and sometimes kill opposition members and human rights activists, the Chinese are happy to do business. They also sell arms to those regimes.Arms for ZimbabweConsider China's arms deal with Zimbabwe, which went largely unnoticed until June 2008, when South African trade unionists refused to unload a cargo ship carrying the weapons in Durban harbor (Zimbabwe is landlocked). The Chinese ship eventually unloaded the arms in Angola and Zimbabwean planes carried them the rest of the way to Harare.'The Chinese ought to be held accountable for that, whether you'e got an embargo by the UN or not,' says Francis Kornegay, a senior researcher at the Center for Policy Studies in Johannesburg. 'On things like that, the Chinese don't like to be taking the heat, in the limelight, and South Africa ought to be able to get China to agree that nobody should be sending arms to Zimbabwe.'But despite the expected 'tougher stand' of President Jacob Zuma toward Zimbabwe, no African nation has stood up to either the Chinese or the Zimbabwean government. 'There is no leadership on the continent. And China takes advantage of that,' Mr. Kornegay said.China has an advantage over Western countries who keep their government aid and their business interests separate, at least on paper. When a US-based mining company makes an offer to pay for the rights to exploit a mine in, say, the Democratic Republic of Congo, it does so completely on its own. But when a Chinese firm - which is, after all, owned by the Chinese government - bids on the same project, it can also promise significant Chinese government aid for building roads and water systems and electrical projects, a complete package that no Western private company can compete with.The Chinese government is also flush with cash. So while other governments have simply pulled back from development aid projects, China has actually boosted investment, with $552 million in the first half of 2009. In May, Beijing announced that it would increase its China-Africa Development Fund - which has invested $400 million in Africa since 2006 - by an additional $2 billion.Trade between Africa and China is now worth about $100 billion per year, most of it generated by mineral and oil sales. That's about 10 times the level it was in the 1980s. Chinese investment in Sudan - a country accused by the International Criminal Court of war crimes and mass murder in its six-year civil conflict in the Darfur region - allows China to take home more than 60 percent of all the oil that Sudan produces. The arrangement works well for Sudan, or at least for the government in Khartoum. More than 80 percent of Khartoum's revenues come from oil.Faced with no-questions-asked Chinese investment on one hand and the West's penny-pinching aid-with-a-lecture on the other makes competing with China in Africa a tough task, German President Horst Kohler admitted in a June meeting with Ugandan President Yoweri Museveni. 'For this reason, Africans believe that China is better than the West because for us we raise issues regarding democracy, corruption and human rights,' the German president said in Berlin.(c) Copyright 2009. The Christian Science Monitor'

title: Construction of oil transmission pipeline (Duplicate)
description: 16 September 2003China Chemical Reporter CHCR English (c) 2003 China Chemical Reporter. All rights reserved  The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources of Sudan and China National Petroleum Corporation recently signed 3 agreements on joint oil development in Al Khurtum. President of Sudan, attended the signing ceremony.     The first agreement is concerned on the capacity expansion of Al Khurtum Refinery. The project has an investment of US$340 million. After the completion of the project, the oil refining capacity in the plant can increase from 56 000 barrels to 100 000 barrels per day. The second agreement isabout the construction of a 720km-long oil transmission pipeline from oil producing areas to Al Khurtum. The transmitting capacity of the pipeline will reach 200 000 barrels per day. The third agreement is about the joint establishment of an oil geophysical company. Not long ago CNPC Explorationand Development Co. discovered a large oilfield with oil reserves amounting to 2.0 billion barrels in a Basin of Sudan.        Sudan can already produce various oil products including jet fuel oil. Besides meeting the domestic demand, some export can also be made each year.(c)2003. China Chemical Reporter. title: Chinese military advisers for use of patrol boats
description: In 2006, Sierra Leone and China signed a military aid deal involving Chinese advisors for the use of patrol boats donated by Beijing. The agreement provides for 15 Chinese advisers to stay for six months and train patrol boat personnel. It is unclear if the team ever arrived.

title: The Chinese government has donated 7,780 metric tons of fertilizer valued at 20 million RMB Yuan (duplicate)
description: China donates fertilizer, maize to Zambia.253 words16 September 2003Xinhua News AgencyXNEWSEnglish(c) Copyright 2003 Xinhua News AgencyLUSAKA, Sept. 16 (Xinhua) - The Chinese government has donated 7,780 metric tons of fertilizer valued at 20 million RMB Yuan ( about 2.5 million US dollars) and 4,500 metric tons of non-GMO yellow maize to Zambia.While officiating at the handover ceremony held here Tuesday, Zambian Agriculture and Cooperatives Minister Mundia Sikatana said he is grateful for the assistance the Chinese government has continued to render to Zambia and in particular in the development of the agricultural sector.Sikatana said the donation has not only come at the right time but that it will assist Zambia in expanding coverage in terms of input support and in assisting the country's vulnerable households access food.'The fertilizer we are receiving today will supplement government efforts in reaching out to many of our small scale farmers,' he said.'The food we are receiving today will add value to the nutritional status of our people particularly, in those areas prone to disasters,' he added.    Sikatana reaffirmed the Zambian government's commitment to thecontinued good relations with China.   Chinese Ambassador to Zambia Peng Keyu said the consignment ofmaterials is provided by the Chinese government to promote theagricultural development of Zambia.   Peng said the donation deeply expresses the friendly feelingsof the Chinese government and people to the Zambian government andpeople.   He hoped the two countries can further strengthen the bilateraleconomic cooperation and make new contribution to the commoninterests of the two peoples.  Document XNEWS00020030916dz9g001e4

title: Chinese government promise to aid Sierra Leone in food security
description: In 2002, the Chinese government promised to aid Sierra Leone in food security. It is unclear exactly how much food aid was given and the value of the project.

title: china donates goods (duplicate)
description: China gives Zambia 1m dollars to purchase relief aid270 words9 February 200610:16 AMBBC Monitoring Asia PacificBBCAPPEnglish(c) 2006 The British Broadcasting Corporation. All Rights Reserved. No material may be reproduced except with the express permission of The British Broadcasting Corporation.Text of report in English by official Chinese news agency Xinhua (New China News Agency)Lusaka, 9 February: China has given drought-hit Zambia 1m US dollars for it to purchase relief food. At the signing ceremony held here Thursday [9 February] of the notes to acknowledge receipt of the fund, Chinese Ambassador to Zambia Li Baodong said that this donation is in the conditions that Zambia is suffering the food shortage because of drought.The ambassador said that the Chinese government is doing the job to help the Zambian government to implement the project of maintenance of water supply in Lusaka, Ndola and Kitwe with about 80m RMB [renminbi] yuan (about 10m dollars).The Chinese government has also agreed to provide the government with a batch of goods worth 10m RMB yuan (about 1.2m dollars) to be used in the elections later this year.On occasion Zambian Finance Minister Ng'andu Magande thanked the Chinese government for the assistance. The minister assured the Chinese ambassador the grant will be utilized to purchase relief food to benefit the hunger stricken people and accountability and transparency in the utilization of grant is strictly observed.It is estimated that 1.7 million Zambians are facing food shortage due to the drought that hit most part of the southern African country in the 2004/05 farming season. In November, 2005, Zambian President Levy Mwanawasa declared the hunger situation in the country as a 'national disaster', calling for international food aid.Source: Xinhua news agency, Beijing, in English 1154 gmt 9 Feb 06
sector: Humanitarian and Disaster Relief and Preparation

title: $10 million financing arrangement secured (not a project)
description: Unnamed Chinese Investor Found for Tazaraby Mike Mande, the Eastafrican341 words30 October 200604:23 PMAll AfricaAFNWSEnglish(c) 2006 AllAfrica, All Rights ReservedNairobi, Oct 30, 2006 (The East African/All Africa Global Media via COMTEX) --Tanzania, Zambia and China are working on price assessment for possible concessioning of the Tanzania-Zambia Railways Authority (Tazara) to a Chinese private firm early next year.The three countries have already appointed a team consisting of three parties for the negotiation of the pricing. A private investor from China has been identified.Brigadier General Peter Tembo, Permanent Secretary in the Ministry of Communication and Transport in Zambia, told The EastAfrican in Lusaka last week that Zambia and Tanzania had agreed to concession the railway firm to a Chinese investor who will be guaranteed by the Chinese government.'The Tanzania Parastatal Sector Reform Commission (PSRC) is overseeing the privatisation of Tazara, with the committee from the three partner states working on the price assessment,' he said, adding that some members of the privatisation committee had already been drawn from Tanzania, Zambia and China.Among other things, the Commission was expected to come up with an appropriate modality of privatising Tazara, with the two options being selling or leasing it out.Recently, a Chinese delegation visited Tanzania and Zambia for consultations with various stakeholders on the concessioning of Tazara.Maua Daftari, Deputy Minister for Infrastructure Development, said recently that the Tanzania and Zambia governments had identified a Chinese firm with the capacity to run the 1,860 kilometre railway profitably but stopped short of disclosing the firm's name.Ms Daftari said that Tanzania and Zambia had agreed to give priority to the Chinese firm after taking into account China's role in building the railway line and sustaining it over the past three decades.The railway line, constructed in the 1970s, runs from Dar-es-Salaam to Kapiri Mposhi in Zambia. Tazara has been experiencing declining profits through technical and managerial problems.Early this month, Tazara contracted an international firm to rehabilitate 18 main line locomotives under a $10 million financing arrangement secured through Konkola Copper Mines.
verified: Konkola Copper Mines, Private Sector

title: $500m on Zambian economic development (duplicate-progress report)
description: Chinese firm spends 500m dollars on development of economic zone in Zambia355 words15 December 200808:20 AMBBC Monitoring AfricaBBCAPEnglish(c) 2008 The British Broadcasting Corporation. All Rights Reserved. No material may be reproduced except with the express permission of The British Broadcasting Corporation.Text of report by state-owned national newspaper Zambia Daily Mail website on 15 December[Report by Nkole Chitala: 'NFCA Spends US Doller 500m on MFEZ']China's Non-Ferrous Metals Corporation Africa (NFCA) mining Plc has spent US$500 million on the development of Chambishi multi-facility economic zone (MFEZ) on the Copperbelt.And a Chinese delegation, led by that country's minister of Commerce and Trade is expected in Zambia to commission the copper smelter at Chambishi mine next month.Commerce, Trade and Industry minister, Felix Mutati, said in Solwezi that out of the US$900 million investment set for the establishment of the economic zone, US$500 million had been spent.Mr Mutati said that apart from the commissioning of the Chambishi smelter, the delegation would also launch the Lusaka MFEZ.He said work on the Chambishi zone which was on schedule, had progressed well.Power and sewer system, infrastructure and road system were already in place at Chambishi economic zone.He said that currently a pass centre into the zone was being created.The economic zone is an area or premise where manufacturing activities, most for exports, are conducted with tax incentives offered to the firms.To qualify for operating in the zone, a company must invest over US$ 500,000, demonstrate that the investment will transfer technology and utilise local materials, among other criteria.Chambishi mine, being operated by NFCA, was initially an open pit mine and later developed as an underground mine. It was one of the first mines to be privatised in 1999.Since the acquisition of the firm, there has been heavy investment,which has seen the rehabilitation and modernisation of the old copper concentrator.The concentrator will have a capacity of producing 42 per cent copper concentrate grade from 1.8 per cent, making it superior to any other copper produced in Zambia.Currently, average grade for concentrates produced in Zambia is 35 per cent, most of which is exported to China.Source: Zambia Daily Mail website, Lusaka, in English 15 Dec 08a94b0e35
donor_agency_count: China Nonferrous Metal Mining (Group) Co., Ltd. (CNMC), State-Owned Company
recipient_agencies: China Nonferrous Metal Mining (Group) Co., Ltd. (CNMC), State-Owned Company

title: China has given Zambia grant assistance totalling 30 million (duplicate)
description: China gives Zambia 53m dollars for mobile hospitals469 words3 August 201012:31 PMBBC Monitoring AfricaBBCAPEnglish(c) 2010 The British Broadcasting Corporation. All Rights Reserved. No material may be reproduced except with the express permission of The British Broadcasting Corporation.Text of report by Zambian privately-owned daily newspaper The Post website on 3 August[Report by Florence Bupe: 'China Gives Govt US$53 Million Loan for Mobile Hospitals']The Government of China has given Zambia a 361 million yuan (approximately US $53 million) concessional loan for the construction of mobile hospitals in the country.And Vice President George Kunda has appealed to the Zambian and Chinese governments to implement the various bilateral agreements that were signed during President Rupiah Banda's state visit to that country in February his year.Speaking when a visiting Chinese delegation met Vice President Kunda at State House yesterday, Chinese State Councillor Dai Bingguo disclosed that his country had given Zambia the loan as part of continued efforts to strengthen bilateral ties.'On his visit, China will again provide assistance to Zambia through a concessional loan worth 361 million yuan for the construction of mobile hospitals. China will also consider providing preferential export bias credit to support the project n the Mongu-Kalabo Road and the housing project for civil servants,' he said.China has also given Zambia grant assistance totalling 30 million (about US $4.4 million) for the completion of already existing projects, including the construction of the Government Complex and stadium.Dai pledged his country's continued support to Zambia's economic growth through the provision of technical and financial resources for various projects. And Vice President Kunda said President Banda's recent visit to China had provided an opportunity for Zambia to be in touch with prevailing economic trends for growth. He said Zambia was one of China's biggest investment destinations with a total investment injection of US $700 million so far.'I would like to appeal to the governments of China and Zambia to quickly implement the various agreements that were signed during our President's state visit t hat country in the areas of technical and economic support,' said Vice-President Kunda.The Chinese delegation and Zambian government officials later held a closed door meeting with President Rupiah Banda, who was not part of the earlier meeting. The closed door meeting was followed by the signing of four bilateral agreements which included economic and technical cooperation, the Framework on the provision of the concessional loan, the agreement on the avoidance of double taxation and the agreement for the establishment of the Confucius Institute at the University of Zambia (UNZA).Meanwhile, First Republican President Dr Kenneth Kaunda appealed to China to continue providing assistance not only to Zambia, but also to Africa as a whole if sustainable development is to be attained.This was when the Chinese delegation visited Dr Kaunda's residence in Lusaka's Kabulonga area.Source: The Post website, Lusaka, in English 3 Aug 10ac5cf9d7Document BBCAP00020100803e683001rx

title: U.S.$400 Million Deal With Zambia [not a project, company is Nigerian]
description: In 2010, the Investment Promotion and Protection Agreement between Dangote Industries Ltd. and the Zambian government was signed, an agreement worth $400 million USD. It is a requirement for all major investors in Zambia which offers them additional incentives and safeguards their investments.  'As Dangote Industries Limited's investment is among the largest investments outside the traditional mining sector and Chinese investments in Zambia, it has understandably attracted a lot of attention,' he said, adding 'The fact that it is an African investment also generates a great deal of interest. Let me assure you that we are equal to the task; we have similar investments in more than 10 other African countries. We spent about nine months negotiating and I am delighted that we are now at a point where all parties are agreeable to the deal.'According to Dangote, the proposed cement plant in Zambia with an installed capacity of 1.5 million metric tonnes per annum, will be up and running 27 months from February/March 2011. He said DIL's choice of Zambia for this multi-million dollar investment is quite strategic, noting that the World Bank had in 2010 named Zambia as one of the world's fastest economically reforming countries. Zambia, he recalled, is also rated as one of the most highly urbanised countries in sub-Saharan Africa with 44 percent of the population concentrated in a few urban areas.Document AFNWS00020101213e6cd0004

title: China Injects assists Tazara Railway
description: In 2011, China granted a soft loan worth $39.9 million USD to Tazara to strengthen the railway. The loan would be spent on 11 areas including purchase of six new locomotive engines, rehabilitation of nine more and purchase of 90 new cargo carriages and rehabilitation of four cranes and two rescue cranes. Other requirements include the purchase of raw materials for rail underlining bars, purchase of spare parts for 1,200 cargo carriages and covering training costs of workers from different departments and professionals.

title: Bauxite development
description: In 2007, four Chinese state-owned firms set up a conglomerate known as the Henan International Mining Co. Ltd. to develop Guinea's bauxite resources. Yongcheng Coal and Co. Ltd. was one of the participants. This particular company holds a 51 percent stake in the overall conglomerate, which has a registered capital of 200 million RMB. In February of 2012, Henan International held a groundbreaking ceremony, with Provincial Minister Guo Gengmao, Chinese Ambassador Zhao Lixing, Deputy Prime Minister Uthman Ba, and Mineral Resources Minister Fu Fana all present. Geological exploration of the region was completed in October of 2009, and in October of 2010, completed the charter of their mining rights. The total investment will reach more than $3 billion USD.

title: Not a project (through WHO): 500,000 USD humanitarian aid for healthcare
description: 'NAIROBI, Jan. 22 (Xinhua) -- Chinese government donated 500,000 U.S. dollars humanitarian aid to Somalia through the World Health Organization (WHO) here Tuesday.China and Somalia enjoy cordial relationship, and the friendship cherished by the two countries and peoples have been developed continuously since China and Somalia established diplomatic ties in the year of 1960, said Zhang Ming, Chinese Ambassador to Kenya, at the hand-over ceremony Tuesday.'The Chinese government has been always supporting the Somali peace process from the beginning and has provided help in varieties to Somali people within our capacity,' said the ambassador, who paid a visit to Mogadishu last August and saw the accessibility of Somali people to health care was very low.'In order to express the concern and sympathy of China and the Chinese people towards Somalia and the Somali people, the Chinese government decided to provide a humanitarian aid of half a million U.S. dollars, for helping the internally displaced persons in Somalia to get more basic medical treatment and helping the people in need,' he said.'What I can assure you is that, the Chinese government will continue, together with the international community, to make contribution for the peace, stability, reconstruction and development of Somalia,' said the ambassador.The donation will be handled by WHO Somalia office to purchase medicine and medical equipment, and transport and distribute them to hospitals in Somalia.Both WHO Somalia Representative Fouad Mojallid and Somali Ambassador to Kenya Mohamed Ali Nur were present at the ceremony. They thanked the Chinese government for the support to Somalia.Document XNEWS00020080122e41m004jx'
sector: Humanitarian and Disaster Relief and Preparation
donor_agency_count: World Health Organization (WHO), Multilateral

title: 2D Petroleum Seismic Surveys (Duplicate of 137)
description: 'Exploration of the remote Tenere Block in eastern Niger is back on the cards after Canada's TG World Energy and Chinese state giant China National Petroleum Corp. (CNPC) settled a bitter disagreement.CNPC International will operate the block and carry the costs of Canadian minnow TG World for a 20% stake in the four-year exploratory program, plus offer $1 million in compensation. The agreement is still subject to government approval.The dispute stemmed from the Niger government's decision last November to hand over the 8.6 million acre Tenere exploration permit to CNPC, just a week after terminating TG's own lease on the acreage -- its sole global asset -- ahead of its formal expiry.TG protested and accused its former Chinese negotiating partner of breaking confidentially agreements, as another CNPC affiliate, China National Oil and Gas Exploration and Development Corp., had earlier discussed a farm-in deal (IOD Jan.14,p1).After TG World initiated international and local legal action, the two sides held talks in Niger and China in June, and the Canadian firm later said an 'amicable settlement' appeared to have been reached.The new $55 million work program calls for a minimum of 1,500 kilometers of seismic surveys before the end of the year, followed by three exploration wells. The Tenere contract is structured on rolling three-year terms, each of which would include further exploration well commitments.Tenere is adjacent to the Agadem contract area held by Exxon Mobil and Malaysia's Petronas, which has found oil and gas discoveries in five pools totaling 350 million barrels of oil equivalent. Operator Petronas now plans to drill three more Agadem wells to gauge the threshold required for an export development project. According to TG, Tenere should lie on the same trend, and its previous seismic work suggested 10 prospects large enough to hold over 500 million barrels of oil equivalent each.As one of the poorest countries on the planet, Niger has been keen for oil exploration to get back on track after years of raised hopes and sporadic drilling stretching back to the 1950s.Interest has picked up since an Exxon-led consortium completed a 1,050-km crude export pipeline from the large Doba fields in neighboring Chad through to Cameroon and the coast (IOD Oct.3,p4).Nonetheless, transportation remains the key obstacle should any large finds be made in this barren and remote Saharan nation, with Exxon admitting it would require a find of at least 1 billion barrels to justify a 1,000-km plus link to the Chad pipeline, or a new line crossing North Africa to the Mediterranean. '//中国石油网消息（记者李向阳）12月6日，尼日尔项目认真贯彻集团公司领导调研指示精神，迅速成立油气勘探地质资料调查和天然气利用两个专题小组，广泛收集资料，开展市场调查，为新项目开发提供依据。　　中国石油尼日尔地区企业协调组成员一致表示,要增强紧迫感、危机感和使命感，自觉加压，勇挑重担，全面提升工作水平，为非洲油气合作区建设做贡献。尼日尔项目成立尼日尔油气勘探地质资料调查和天然气利用两个专题小组，广泛收集资料，开展市场调查，为新项目开发提供依据。中国石油尼日尔地区企业协调组还组织各参建单位认真总结一体化项目建设的经验教训，做好成品油销售工作，经营和管理好阿加德姆百万吨上下游一体化项目，树立中国石油的良好品牌；进一步加大勘探发现的力度，寻找更多的优质储量；加快推动二期工程进展，为力争早日实现尼日尔原油出口和扩大中尼两国的友谊与合作做出更大贡献。 http://www.cnpc.com.cn/cn/xwzx/xwygg/%25C4%25E1%25C8%25D5%25B6%25FB%25CF%25EE%25C4%25BF%25B3%25C9%25C1%25A2%25D7%25A8%25CC%25E2%25D0%25A1%25D7%25E9%25D6%25FA%25CD%25C6%25D0%25C2%25CF%25EE%25C4%25BF%25BF%25AA%25B7%25A2.htm

title: Second batch of peacekeepers to Darfur (Duplicate)
description: China announced today the deployment of the second batch of peacekeepers to Darfur by mid-July. Beijing also announced the temporary transfer of its troops in south Sudan to Darfur.China a close ally to the Sudanese government agreed to send a 315-member engineering unit to Darfur, the first group of 143 engineers had already been dispatched to Darfur since November 2007. The Chinese engineers are to build roads and bridges, and dig wells, and have also brought a medical team.Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Liu Jianchao said today China will deploy its follow-up troops next month. 'According to the UN's arrangement on the transportation of materials and equipment, China will deploy its follow-up troops in the region by mid-July.' Jianchao said.The spokesperson also announced the temporary transfer of some of its troops and facilities stationed in the UN mission in South Sudan to Darfur, helping the engineer troops in Darfur with construction of camps and roads.Chinese troops, located in Western Bahr-al-Ghazal State, are supposed to be 435 officers and soldiers in total, has 275 engineers, 100 transport troops and 60 medical staff. China is also ready to send well-diggers and relevant equipment to Darfur to solve the water shortage facing the hybrid forces, the Chinese official said.He also reiterated China's concern about the situation in Darfur saying that his country supported the duel-track strategy that promotes the deployment of peace-keeping mission and political negotiation in a balanced way in order to solve the Darfur issue politically.He further reaffirmed the willing of Beijing to work with the international community and continue 'to make our contribution for the early realization of peace, stability and development in Darfur.'More than 2.5 million Darfur civilians have fled to camps and 300,000 been killed in four years of fighting between the region's ethnic rebels and the Sudanese government or militia allies. Several previous peace deals have failed, and refugees along with aid workers continue to face daily insecurity.Source: Sudan Tribune website, Paris in English 27 Jun 08

title: US$30 Million Grant (duplicate)
description: Oct 05, 2007 (New Era/All Africa Global Media ia COMTEX) -- The Chinese Ambassador to Namibia, Liang Yinzhu, on Tuesday leaves after serving in the country for four years. He leaves after a rich career in diplomacy in Africa. He worked as an ambassador in Nigeria, Ghana, Zimbabwe and Namibia. New Era met him on Wednesday, and he had much to say about his time in office and commented on areas of cooperation between the two countries.Q: Could you describe the relationship between China and Namibia?A: Far as they are from each other geographically, China and Namibia established their traditional friendship in the 1960s and then made it deep rooted. When the Namibian people were struggling for independence, China stood firmly on their side and provided them with moral and material support by overcoming its own difficulties. The two countries established diplomatic relations the day after Namibia gained independence.The friendly cooperation between the two countries has ever since been developing in a steady and sound manner. In recent years, there have been frequent exchanges of high level isits, which greatly helps deepen mutual political trust and promotes cooperation in all fields with marked results.China significantly increased its assistance to Namibia and a number of projects were completed. His Excellency Hu Jintao, President of the Peoples Republic of China, pledged to provide Namibia with 1 billion yuan in concessionary loans, US$100 million in preferential export buyer's credit, 30 million yuan in grants and 30 million yuan in interest-free loans during his isit to Namibia in February this year.Also during this isit, President Jintao undertook to build two rural schools and a hospital. The two sides are now discussing the modalities of the financial assistance.Trade olume between the two countries increased rapidly and bilateral cooperation in such areas as economy, trade, jurisdiction, education, health, etc has been on the rise. More and more cities in the two countries got twinned with more commercial and cultural exchanges between the two peoples. Some Chinese businessmen came to Namibia to invest, who made contributions to enriching local markets, improving the living standards of the locals and arresting unemployment and poverty.In accordance with the MoU on the implementation plan for organised Group Travel by Chinese citizens to Namibia signed during President Jintao's isit, Chinese travel agencies will start organising tourist groups to Namibia as of October 15.In a word, acting on the Beijing Declaration and Plan of Action of the Beijing Summit of the Forum on China-Africa Cooperation held last year, the two sides are making concerted efforts to instil igour and itality into bilateral relations, which will greatly benefit the two countries and the two peoples.
sector: Trade, Tourism, Banking and Financial Services

title: Development assistance to Darfur (Not specific project)
description: 158 words 29 September 2009 05:42 AMBBC Monitoring Middle East BBCMEP English (c) 2009 The British Broadcasting Corporation. All Rights Reserved. No material may be reproduced except with the express permission of The British Broadcasting Corporation. Text of report in English by state-owned Sudanese news agency Suna websiteKhartoum, 28 September: The Chinese ambassador to the Sudan, Chang Li has said his country has provided about one hundred million and four hundred thousand Chinese Yuan in development assistance to Darfur.The ambassador has pointed out in a press conference held within the celebrations marking his country's national day, that the embassy would donate the construction of one school in Nyala town from within the budget of the embassy in Khartoum, in support for development in Darfur.The ambassador said he has been told by the Commissioner for Humanitarian Affairs, Hassabu Muhammad Abd-al-Rahman, that China was considered one of the first countries providing development assistance to Darfur. He said his country encourages political dialogue and that all should join the peace process.Source: Suna news agency website, Khartoum, in English 28 Sep 09aac68b95Document BBCMEP0020090929e59t001md

title: concessional loan was agreed for US$270 million (duplicate of ID 2438)
description: China and Ghana Sign Financing Deal for Bui HEP Thomas Pearmain 176 words 26 September 2008Global Insight Daily Analysis WDAN English Copyright 2008, Global Insight Limited. All Rights Reserved. China's SinoHydro, the developers behind the long-anticipated Bui dam in Ghana's Brong Ahafo region has signed a financing agreement with the government for the US$562 million project. African Energy reports that a concessional loan was agreed for US$270 million between the governments of Ghana and China while another agreement for US$292 million was signed between Ghana and the Export-Import Bank of China. Ghana will directly invest US$22 million in the facility.Significance: President John Agyekum Kufour launched construction of the Bui Dam on the Black Volta River at the end of September. Kufour has said that international environmental and social standards will be applied and that the relocation programme will draw on the lessons learnt from the building of the Akosombo and Kpong dams. The government hopes that the Bui dam will become a national tourism site and its construction process will provide employment for 2,900 Ghanaians. It is scheduled to be completed in five years.Document WDAN000020080926e49q00039加纳布维水电站提前一年截流  库福尔总统、王彤宙出席庆典仪式                                                                               来源：                  中国水电新闻中心                作者：                    赵东风 刘细军 朱莎                                                                        摄影作者：                                                    时间：                    2008-12-03                                【字号：大 中 小】                                                      　　12月2日，在加纳总统库福尔与数千加纳人的注视下，中国水电八局有限公司布维项目部员工奋起神威，一举斩断非洲黑沃尔特河，比合同工期提前一年实现布维水电站工程截流，兑现了中国水电集团总经理范集湘向全国政协主席贾庆林所作的承诺。　　加纳政府在截流现场举行了隆重的截流庆典。加纳总统约翰．库福尔、政府首席长官、能源部部长、财政部副部长、电站左右两岸所在省的省长出席庆典。中国驻加纳大使于文哲、参赞胡玉杰、中国进出口银行驻非洲代表易宗华与中国水电集团副总经理王彤宙、水电八局有限公司总经理林修建出席庆典。出席庆典仪式的还有加纳一些部落的酋长。在庆典仪式上，库福尔总统致辞，对中国的经济援助表示衷心感谢。他称赞中国水电集团是具有国际一流水准的品牌企业，希望布维水电站项目的建设能够带动加纳经济、文化、教育等方面的发展，能够继续加强中加两国的友好关系和传统友谊，进一步促进各个领域的合作。　　王彤宙在致辞中说，没有中加两国政府和人民的大力支持，今天的截流是不可能实现的。中国水电集团凭借其先进的技术、精致的施工和良好的声誉，成为中国水电建设行业的一流品牌，同时也获得了广泛的国际赞誉。布维水电站项目是在中加两国政府的高度重视和关注下实施的，截流后的建设任务依然十分艰巨，全体工程建设者要以对加纳国家和人民高度负责的精神，继续发扬艰苦奋斗的作风，再接再厉，奋发进取，精心施工，确保工程质量和施工安全，确保高质量按期完成工程建设任务，把布维水电站建成一流工程、优质工程。　　加纳布维水电站由中国进出口银行贷款兴建，总投资约6亿美元，设计总装机容量40万千瓦，大坝为114米高的碾压混凝土坝，，建成后将成为加纳的第二大水电站，使加纳由电力进口国一跃变成电力出口国。布维水电站项目是加纳唯一由总统副总统亲任业主委员会主任副主任的项目。2007年4月，加纳能源部与中国水电集团公司签署加纳布维水电站EPC建设合同即设计、采购、施工总承包合同。加纳总统库福尔出席了项目合同签字仪式。贾庆林主席要求中国水电集团把布维水电站建成让加纳人民放心的一流工程，成为中加经济合作的又一新成果，为增进中加、中非各国的传统友谊作出央企的贡献。　　布维项目部全体员工克服远离祖国，环境陌生，资源匮乏，蚊虫肆虐，疟疾流行等困难，积极开展各项设计、采购与施工的工作，自今年4月中旬首批大型设备进场后，迅速掀起施工高潮，在短短的7个月内，投入施工设备近2亿元，完成临时施工道路、承包商营地、业主临时营地、临时砂石生产与砼拌和系统以及附属加工厂、仓库建设。相继开始主体工程坝肩开挖与导流明渠等工程施工。9月，项目部在挡水标准设计为十年一遇的纵向围堰施工中，遭遇并战胜了百年一遇洪水。 11月9日，进行截流预进占施工并顺利推进。11月29日，设计流量为720立方/秒的导流明渠具备截流条件开始破堤导流，12月2日胜利实现大江截流。截流的同时从国内传来喜讯，中国进出口银行的贷款协议中的融资条件完成，标志着项目放款程序正式启动。　　目前，中国水电集团在非洲承建的项目已有80个，合同总额30余亿美元。

title: Construction of primary school (Duplicate)
description: 282 words 6 September 2009 06:04 AMBBC Monitoring Asia Pacific BBCAPP English (c) 2009 The British Broadcasting Corporation. All Rights Reserved. No material may be reproduced except with the express permission of The British Broadcasting Corporation. Text of report in English by official Chinese news agency Xinhua (New China News Agency)[Xinhua: 'China-Donated Primary School Put To Use in Darfur']KHARTOUM, Sept. 5 (Xinhua) - A primary school donated to the Darfur region by the Chinese embassy in Sudan was completed and put to use on Saturday.Located in Nyala, capital of South Darfur state, the school has32 classrooms, six teachers' offices, 600 sets of chairs and desks, and a small football pitch.Chinese Ambassador to Sudan Li Chengwen, Deputy Governor of South Darfur state Abdel Aziz Adam al-Hilu and hundreds of children studying in the school attended the opening ceremony held in the school's playground.Al-Hilu called the school the best gift the local people have ever received and praised the Chinese people as the true friends of the Sudanese people.He said even before the school was finished, some anxious teachers and students began to have classes there.The school was constructed by the engineering troops of the Chinese peacekeeping forces in Darfur. After getting the go-ahead from the African Union-United Nations Hybrid Operation in Darfur (UNAMID), the troops used their spare time to build the school, which is deemed as the top-class school in South Darfur state in terms of the standard of construction and equipment.Al-Hilu also said 54 primary schools donated by the Chinese government to South Darfur State are being completed and put to use one after another and will surely play an important role in promoting the local cultural and social development.Source: Xinhua news agency, Beijing, in English 0815 gmt 6 Sep 09aaa83e06Document BBCAPP0020090906e596000b8

China Power Investment will acquired digging rights outside of Conakry, and in exchange, the company will finance a coal power plant, a deep water port, and a refinery. It is still unclear if the deal was actually signed.

title: Agricultural equipment donation
description: In 2011, the Guinean prime minister received 150 farming tractors, among other agricultural equipment and implements from China, but they were purchased by the Guinean government for the Guinean farmers. It is unclear how much the tractors were worth. The sale does not appear to be concessional; this is a commercial transaction without a Chinese-financed element.

title: Bus and street cleaning truck donation- duplicate with 13788
description: Programme summary of Guinea-Conakry RTG television 2030 gmt 23 Dec 11558 words27 December 201104:29 AMBBC Monitoring AfricaBBCAPEnglish(c) 2011 The British Broadcasting Corporation. All Rights Reserved. No material may be reproduced except with the express permission of The British Broadcasting Corporation.1. Headlines2. Communiquéssued by the Ministry of Labour saying that Monday 26 December is a public holiday, in conformity with the law.3. China has donated 100 buses and 50 waste collection trucks to Guinea. The official presentation of the donation took place today under the chairmanship of President Alpha Conde. The Chinese ambassador said the donation demonstrates the good relations between China and Guinea and it is a support to President Conde's 'Guinea Is Back' policy. The buses will be used for public transportation in the country. This is a big relief for the people who expressed their happiness.4. Cultural news: The prime minister today in Touba presided over a local festival. More details later.5. The minister of territorial administration has concluded his visits to headquarters of political parties. His last visit was to the Guinean Ecologists Party headquarters. An official of that party expressed happiness with the visit and outlined the outcome of the discussions. The minister reiterated the preparedness of President Conde to organize free and fair legislative elections in the country. He noted that all the opposition leaders want to move to the elections and expressed happiness over this development. In the coming days, all the stakeholders involved in the electoral process will come together to discuss all the demands made by the opposition parties.6. The Alliance for Democracy and Progress and the Collective of Political Parties for the Conclusion of the Transition yesterday held a news conference to express their preparedness to resume dialogue with the government over the legislative elections. They also assessed the balance-sheet of President Alpha Conde. The opposition has decided to suspend their planned rallies.7. Cultural news: The prime minister today presided over a local festival in Touba. Prayers were also offered for peace in the country.8. The Ministry of Territorial Administration and Decentralization wishes to inform members of the Framework for National Dialogue about the resumption of deliberations of the committee on Tuesday 27 December 2011 at 1000 at the Palais Du Peuple. Members of the committee are invited to attend.9. The Guinean ambassador to Russia recently presented his credentials to that country's leader.10. Youths of Dixxin District have held a rally to express support to President Alpha Conde. The ceremony was presided over by the minister of youths.11. The minister of communication recently visited Galapai and Yomou to promote peace and national reconciliation.12. The governor of Conakry is continuing his sensitization tour of parts of the city. This week, he visited Matam and Dixxin.13. The First Lady today held a Christmas party for 150 children from various SOS villages in Conakry.14. The minister delegate for national defence and the minister of health have visited Dubreka to inspect the 120-bed military hospital under construction there.15. Report about the eviction of some illegal settlers in a district near the Conakry port.16. Report about the launching of a local mosque in Conta town near Forecariah.17. The IOM has donated some relief materials to Guinean refugees returning from Cote d'Ivoire. The US and Australia governments donated 18m US dollars for this project.18. Obituary announcement.Source: Radiodiffusion Television Guineenne Television, Conakry, in French 2030 gmt 23 Dec 11aefe444eThe British Broadcasting CorporationDocument BBCAP00020111227e7cr001xh

title: Humanitarian aid for Darfur (Duplicate)
description: Khartoum, Feb 22, 2011 (Sudan News Agency/All Africa Global Media via COMTEX) -- Sudan and China Monday signed at the Ministry of Finance and National Economy two agreements of 160 million Chinese Yuan, in presence of Minister of Finance and National Economy, Ali Mahmoud, and the Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of China. Zhai Jun, Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs.The first agreement, amounting to 100 Million Chinese Yuan, is a gift from China for implemenattion of humanitarian aid projects in Darfur states as well reconstruction in eastern Sudan and projects of economic and technical cooperation between the two countries.The second agreement, amounting to 60 Million Chinese Yuan, as an interest-free loan that would be allocated for economic and technical projects.The agreements were signed by the acting Undersecretary of the Ministry of Finance and National Economy, Mustafa Hawli, while the Chinese Ambassador to Sudan, Li Chengwen.The Undersecretary commended in his address on the occasion the great cooperation and assistance that China extended to Sudan in the past decades.He expressed Sudan determination to strengthen its financial and economic relations toward enhancing the standards of living in Sudan as well as realization of the strategic goals.The Chinese Ambassador to Sudan, Li Chengwen, expressed his pleasure on the presence of the Chinese Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs in the signing ceremony of the two agreements, a matter which was apparent message that the relations of friendship linking China and Sudan will be retained and consolidated. Document AFNWS00020110222e72m000pe
sector: Humanitarian and Disaster Relief and Preparation

title: China offers simple, cheap belt maker (Not a project)
description: China Offers Simple, Cheap Belt Maker. 240 words 6 April 2001 07:27 PM All Africa AFNWS English (c) Distributed via COMTEX News. Kampala, Apr 06, 2001 (New Vision/All Africa Global Media via COMTEX)-Small and big scale industries making belts, are to benefit from Chinese simple and cheap technology that can boost output, and become more marketable. The technology involves an embossing machine used for cutting and design. Previously, local man'facturers used to design their products manually by banging, which is tedious and not cost effective. However, the embossing machine from China, is able to cut and design between 100 to 150 belts per hour. The Uganda's Ambassador to China, Phillip Idro, who introduced the technology, said China unlike Uganda depends mainly on the smallscale industries. He said in China, a total of 150 million people are in this sector. He said this constitutes 30% of the government's tax returns. Idro said there is need for small scale industries to integrate for the efficient utilisation of resources. 'The concept of industrialisation must be improved. If we need to industrialise we must pay attention. My aim is to improve on the industrialisation and I am looking at both small and big entrepreneurs,' he said. Idro was briefing journalists at the Training and Common Facility (TCFC) in industrial area recently. TCFC was set up with support from the Trade ministry, Austrian government and UNIDO. by Joseph Olanyo Copyright New Vision. Distributed by All Africa Global Media(AllAfrica.com)

title: Expansion of Lira spinning mills (Duplicate)
description: CHINA financiers are to inject $13m into Lira Spinning Mills by the end of this year to increase the firm's production capacity, representatives of the company told the Vice- President last week.Capitol Group and Lira Spinning Mills representatives visited Prof. Gilbert Bukenya at Ntinda to update him on the progress of the Lira factory and the cotton trade between Uganda and China. Capitol Group are international partners of Jinda International Textiles Corp., the firm which took over Lira Spinning Mills. Bukenya thanked the Chinese for investing in Uganda and asked them to help Uganda produce finished fabrics rather than unfinished ones like lint. 'I want Uganda to produce cloth like the one you are wearing rather than just lint. You can help us turn this country into a weaving centre for East, Central and Southern Africa. That way, farmers will grow more cotton and earn more money,' he said. 'We are currently buying fabric in order to use our quota under the Africa Growth and Opportunities Act. We want as many investors as possible to make fabric in Uganda. The Government will support Lira Spinning Mills to achieve this,' he said. Jinda's chief executive officer Jing Hong said the firm had exported cotton worth $8.7m in the last season, but expected to increase exports to $17m in 2004/2005.
donor_agency: Jinda International Textiles Corp, Private Sector
recipient_agencies: Jinda International Textiles Corp, Private Sector

title: Loan to boost high-speed internet infrastructure (Duplicate)
description: China gives Uganda 120m-dollar loan to boost high-speed internet infrastructure 162 words 7 November 2006 11:57 PM BBC Monitoring Africa BBCAP English (c) 2006 The British Broadcasting Corporation. All Rights Reserved. No material may be reproduced except with the express permission of The British Broadcasting Corporation. Text of report by David Muwanga entitled 'China to give 120m dollars loan for IT facilities' published by Ugandan newspaper The New Vision website on 8 November China will give Uganda a 120m-dollar (219.6bn shillings) loan for development of the national broadband [high-speed internet] infrastructure, the information and communications technology (ICT) state minister has said. 'The government is doing everything possible to ensure that ICTs are aggressively promoted and enabled to play an important role in national development. That is why we are getting a 120m dollars loan for establishment of a broadband network that will result into provision of faster telecommunication services at cheaper rates,' Alintuma Nsambu said. Nsambu said while opening a workshop at Serena Kampala Hotel that Uganda still experiences challenges related to the high costs of bandwidth using fibre optic cable. Source: The New Vision website, Kampala, in English 8 No 06

title: Chinese Traditional Medicine practicioners in Tunisia (Duplicate of 14020)
description: MEDICAL TEAMS WILL CONTINUE TO OFFER HELP  By Zhang Feng  551 words2 November 2006China DailyCHNDLYEnglishCopyright 2006 China Daily Information Company. All rights reserved.  China will continue to improve healthcare services in African countries by sending medical teams.  The country will continue to enhance medical services co-operation with African countries, send medical teams to countries in need, strengthen prevention and control of major infectious diseases including malaria, and train local talent, said Mao Qun'an, spokesman of the Ministry of Health.  Speaking at a press conference last month, Mao said since the Forum on China-Africa Co-operation was launched in 2000, China has made great efforts to train African doctors in traditional medicine, clinical medicine, disease prevention and control, and management of rural medical services.  Among all aspects of co-operation, medical teams have been a highlight, officials said.  According to statistics from the Ministry of Health, from April 1963 to the end of 2005, China had sent 15,000 people in medical teams to 47 African countries, offering 170 million treatments.  Currently, at least 950 doctors and nurses from different regions of the country are working in 36 African countries, Mao said.  'Chinese doctors have been welcomed by local residents. More than 600 doctors have been awarded various nation-level medals by local governments,' Mao said.  The first Chinese medical team was sent to Algeria in 1963, and it was seen off by then Premier Zhou Enlai.  Medical aid for African countries is different from other forms of economic support, said Li Wanshan, a senior official from the International Co-operation Department of the Ministry of Health.  Medical teams are jointly organized by the two sides. The teams mainly provide free services, funded by the Chinese Government.  These doctors must be good at medical treatment and foreign languages, Li said.  Generally, they work for at least two years. And the hospitals or clinics where they work almost all have poor medical equipment and a small number of doctors, and are unable to meet medical demand.  There are nearly 100 doctors of Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) in Africa, offering treatments such as acupuncture.  By the middle of this October, Chinese acupuncturists in Tunisian capital Tunis had treated at least 20,000 patients over the past two years, Xinhua News Agency reported.  Acupuncture can help treat stroke sufferers for a much lower cost than western medicine, experts say.  In Tanzania, TCM has been used by Chinese medical teams for 19 years to treat 10,000 HIV/AIDS patients.  Compared with Western medicines that are usually too expensive for African people, TCM is much cheaper and sometimes more effective in treating certain diseases, said Fang Shuting, deputy director of the State Administration of TCM.  Nearly 1,000 African students have come to China to learn TCM since the 1960s.  In Africa, Chinese doctors often have to deal with diseases that have virtually disappeared in China.  For example, doctors have to treat many patients with rupture of the uterus, which is hardly seen in China nowadays, said Zhang Fengru, a Chinese doctor who worked in Morocco.  Since 1975, China has sent 109 medical teams with 1,200 doctors to Morocco. Currently, 121 Chinese doctors are working there.  On April 25, 2006, President Hu Jintao met doctors there as he visited the country and encouraged them to work harder for African people.  (Copyright 2006 by China Daily)  Document CHNDLY0020061101e2b20000d

title: Investment in car assembly plant (Not a Project yet)
description: 8 (East African Business Week/All Africa Global Media via COMTEX) -- Walusimbis's Garage, one of the oldest car dealerships in Uganda is planning a partnership with aChinese firm in which a car assembling and selling plant will be established in Uganda.'The plan is to demystify vehicle ownership and it is to mainly promote ownership of new vehicles that have little environmental side effects,' said Mr. Isaac Kyazze, sales and marketing manager at Walusimbi's Garage recently.Walusimbi's management is targeting a first batch of 200 units of saloon cars.Each car will cost between US$12,000 to $16,000. This means, at a unit cost averaging $14,000, theinvestment ranges anywhere upto $3.2million (Ush5.44 billion).One distinct feature of these cars is the 50,000 kilometers warranty and the pre-installed alarms.The warranty ensures that any buyer is free to access the services of the dealers for as long as they are still within the 50,000 kilometre range.Officials at Walusimbi's garage are tight lipped about the identity of the Chinese car partners, who are expected in the country in a few weeks,Kyazze says they are targeting government institutions which include ministries, commissions, parastatals and Non Governmental Organisations. 'We hope by May 2008, we shall get the first batch of these vehicles. We have samples already in town which have touched the ground,' said Kyazze.A comprehensive launch has been delayed because the company is looking at sustainability, technical conditions, compliance to African specifications, fuel consumption in litres, vehicle affordability, spares, after sales service requirements, training of personnel, and promotional strategy among others.Walusimbis's garage is planning to sweep the entire East African market with these brand new cars.According to the officials, because the cars will have similar technology to the Toyota brand, servicing of the China car will be possible in garages that service Toyota vehicles.Document AFNWS00020080324e43o0017r
donor_agency_count: Walusimbi's Garage Ltd., Private Sector
verified: Walusimbi's Garage Ltd., Private Sector

title: Phase One Health Project
description: (PPIAF) Previous description: Oil-backed loan to repair damaged infrastructure, mainly railway tracks bombed in the country's civil war. The money will also lay roads and electrify slum areas of the capital, Luanda, and also fund rehabilitation of the water supply systems Updated description: On March 2, 2004 the first Credit Accord with the Eximbank of China was signed for a financial package of two billion US Dollars and meant for the financing of projects of Angola's public investment. The first package was implemented in two different phases, with each taking one billion US Dollars. The first phase involved 27 contracts, corresponding to 50 projects, of which 21 have been completed. These projects focused on areas of electricity, water, health, education, public works, each of which taking about 20 percent of the total amount released.The second phase included 13 contracts and 52 projects that are underway. These contracts are in the areas of telecommunications, fisheries, health, education and public works.A contract is near approval to complete the second phase. The contract is called EDEL III, plus another two in final stage of negotiation, also in the sector of electricity and waters.The balance at the end of September 2007, according to the Finance Ministry, is of Usd 7.1 million, of which Usd 1.6 million are for the first phase of the financing and Usd 5.4 million for the second phase.The total amount disbursed until the end of September is Usd 932.9 million, being 733.1 million for the first phase and 199.8 for the second phase.As a result of the positive evaluation made by the two parties concerning the first package of two billion US Dollars, a memorandum of understanding was signed on June 20, 2006, between the Angolan Finance Ministry and China's Eximbank, for the granting of a new financing of the same amount.; Contractor Comment: Tied to the loan, is the agreement that the public tenders for the construction and civil engineering contracts will be awarded primarily to Chinese state-owned enterprises approved by the Chinese government. Exim Bank has compiled a list of 3; Political/Resource Considerations: Oil (China was to receive 10,000 barrels of oil per day. Sinopec wins a license for a large oil-production block previously held by Total of France. Sinopec then formed a joint venture to bid on other oilfields in Angola.); Chinese Commitment: USD 30 Million; PPIAF-ID:15
donor_agency: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
