title: U. of Ghana: Longdistance Education Project Funded by Chinese [review 1882]
description: Legon ICT-Based Distance Education Project Launchedby Roberta Ollenu500 words11 December 200901:05 PMAll AfricaAFNWSEnglish(c) 2009 AllAfrica, All Rights ReservedDec 11, 2009 (Public Agenda/All Africa Global Media via COMTEX) -- The University Of Ghana, Legon on Tuesday launched an ICT- based distance education project to serve as an e-learning hub for distance education students within and outside Ghana who enroll at the University.Its purpose is to improve the quality of teaching, learning and increase access to the university programmes by transforming existing print-mode distance education programme of the university to an ICT-based version. It is also to develop a suitable and modern ICT (hardware, software, networking) and make learning easier for students of the University.Minister of Education(MOE), Hon. Alex Tettey Enyo, noted that against the backdrop of the fact as many as 40% of students who qualify do not gain admission into the university, it was gratifying that the university was pursuing the ICT-based distance education project to support governments efforts in increasing access and quality in tertiary education.'It is indeed a global challenge to make higher education widely accessible and cost-effective, while maintaining quality in the face of the growing demand,' he addedHon. Tettey-Enyo said that it was government's desire that through the deployment of the ICT in education, the culture and practice of traditional memory-based learning will be transformed into education that stimulates thinking and creativity necessary to meet the challenges of the 21st Century.He explained that developing countries have shown that these technologies have an enormous potential for knowledge dissemination, knowledge acquisition, effective learning and the development of more efficient education services.He said the overall policy goal for integrating ICT into education was to enable graduates from Ghanaian educational institutions, formal and non-formal to confidently and creatively use ICT tools and resources to develop the requisite skills and knowledge needed to be active participants in the global knowledge economy by 2015.He said the MOE was working towards providing a common network platform for an e-education infrastructure which will provide facilities for the internet services to be put in place for the use of all institutions.The Chinese Ambassador to Ghana, H.E Wenzhe YU, disclosed that the Chinese government is supporting the project with a concessional loan of US $8.5 million and that the implementing institution Tsinghua Unispendor Corporation Ltd of Tsinghua University is also from China.He said the project was in line with some of the decisions made by China at the recent Forum on China-Africa in Egypt last month, which included the expansion its training and scholarship programmes to Africa.Ambassador Wenzu YU added that with an enhanced commitment to electronic education, greater and better teaching and learning opportunities would be opened to lift the fortunes of Ghana's educational system to a new and higher pedestal.He urged all Ghanaians to embrace and support the project because it will positively impact on human resource development and for that matter country as whole.Document AFNWS00020091211e5cb001bi清华紫光与加纳大学的远程教育项目正式启动2009-12-09 17:14  文章来源：驻加纳使馆经商参处文章类型：原创  内容分类：新闻十二月八日上午，清华紫光公司利用中国政府优惠买方信贷为加纳大学实施的远程教育项目在加纳大学非洲湿地中心正式启动。加纳教育部部长、加纳大学副校长、我驻加使馆于文哲大使、胡玉杰参赞、清华紫光公司代表以及加纳大学院系主任、来宾和新闻媒体等100多人出席启动仪式。  在启动仪式上，加纳大学副校长、清华紫光公司领导、我驻加大使和加纳教育部长分别致辞，强调远程教育对加纳教育、社会和经济发展的作用，并对加纳大学远程教育项目的启动表示祝贺。加教育部长亚历克斯•特泰•恩尼奥在致辞中代表米尔斯总统和加纳政府对中国政府提供优惠买方信贷支持加纳发展远程教育项目表示感谢。他说，在加纳有资格接受高等教育的人口中，约有40%的人没有进入大学就学。远程教育不仅给他们提供了高等教育的机会，而且能够有效减少在校学生的学习费用。此外，远程教育还能增加大学的经济收入，有效地改善师生比例。他承诺，加纳政府将一如既往地给予远程教育项目更大的支持。  于文哲大使在致辞中说，教育是一个民族发展进步的基础。他援引米尔斯总统的讲话“接受优质教育是所有人的权利，而不是个别人的特权”，表示远程教育将有助于实现加纳高等教育的发展目标。于大使回顾了中加建交50多年来的传统友谊，简要介绍了中非合作论坛北京峰会以来中加合作成就，包括正在加纳大学工作的我国青年志愿者。于大使称，在上月举行的中非合作论坛第四次部长级会议上，中国政府决定进一步增加对非洲国家的援外培训项目，该决定将有助于加强加纳政府能力建设，进一步增进两国人民之间的了解。

The company's estimated worth was between $35 million and $100 million USD.

title: China to Construct an Office Complex in Ghana
description: According to the letter, in accordance with the practices of implementing bilateral-aid projects between China and Ghana, the Chinese side would design on the basis of the proposed drawing by the Ghanaian side, the working drawings, pursuant to Chinese standards.Speaking in an interview earlier in Accra, Dr Addo-Kufuor said the current building housing the Ministry was small and also located in the heart of a Military installation thereby making it unattractive for civilians. He said this was also because of the sensitivity of the Military Headquarters.The Minister also said he was of the view that it was not necessary to put up offices to house the Ministry at one particular place. He said in view of this situation, a meeting was held between the Military High Command and the Ministry and an agreement was reached to put up a modest office complex outside the Military Headquarters.He said on one of his working visits to China, he discussed the idea with the Chinese who welcomed it and decided to support the Ministry in the venture.Document LQAF000020041114e0bc0004x '中国援加纳办公楼项目设计合同于5月6日在加纳首都阿克拉正式签订。加纳国防部部长克梅瓦.阿多-库福尔和中国北京建筑设计研究院代表张子军分别在设计合同上签字。　　新建加纳国防部办公楼约7600平方米，地上四层，为欧式古典建筑形式。项目建成后将为加纳国防部提供现代化的办公条件。　　（信息来源：中国对外承包工程商会子站）' '中国援加纳国防部办公楼项目施工合同于2006年10月20日在加纳首都阿克拉正式签订。加纳国防部大司长凡克林.奥富苏-阿派和中国青岛建设集团副总经理王振华分别在施工合同上签字。新建加纳国防部办公楼约7600平方米，地上四层，为欧式古典建筑形式。项目建成后将为加纳国防部提供现代化的办公条件。整个项目建设工期为14个月。 '

title: Cultural and sporting projects
description: In a state-visit on January 12, 2006, China's foreign minister Li Zhaoxing announced that China would finance cultural and sporting programs. Although no updated status can be found for this commitment, it probably refers at least in part to ID#1702 the construction of a National Theater.

title: Medical and agricultural cooperation restored (Duplicate of 1615, 1759...)
description: DAKAR, Jan 12 (Reuters) - China's foreign minister visited Senegal on Thursday, cementing recently restored ties as part of a tour of six African countries aimed at increasing Beijing's diplomatic and economic clout on the continent.Senegal, the latest African nation to be wooed by China, resumed diplomatic relations in October after a 10-year break by switching allegiance from Taiwan to the mainland.Li Zhaoxing, the first high-level Chinese visitor to Senegal since the rapprochement, signed a 30 million yuan ($3.72 million) donation with his Senegalese counterpart Cheikh Tidiane Gadio.China also gave $200,000 for flood victims after the West African state's worst rains in decades damaged thousands of homes in September, forcing many to sleep on the streets of the capital Dakar.'China will remain a loyal friend to Senegal,' Li told reporters.His tour comes as Beijing tries to convert diplomatic goodwill in Africa into concrete trade and investment agreements. Li leaves Senegal on Friday to visit Mali, Liberia and major oil producers Nigeria and Libya.China already gets a third of its oil from Africa and is seeking to secure new supplies of energy and raw materials to fuel its fast-growing economy.Last week, China's top offshore oil producer, CNOOC Ltd., agreed to pay $2.3 billion for a stake in a Nigerian oil and gas field, its largest ever overseas acquisition.Li said he did not plan to sign any fresh energy deals during his trip but he stressed the sector's importance for China's relations with Africa.'My main purpose is to enhance understanding, mutual trust and to accelerate, further encourage, mutually beneficial cooperation in all possible fields,' he told reporters. 'Energy is part and parcel of overall cooperation with so many African countries.''A BIG DAY'Senegal's Gadio said China had cancelled $20 million in debt and would finance cultural and sporting projects in the African country. Medical and agricultural cooperation would also be restored, he added.'This is a big day for relations between China and Senegal,' Gadio told reporters.Li's Africa tour began in Cape Verde on Wednesday, where he signed a cooperation accord, including a 2 million euro interest-free loan for medical projects, the local Inforpress news agency reported.Negotiations were also opened on other Chinese investment projects to construct a national sports stadium, a dam, and ceramic and fisheries facilities on the arid archipelago off Africa's west coast, Inforpress said.China has steadily built up its influence in the world's poorest continent since the 1960s and 1970s when it offered its support to newly independent African states and threw its weight behind independence movements.Beijing says it offers economic aid and cooperation 'without strings', in contrast to Western states which demand pledges from poor African countries to fight corruption and improve human rights.Critics say the Chinese approach undermines international efforts to introduce good governance reforms in Africa.  新华网北京１月５日电（记者孙侠）外交部发言人秦刚５日在这里宣布，外交部长李肇星将于１１日至１９日对佛得角共和国、塞内加尔共和国、马里共和国、利比里亚共和国、尼日利亚联邦共和国和大阿拉伯利比亚人民社会主义民众国六国进行正式访问。    秦刚强调，中国和非洲的传统友谊是建立在相互尊重主权和领土完整基础之上的。在发展中非互利合作方面，中方一直持积极态度。     秦刚说，中国愿意同非洲国家通过双边渠道以及中非合作论坛这一多边平台来深化在各领域的合作，包括在能源领域的合作。这符合双方利益，也有利于促进非洲国家的共同发展。     秦刚指出，尊重中国的主权和领土完整，承认一个中国原则是中国和世界上所有国家建立外交关系的一个重要政治前提。中国和非洲国家正是在这一基础之上发展了传统的友好合作关系。     中非关系的发展、友好合作关系的深化符合当今时代“求和平、促合作、谋发展”的潮流，相信中非传统友好合作关系还会在一个中国原则基础上不断深入发展，这是大势所趋，秦刚说。     李肇星是应佛得角外交、合作和侨务部长维克托·博尔热斯、塞内加尔外交国务部长蒂迪亚内·加迪奥、马里外交和国际合作部长莫克塔·瓦内、利比里亚全国过渡政府外交部长托马斯·尼梅利、尼日利亚外交部长奥卢耶米·阿德尼吉以及利比亚对外联络和国际合作总人民委员会秘书阿卜杜勒－拉赫曼·穆罕默德·沙勒加姆的邀请对上述六国进行访问的。（完）

title: Two 125 MW turbines from China Metallurgical Group (Duplicate of 244)
description: The China Metallurgical Group last week penned an agreement with the Senegalese government to build a power plant equipped with two turbines generating 125 MW apiece. In return, the Chinese group will be offered special access to iron ore mined in Senegal by state-owned Societe des Mines de Fer du Senegal Oriental (Miferso). China Metallurgical has a similar arrangement in next-door Mauritania where it is building a new airport at Nouakchott. The deal with China Metallurgical came as Senegal found itself confronted with an ever-increasing number of power cuts and growing difficulty in finding fuel for its power plants. The government has been at odds for months with Societe Africane de Raffinage, operated by Total, which is demanding payment for past deliveries and refuses to supply the country’s power plants until Dakar agrees to pay its debt.Last year the government signed an accord to buy electricity from Kounoune Power, a company set up by Matelec, an affiliate of Lebanon’s Doumet group, and Mitsubishi Equipment. With funding from the World Bank and the International Finance Corp., the two firms are going to construct a 67 MW private power plant at Kounoune. However, relief for the hard-pressed power sector won’t be immediate because the station will be commissioned only next year. Senegal’s agreement with China Metallurgical put the seal to Dakar’s switch in allegiance between Taiwan and Beijing. Senegal had long been Taipei’s leading ally in Africa but decided last August to turn its back on Taiwan and instead recognize mainland China.

recipient_agencies: China Metallurgical Group Corporation, State-Owned Company

title: Not a project: AIDS medication factory request
description: Apparently moved by the havoc being wreaked on women and the youth by the Human Immuno-Deficiency Virus (HIV)/Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome (AIDS), the Director-General of the National Agency for Food and Drug Administration and Control (NAFDAC), Dr Dora Akunyili, has started wooing one of China's biggest pharmaceutical companies to invest in the production of anti-retroviral drugs in the country.Tianjin Tianshi Pharmaceutical Company, the sixth largest company quoted on the China Stock Exchange, is being lobbied by Akunyili to establish a factory in Nigeria for the production of anti-retroviral drugs and other life-saving medicines.The director-general told the visiting president of the pharmaceutical company, Mr Li Jin Yuan, that Nigeria had qualified, energetic, loyal, hardworking and abundant labour readily available to ensure that such a pharmaceutical company flourished.She observed that the willingness of Yuan to set up a manufacturing company in the country was a practical demonstration of its desire to forge genuine partnership with Nigeria rather than using her as a mere trade outpost.The NAFDAC chief assured the Chinese firm that the federal government would readily support its proposed plan to also invest in the energy sector of the economy.According to her, the agency would offer free technical and consultancy services to the company whenever the project takes off because many Nigerians will be gainfully employed and the economy will receive a further boost.She commended Tianshi Company for its record of good quality products, while urging the visiting president of the establishment to ensure that all drugs imported into the country from China are truly certified.But Liberi said that to ensure the success of the programme and show mark of commitment on the part of the US government to control the spread of the virus. The plan had the US ambassador to Nigeria, John Campbell, and the minister of health, Prof. Eyitayo Lambo, as national coordinators while the Centre for Disease Control and Prevention, Department of Defence, National Institutes of Health and the Public Affairs Section of the United States Embassy are the coordinating partners.Earlier, Yuan disclosed that there were 200,000 distributors of Tianshi products in the country, while efforts were being expedited to increase the number to 500,000 by next year.He said the Tianshi International Convention would come up next year in Malaysia with globally renowned pharmaceutical companies and political leaders in attendance.But he said that 16 BMW cars had already been earmarked to be given to reward loyal distributors of Tianshi products all over the country.Source: The Guardian web site, Lagos, in English 30 No 04 '
donor_agency: Tianjin Tianshi Biological Development Co., Ltd., Private Sector
recipient_agencies: Tianjin Tianshi Biological Development Co., Ltd., Private Sector

title: NOT bilateral (UN): Agriculture Experts and Techs
description: In 2005, the Chinese government sent 393 agriculture experts to provide assistance to farming communities in Nigeria. Within the frame work of the south-south cooperation between Nigeria and that of China under the National Special Program for Food Security (NSPFS), Salisu Ingawa, project coordinator of Nigeria's National Special Program for Food Security (NSPFS), said, 'there are 393 Chinese experts and technicians in agriculture and related disciplines working directly with farmers in farming communities in 109 NSPFS sites Nationwide.'See ID# 1985

title: Chinese Peacekeeping Squad Leaves for Liberia (Inactive: see #1552)
description: Text of report in English by official Chinese news agency Xinhua (New China News Agency)[Xinhua: 'Chinese Peacekeeping Squad Leaves for Liberia']Beijing, June 13 (Xinhua) - A Chinese police squad left Beijing early Sunday for Liberia to join the United Nations peacekeeping mission in the west African country.The 18-member squad included staff from the criminal investigation, public security, traffic control and special police departments of Zhejiang Province in east China.Two out of the 18 police personnel had previously participated in United Nations peacekeeping missions.With an average age of about 30, they form China's ninth police squad to Liberia, and will replace personnel from central China's Hubei Province, who are expected to return to China on June 16.According to the Ministry of Public Security, China has sent 1,615 police for UN peacekeeping missions to East Timor, Bosnia and Hercegovina, Kosovo, Liberia, Afghanistan, Haiti and Sudan since January 2000.Source: Xinhua news agency, Beijing, in English 0230 gmt 13 Jun 10
sector: Humanitarian and Disaster Relief and Preparation

title: Kiwira Coal Mine (Duplicate of 1906)
description: China will invest $400 million in Tanzania's Kiwira coal mine project estimated to generate 200 megawatts of electricity, Energy and Mines minister William Ngeleja said.The money comes under a soft loan arrangement, a newspaper reported.Five groups, including the state-run National Social Security Fund, applied to run the project, before the government accepted China's offer, it said.China Daily Information Company

title: 275 Chinese peacekeeping troops (Inactive: see #1552)
description: BEIJING, Dec. 16 (Xinhua) -- A 275-strong squad of Chinese troops left Beijing Thursday aboard a chartered plane for Liberia to join the United Nations-mandated peacekeeping mission in the west African country.Another 283 Chinese peacekeeping troops will leave for the country on Dec. 27.Totalling 558, they will be the 11th contingent of Chinese peacekeeping troops to Liberia and will assume a 8-month-long mission.Among them, a team of 275 troops will be responsible for construction of roads, bridges and bunkers, repair and renovation of houses and airports, and building and maintenance of water and electricity supply facilities in Liberia.Another 240 will aid in transportation of personnel and materials and 43 more will offer medical treatment and epidemic prevention services.Under the UN Security Council Resolution 1509, China started dispatching peacekeepers to Liberia from December 2003 and so far has sent a total of 5,580 peacekeepers to the country.Enditem
sector: Humanitarian and Disaster Relief and Preparation

title: China provides loan to Ghana for transmission project
description: In 2006, Ghana signed a deal with the Chinese government for a soft loan worth $31 million USD for the construction of a national high-tech transmission backbone infrastructure. The fiber optic network will cover the whole country providing more durable and efficient common bandwidth for all communication service providers. The fiber optics will be linked with Kumasi and further to the north, subsequently connecting Accra. Ghanaian Minister of Communications Albert Kan Dapaah and VP of China's Eximbank met to agree on the deal. Deputy Minister of Communication in Ghana Dr. Benjamin Aggrey Ntim was also familiar with the project. According to reports, the construction of the project started in 2006 by Chinese company Huawei Technologies, while Eximbank made available $31 million USD towards the project. As of 2011, the project was still under construction. The project was untied.

title: Ghana facilitates a loan  to expand facilities for Ghana Telecom （Duplicate）
description: Chinese premier loans Ghana US$66 million for projectsBy KWASI KPODOAssociated Press Writer383 words18 June 200604:52 PMAssociated Press NewswiresAPRSEnglish(c) 2006. The Associated Press. All Rights Reserved.ACCRA, Ghana (AP) - China's premier on Sunday committed to lend about US$66 million (euro52 million) to Ghana to fund a telecommunications upgrades and other projects in the west African nation.China, the world's fastest growing economy and most populous nation, has spent the last few decades building relationships and trade throughout Africa -- regularly conducting state visits and financing infrastructure projects in resource-rich markets that the West has been slower to embrace for reasons ranging from small profit margins to bureaucratic hurdles.Premier Wen Jiabao and Ghanian President John Kufuor agreed to a low-interest loan of about US$66 million (euro52 million) for a number of projects, including a plan to upgrade Ghana's communications network by increasing phone lines and improving the country's Internet-access. The plan also includes training students and workers in communications technology, finance minister Kwadwo Baah-Wiredu said after the meeting.'This will help a great deal to expand employment opportunities in Ghana,' Baah-Wiredu said. 'And we are very grateful to the Chinese.'Baah-Wiredu noted that Ghana has backed Beijing's 'one-China' policy and refused to recognize Taiwan as an independent country.The money is also going toward programs to send Chinese doctors and medical workers to Ghana.Ghana also agreed to help facilitate a loan from a private communication company in China to expand facilities for Ghana Telecom, part of growing business ties between the countries. Trade between Ghana and China totaled US$769 million in 2005, up from US$76 million 10 years earlier, according to Chinese state media. Ghana has had diplomatic relations with China since 1960.Wen is on a tour of seven African nations that started in Egypt and will also take him to Republic of Congo, Angola, South Africa, Tanzania and Uganda. He is expected to sign energy agreements with some countries, though China has not provided more details on what these will entail. Ghana's Baah-Wiredu said a dam funding project that some had expected to see signed by Wen and Kufuor Sunday will not be considered until November to allow technical details to be worked out.Wen leaves Ghana on Monday for Republic of Congo.7Document APRS000020060618e26i002nx
donor_agency: Unknown
donor_agency_count: Vodafone Ghana (Ghana Telecom), Private Sector
verified: Vodafone Ghana (Ghana Telecom), Private Sector

title: Chinese prime minister helps open up road project in Ghana (Update)
description: Accra, 19 June: Visiting Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao and Ghanaian President John Agyekum Kufuor co-inaugurated Monday [19 June] a road between Ofankor and Nsawan, a portion of the trunk road linking Ghana's capital Accra and the west African country's second biggest city Kumasi.'The road symbolizes the cooperation between China and Ghana and constitutes a new link between the two countries that have forged traditional friendship,' said Wen, who arrived in Ghana Sunday for a two-day official visit.Kufuor praised the quality of the road and speed of the construction, saying this project would make great contribution to Ghana's economic development.The road was 17.4 km long, with its start point at Ofankor, 20 km north of the capital city.The Chinese government granted Ghana 180m yuan (22.5m US dollars) interest-free loan for the highway rehabilitation and expansion project, undertaken by China Railway Wuju Group Corporation.The completed road is two-way with four lanes. Two lanes are newly constructed while the other two are reconstructed with new pavement of gravel base course and bituminous surface course.'The completion of this road will make driving become safe and fast,' said Norbert B. Quarmour, director of public affairs of Ghana Highway Authority, 'There were a lot of potholes on this road. There were only two lanes and no grass corridor.'Zeng Jian, a senior official of the Chinese company, described the road as a 'new friendship milestone' in the development of Sino-Ghananian relationship since the two countries established diplomatic ties in 1960.'Before the construction of the new road, China helped Ghana build several other public facilities, including the National Theatre, irrigation projects, a hospital, camps for soldiers and policemen.China has constructed nearly 900 projects in Africa as a whole over the past 50 years, covering various fields including agriculture, energy, infrastructure and water conservancy.Source: Xinhua news agency, Beijing, in English 1132 gmt 19 Jun 06
donor_agency_count: China Railway Wuju Group Corporation, State-Owned Company
recipient_agencies: China Railway Wuju Group Corporation, State-Owned Company

title: 16 doctor medical envoy (Duplicate of 1615)
description: DAKAR, April 17 (Xinhua) -- Senegal and China on Tuesday signed an agreement on the dispatch of a Chinese medical team to serve at a hospital in this capital. Senegalese Health Minister Abdou Fall and Chinese Ambassador Lu Shaye signed the cooperation accord on behalf of their respective governments. The Chinese medical team comprising 16 doctors is preparing to leave Beijing for Senegal to work for two years at a hospital in the suburbs of Dakar, Lu said at the signing ceremony. The agreement is part of the aid package to Africa announced by Chinese President Hu Jintao at last year's Beijing summit of the Forum on China-Africa Cooperation, according to the Chinese ambassador. The Senegalese minister hailed the agreement as a milestone in efforts by the two countries to strengthen medical cooperation. The Senegalese government will try its best to ensure cooperation with China in personnel training, medical study, as well as the treatment and control of chronic diseases, he said. China will also deliver 2 million yuan (256,410 U.S. dollars) worth of malaria medicines under a separate agreement signed on Tuesday by the Senegalese and Chinese officials.

title: 370 million yuan soft loan for power industry
description: In June of 2007, China signed a 370 million Yuan soft loan to Senegal to help the country salvage its struggling power industry. State power company Senelec has struggled because of under-investment, poor infrastructure, and lack of funding. This new funding will finance a 90 KV distribution network to increase capacity and reduce wastage in Dakar. State-owned engineering group China National Machinery and Equipment Import and Export Corporation will carry out the work. Chinese Ambassador to Senegal Lu Shaye signed the loan agreement. It is unclear what progress has been made on the project, but the project seems to be untied.
donor_agency_count: China Machinery Engineering Corporation (CMEC) ; Senelec, State-Owned Company
recipient_agencies: China Machinery Engineering Corporation (CMEC)
verified: Senelec, State-Owned Company

title: Seismic Project (Duplicate of 2388)
description: 'Chinese survey company BGP has kicked off a seismic shoot on the Tenere block in Niger, which is operated by its parent company China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC), writes Iain Esau.According to Calgary-based TG World Energy, the minority partner in Tenere, more than 288 kilometres of 2D data has been acquired since work started last month.Operations began by shooting a line through the vintage Fachi-1 well, a move designed to provide the partners with additional control over seismic data acquired in the 1970s, and also to tie-in to Fachi-1 well logs.The Fachi probe was thought to have been drilled on an uplifted ridge that separates two deep areas of the Tenere trough, which TG believes are the most prospective portions of the concession.BGP will acquire the full 1500 kilometres of 2D required to meet the permit's minimum work programme with operations targeting structures mapped by both TG and CNPC.The Canadian outfit said it has mapped 35 closed structures with independent analysis by CNPC identifying the same structures.The current 2D survey is expected to provide infill data on most of these prospects.CNPC has an 80% stake in the licence, with TG holding the remainder. '
donor_agency_count: China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC), State-Owned Company
recipient_agencies: China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC), State-Owned Company

title: 20 scholarships (Inactive: duplicate with ID: 1814)
description: APA-Monrovia (Liberia) The outgoing Chinese Ambassador to Liberia, Zhou Yuxiao has disclosed that China will this year offer 20 scholarships to deserving Liberians to pursue studies in several Chinese universities.Speaking at his farewell reception in the capital Monrovia Thursday night, Mr. Zhou also disclosed that the Chinese government was also preparing to build a large vocational training centre in the northern Paynesville suburb of Monrovia.'In the field of economics, China has become Liberia's largest trade partner and Liberia's export to China reached US$24.5 million in 2010,' the Chinese envoy pointed out, adding, 'the Shanghai construction will invest to build a five-star hotel near Monrovia soon'.He said his government has begun reconstruction work on a new health ministry, and that China was also prepared to send five technicians and train 25 medical and technical personnel in China as obligations under the Tripartite Memorandum of Understanding signed with the Liberian and Egyptian governments.In agriculture, he said, China completed the construction of an Agricultural Technology Demonstration Centre at the Central Agricultural Research Institute in Bong County last year, adding, 'as for infrastructure, Chinese companies like CHICO and CICO have been actively engaged in Liberia's road and bridge constructions. I am pleased to let you know that a technical survey team is scheduled to arrive Friday to conduct feasibility studies for the construction of a ministerial complex to be built with Chinese aid if suitable land is provided.'China has also constructed a US$25 million campus for the state-run University of Liberia.

title: Bui Hydropower/Dam project
description: Ghana Signs Dam Agreement With Chinese Firm291 words19 April 200709:19 PMDow Jones International NewsDJIEnglish(c) 2007 Dow Jones   Company, Inc.ACCRA, Ghana (Dow Jones)--The Ghanaian government Thursday signed an engineering and procurement contract with Sinohydro of China to begin construction of a 400 megawatt dam in the West African country.EximBank of China is providing Ghana with a loan for the project, estimated to cost $600 million.Ghana's Energy Minister, Joseph Kofi Adda, who signed the agreement, together with style='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFF00'>Sinohydro Chairman Fan Juxiang, said the project was crucial to augment the country's power production, which is currently in crisis.Ghana's power shortfall has deepened since August last year, resulting in a national load shedding which has hindered the operation of bulk power users including the mines.Authorities have blamed the current power crisis on low levels of water in the major eastern Akosombo Dam due to unfavorable rainfall pattern.The proposed Dam project, to be constructed at Bui in the Brong Ahafo Region, some 550 km north of Accra, was identified in the early 1920s but had many times been shelved.Adda said additional benefits of the dam will be irrigation, fishing and tourism.'The project will also improve power supply in the northern regions and put Ghana in the position to supply power to neighboring countries within the framework of ECOWAS,' adding, 'it is a dream comes true for the people of Ghana.'Juxiang called for early settlement of financial arrangements to enable the project to begin in June of this year as anticipated.Construction will span over five years with cstyle='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFF00'>ompletion slated for February 2012, the Ghanaian officials and their Chinese counterparts say.Ghana's Parliament will have to ratify the agreement.-By Kwasi Kpodo, contributing to Dow Jones Newswires; +233 244 696990 [ 20-04-07 0119GMT ]Document DJI0000020070420e34k00021---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Ghana 622m-dollar hydropower dam project breaks ground343 words24 August 200712:01 PMBBC Monitoring AfricaBBCAPEnglish(c) 2007 The British Broadcasting Corporation. All Rights Reserved. No material may be reproduced except with the express permission of The British Broadcasting Corporation.Excerpt from report by state-owned Ghanaian GBC radio on 24 August[Presenter] The sod has been cut for the much awaited Bui [Hydro] Dam project to start. President Kufuor and the group president of Sino hydro Corporation, Fan Jixiang, performed the ceremony. The project was conceived in the 1920s.President Kufuor announced that the project is expected to be completed in early 2012 to help stabilize the country's energy sources. He said government's overall plan is to increase energy from 2,000 MW to 6,000 MW by 2016. President enumerates other benefits from Bui Hydro Dam project.[Kufuor] Government has succeeded in raising 622m dollars to implement this project. The amount is made up of a loan of 562m dollars from the Chinese government and 60m dollars from the Ghana government. The Bui project, has been many components besides the generating of power, there is a major irrigation scheme to facilitate all the year round farming in this area.Another component is the Bui National Park, which as a natural reserve, will promote eco tourism. Yet another significant aspect of the project is the creation of a major metropolis to be known as the Bui City, especially for our own facilities of a modern city.About 8,000 Ghanaians will be employed directly. Many indirect jobs will also be available. Our engineers, technicians, managers as well as both skilled and unskilled labour will take whole advantage of the project, especially the electro gene technology transfer to form the project that will enable us to execute similar projects on our own in the future.[Presenter] The group president of Sino hydro, Fan Jixiang, said they will work closely with their Ghanaian counterparts to make the Bui Dam a model project that would reflect the improved cooperation between Ghana and China. He hoped the project will offer lasting solution to challenges of a sustainable energy supply in the country. [Passage omitted].Source: Radio Ghana, Accra, in English 1300 gmt 24 Aug 07a6d3b620Document BBCAP00020070824e38o002s1---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Ghana: China approves 562m dollar loan for dam construction165 words11 August 200810:43 AMBBC Monitoring AfricaBBCAPEnglish(c) 2008 The British Broadcasting Corporation. All Rights Reserved. No material may be reproduced except with the express permission of The British Broadcasting Corporation.Excerpt from report by Nehemia Owusu Achiaw entitled 'China approves 562m dollars for Bui project' published by state-owned Ghanaian newspaper Daily Graphic on 11 AugustThe Chinese government has given approval for the release of 562m dollar loan to Ghana towards the construction of the Bui Dam in the Brong Ahafo Region.The Ghana government has already paid 60m dollars being its part of the financial obligation towards the realization of the project.This came to light when a delegation from Sino-hydro Corporation, the Chinese construction firm executing the project, paid a courtesy call on President J A Kufuor in Beijing last Friday [8 August].[Passage omitted].On completion, the Bui Dam is expected to generate 400 mega watts of hydro-electric power to complement the country's energy supplies, which, for many years, had depended on the Akosombo and Kpong dams. [Passage omitted].Source: Daily Graphic, Accra, in English 11 Aug 08a8a504d5Document BBCAP00020080811e48b001gt --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Ghana, China sign seven development agreements363 words4 September 200808:16 AMBBC Monitoring AfricaBBCAPEnglish(c) 2008 The British Broadcasting Corporation. All Rights Reserved. No material may be reproduced except with the express permission of The British Broadcasting Corporation.Text of report by state-owned Ghana Broadcasting Corporation (GBC) Radio 1 on 4 SeptemberPresident Kufuor this last night [3 September] witnessed the signing of seven agreements between Ghana and China. Ghana's Finance Minister Kwadwo Baah Wiredu and the Chinese deputy minister of commerce, Fu Ziying initialed for their countries.Two agreements worth 7.4m dollars technical cooperation were signed. The projects for which these will be used are yet to be decided by both governments. The third is a concessional loan framework agreement of 270m dollars for the Bui Hydro Power Dam project between the governments of Ghana and China.Another agreement worth 292m dollars was also signed for the same purpose but between the government of Ghana and the Exim Bank of China. This is the last phase of funding for the Bui Dam project. It was initiated last year [2007]. The government of Ghana is providing another component of 60m dollars. An agreement for eight point two million dollars for an ICT based distance learning programme at the University of Ghana was also signed.China is also providing Ghana 250,000 dollars for Anti Malaria Drugs. This is the second time in two years that the Chinese government is making such a donation. The Exim Bank of China also signed with the government another concessional loan agreement for the based distance learning project at the University of Ghana. President Kufuor said the signing of the agreements should be in the interest of the two nations noting that the funds put together are well over a billion dollars and this is very significant. He said such cooperation should be sustained.President Kufuor urged China to consider promoting trade in soya and palm oil. He said adding value in Ghana to soya and oil palm will promote growth and create employment for many Ghanaians. The Chinese deputy minister, Mr Fu Ziying observed that the signing of the seven agreements and exchange of letters have strengthened economic ties between the two countries. He hoped by these economic relations would have a brighter future.Source: Radio Ghana, Accra, in English 0600 gmt 4 Sep 08a8c48632Document BBCAP00020080904e494001p5-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------China and Ghana Sign Financing Deal for Bui HEPThomas Pearmain176 words26 September 2008Global Insight Daily AnalysisWDANEnglishCopyright 2008, Global Insight Limited. All Rights Reserved.China's SinoHydro, the developers behind the long-anticipated Bui dam in Ghana's Brong Ahafo region style='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFF00'>has signed a financing agreement with the government for the US$562 million project. style='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFF00'>African Energy reports that a concessional loan was agreed for US$270 million between the governments of Ghana and China while another agreement for US$292 million was signed between Ghana and the Export-Import Bank of China. Ghana will directly invest US$22 million in the facility.Significance: President John Agyekum Kufour launched construction of the Bui Dam on the Black Volta River at the end of September. Kufour has said that international environmental and social standards will be applied and that the relocation programme will draw on the lessons learnt from the building of the Akosombo and Kpong dams. The government hopes that the Bui dam will become a national tourism site and its construction process will provide employment for 2,900 Ghanaians. It is scheduled to be completed in five years.Document WDAN000020080926e49q00039-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Phase Two of Bui Hydro Project Takes Off398 words4 December 200808:08 AMAll AfricaAFNWSEnglish(c) 2008 AllAfrica, All Rights ReservedDec 04, 2008 (Accra Mail/All Africa Global Media via COMTEX) -- Phase Two of Bui Hydro Project to add 400 megawatts of electrical power to the country's generation mix has commenced.The Black Volta River was on Tuesday blocked to pave way for actual construction of the main dam and other structures including spillway, power intake and power house.Chinese Contractors, Sinohydro Corporation Limited is style='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFF00'>undertaking the US$622million project.The first phase, which involved the building of employee and contractor's camps, warehouse, workshop, installation of cracking plant and access road started in August 2007 and completed a month ago ahead of schedule.President Kufuor, who performed the ceremony, said the project would significantly help transform the economic and social lives of the people not only in the area but the nation as a whole.He said in addition to contributing to the energy security of the country, it had the potential of irrigating 30,000 hectares for agricultural development as well as ecotourism and fisheries.President Kufuor gave the assurance that adequate measures had been instituted to ensure protection of the environment.He said the Bui Hydro Authority (BHA), Forestry Commission and other stakeholders were collaborating to protect wildlife for ecological balance.President Kufuor suggested to BHA to erect a fitting monument at the dam site in memory of the late Mr. Kwadwo Baah Wiredu, former Minister of Finance and Economic Planning for the role he played towards commencement of the project.Mr. Felix Owusu Agyapong, Minister for Energy, said the project on completion would enhance power supply to Brong Ahafo, Northern, Upper East and West Regions and the West African Power pool.Mr. Yu Wenzhe, Chinese Ambassador to Ghana, said Bui which carries the dream of the government and nation was not only a landmark achievement by President Kufuor but also an important milestone of Ghana-China friendship and cooperation.He said China was committed to forging strategic partnership with Ghana based on mutual trust and economic win-win co-operation.In another development, President Kufuor had inaugurated an electrification project at Bamboi in the Northern Region.He said government had laid a solid foundation for accelerated economic take-off and asked the people to ensure that the country's march towards progress was sustained by retaining the ruling NPP government in power on December 7.Document AFNWS00020081204e4c4000pg

title: Technical Assistance (Inactive: see project #1830)
description: No 18, 2011 (Heritage/All Africa Global Media via COMTEX) -- The Governments of Liberia, the People's Republic of China and the United Nations Food and Agricultural Organization (FAO) have signed a South-South Cooperation (SSC) Tripartite Agreement valued at approximately US$1.2 million. The Agreement financed through the Chinese Trust Fund is aimed at contributing to the implementation of the National Programme for Food Security (NPFS) through its support to ongoing initiatives and projects in Liberia over a two-year period. On the basis of the expressed needs and objectives discussed with China, Liberia will receive technical assistance from 24 cooperants from the China, including five experts and 19 technicians.According to a Foreign Ministry release, Liberia's Ambassador Ad-Hoc to Italy, His Excellency Dr. Mohammed Sheriff signed on behalf of the Government of Liberia, while the Deputy Permanent Representative of China and Permanent Representative of China to the FAO, His Excellency Mr. Handi Guo signed for the People's Republic of China. The FAO Assistant Director-General, Mr. Thomas Laurent signed on behalf of his organization. The signing ceremony took place at the FAO Headquarters in Rome, Italy recently.Speaking during the brief ceremony, Liberia's Ambassador to Italy, Dr. Sheriff thanked the Chinese Government and the FAO for the assistance especially at a time the country is embarking on its reconstruction drive in line with its Poverty Reduction Strategy.Ambassador Sheriff highlighted President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf's drive towards empowering the people of Liberia to invest in agriculture, the bedrock of any nation. He said the assistance is timely and will go a long way contributing to whatever government has already begun in the sector.For his part, Deputy Permanent Representative of the People's Republic of China and Permanent Representative of China to the FAO, His Excellency Mr. Handi Guo pledged his country's support to Liberia in its development efforts. He said his country will not leave Liberia alone as it is a true partner and friend to China.FAO Assistant Director-General, Mr. Thomas Laurent promised to continue to partnership with Liberia. He said Liberia has become one of the strongest progressive countries in the West African sub-region and the FAO will continue to help Liberia in its reconstruction efforts.The SSC programmes aim to enhance solidarity among developing countries, allowing recipient countries to benefit from the experience of more advanced developing countries.The initiative was launched by FAO in 1996 within the framework of the Special Programme for Food Security (SPFS) and later extended to National and Regional Programmes for Food Security.Based on the specific development needs and the potential of the host countries, experts and technicians from the cooperating countries provide technical assistance to farming communities for a period of two to three years.Oer the last few years, the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO), World Food Programme (WFP), and other UN agencies and development partners have supported the development of the National Food Security and Nutrition Strategy (NFSNS) in Liberia.Under this national strategy, the Ministry of Agriculture subsequently established the Operation Eliminate Hunger (OpEH) to implement the agriculture components of the NPFS. In March 2008, the OpEH received initial support from FAO under the project -'Post emergency accelerated capacity building for Liberia's national food security programme Operation Eliminate Hunger 'Pulukpeh', and acted as the umbrella for the overall programme to further ensure support from donors to the NPFS.In January 2008, the Global Trust Fund for Food Security supported by the Government of Italy committed a total of US$2.2 million to assist smallholder farmers in Liberia to improve their livelihood skills, overcome production constraints and organize themselves to take advantage of market opportunities. The project was approved in February 2008 and is now operational.In line with this Agreement, between April-May 2010, a joint FAO/Government of China SSC formulation mission came to Liberia, to prepare the SSC programme and develop a draft of the Tripartite Agreement defining the respective responsibilities of China, Liberia and FAO.Project sites already earmarked in this Agreement are the Ministry of Agriculture; Songhai Center, Bensonville Youth Training Center; Tumutu Land Mine Action Training Center; Clay Fish Hatchery and Farmer Resource Center; and the Measuegoon Comprehensive Community Pilot Project.

title: China to buy cocoa directly from Ghana
description: In 2007, Ghana agreed to supply cocoa to China as part of a deal for Beijing to finance a new hydroelectric dam in the West African country. The company supplying the coca is Ghana's state-run coca market regulator Cocobod. The company is going to supply 38,000 tons: 30,000 main crop, 8,000 light crop.Beijing is funding the majority of the $600 million cost of building the Bui dam through preferential credit facilities.The dam, with an expected output of 400 MW, is part of an investment programme aimed at ending crippling power cuts that have hampered industry and forced mining companies in Africa's second biggest gold producer to install their own diesel generators to keep up production.COCOA-GHANA/CHINA (UPDATE 1)|LANGEN|ABN|C|SOF|AFN|GRO|MTLDocument LBA0000020070903e393000w加纳将每年向中国出售38000吨可可，以偿付布维电站贷款  据《加纳贸易和财经时报》报道，作为布维电站项目的还贷条款之一，自2007/2008可可季开始，加纳将每年向中国出售38000吨可可。400兆瓦布维水电站项目的总造价约6.22亿美元，其中加纳通过中国政府从中国进出口银行获得了5.62亿美元的优惠贷款，还款期30年。尽管有人担心如此长的还贷期可能使加纳为满足中国的要求而丧失或削弱部分主权，但加纳政界的多数人对加纳可可能够在国家经济发展中扮演如此重要的角色表示满意。国际期货市场上，加纳大宗可可的价格已由2007年初的每吨1625美元下跌至9月初的每吨1290美元。可可价格的暴跌始于1998年9月，至2000年11月时跌至每吨714美元，为27年以来的最低价。2002年7月，可可的平均价格达到每吨1730美元。2005/2006可可季，加纳可可的总产量为740458吨。其中出口中国16364吨，占2.21%。欧洲长期以来都是加纳可可的主要出口市场，所占份额达60%以上。而其他国家所占份额分别为，美国6.33%，加拿大1.36%，日本7.2%，其余部分由其他亚洲和阿拉伯国家分享。

title: comprehensive hospital (Duplicate)
description: 14 April 2008 08:06 AMAll Africa AFNWS English (c) 2008 AllAfrica, All Rights Reserved Kigali, Apr 14, 2008 (The New Times/All Africa Global Media via COMTEX) -- The Chinese Government has donated $50,000 (Frw27m) to help earthquake victims in the Western Province. According to sources in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the money will be handed over once the normal documentation procedure is complete.Sunday Times has learnt that the move came after a February meeting in which officials from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Prime Minister's Office, diplomats and international organizations discussed how to support the quake victims.'The only thing remaining is for the two sides to sign hand-over papers, which will be done after your Government has finalised the issue of banking account forms,' the Economic and Commercial Counsellor at the Chinese Embassy in Kigali, Mr. Yi Zonghua confirmed in an interview Thursday.At least 37 people died and over Frw5 billion worth of property destroyed when three earthquakes hit Nyamasheke and Rusizi districts in February.According to a Government report, 643 people were hospitalized as a result with 276 and 367 suffering from physical and psychological trauma, respectively.Three quarters of Bushenge hospital was destroyed while 212 classrooms (accommodating 6,289 children in primary school will have to be rebuilt. 113 need repair.1,201 households lost their shelter and 36 churches were damaged. Students from affected schools have been transferred to other schools, while about 4,000 plastic sheeting material and 1,201 family kits have been supplied.Tents were also supplied to the most seriously affected primary schools. While a detailed study is needed to assess the exact amount of emergency and rehabilitation costs, the Government report estimates close to Frw6.5 Billion as the amount needed for rehabilitation.The damaged schools in Rusizi District need about Frw1b while 93 primary schools in Nyamasheke District needed about Frw832m for repair and reconstruction.Secondary schools need about Frw1.6b while Frw1.4b is needed to rebuild the houses that were destroyed.The national Disaster Management Unit which operates under the Prime Minister's Office is coordinating relief efforts at the central level.It works closely with the Disaster Management Task Force (DMTF), composed of people from the central Government and its development partners.Other aid related projects by chinaAccording to Yi, China continues to assist Rwanda through several economic development projects.'Of course this donation is a very small matter but it is significant,' he pointed out adding, 'Besides that, we have a number of other projects in economic development. Some of them are still in the pipeline,' Yi said.He gave an example of the new building that will house the Ministry of Foreign Affairs which is under construction and would be completed in four months.China also continues to send medical doctors to Kibungo hospital since 1982. It has also promised to send about 10 youth volunteers to work in Rwanda - in cultural, industrial, agricultural and information technology fields.'We are now designing a project called 'polyclinic' for a comprehensive hospital in the suburb of Kigali,' the diplomat added.China has also provided grants to build two primary schools in the Eastern and Northern provinces, and will also help set up an agricultural technical demonstration centre in Huye District, Southern Province, he added.'A team of Chinese experts will come into the country for a detailed project study before the end of this month and the construction of the centre will get underway before end of the year,' Yi explained. He added that a new cooperation agreement between China and Rwanda would also be finalized soon.  20 August 2008 04:07 AMAll Africa AFNWS English (c) 2008 AllAfrica, All Rights Reserved Kigali, Aug 20, 2008 (The New Times/All Africa Global Media via COMTEX) -- An agreement on economic and technical cooperation between Rwanda and the Government of the People's Republic of China was signed at the Foreign Affairs Ministry yesterday afternoon.As a result, China will provide a grant of Renminbi 60m (over US$8 million) to finance an agricultural technology demonstration center and polyclinic projects in the country. Renminbi, whose principal unit is the yuan, is the currency of the People's Republic of China.'We are happy with the cooperation between our two countries and we appreciate and hope this is all going to build on the already good relationship,' Rosemary Museminali, Rwanda's Minister of Foreign Affairs and Cooperation said shortly after signing.Sun Shuzhong, China's Ambassador Extraordinary Plenipotentiary, also spoke well of the pact. He referred to the signing as an important component in the two countries' bilateral collaboration.Pointing to the forthcoming [October] senior officials meeting and ministerial meeting projected for next year, Shuzhong underscored the significance of a 'new phase of development.''China will try its best to define new areas of cooperation in the years to come. I hope all these efforts will help boost economic development in Rwanda and even further improve China-Rwanda relations,' he said.According to Museminali, the pact was in the framework of the Africa-China cooperation.Apart from potential market opportunities, China also largely benefits from Rwanda's support in different areas in the international forum, Museminali said while fielding reporters' questions.

title: Ghana signs telecoms loan with China Exim （Duplicate）
description: Ghana signs telecoms loan with China Exim115 words1 May 2008Trade FinanceTRAFINEnglishCopyright 2008 Euromoney Institutional Investor PLCThe government of Ghana has signed a second $30 million concessional loan agreement with the Export-Import Bank of China (China Exim) to develop a communications system.The loan has a tenor of 20 years and carries a margin of 200 basis points over Libor.The loan will be used to develop the fibre optics which will serve as a backbone to the CDMA 2000 Go Ta Digital Trunking Communication System for the Security Agencies project.The project is being implemented by ZTE Corporation as the Chinese contractor.In May 2006 Ghana and China Exim signed a similar facility for $30 million towards the project.Document TRAFIN0020080519e4510000b

title: Ghana seeks 70m loan for Phase II of broadband infrastructure project (update, see 1859)
description: China gives Ghana 30m dollars for broadband infrastructure205 words27 May 200805:45 AMBBC Monitoring AfricaBBCAPEnglish(c) 2008 The British Broadcasting Corporation. All Rights Reserved. No material may be reproduced except with the express permission of The British Broadcasting Corporation.Text of report by state-owned Ghana Broadcasting Corporation (GBC) Radio 1 on 27 MayThe first phase of the National Broadband Fibre Optic infrastructure has been completed and it is being tested. It is expected to provide seamless, and integrated multimedia services at lower fee to broadband internet by 2015.The minister of communications, Dr Benjamin Aggrey-Ntim, announced this at the International Telecommunication Union's Standardization Development Forum and Preparatory Meeting in Accra. He said the construction of the fibre optic transmission network is being undertaken in two phases, covering more than 4,000 kilometres. Dr Aggrey-Ntim said the first phase is being supported by the Chinese government with a concessionary loan facility of 30m dollars style='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFF00'>and government is negotiating for an additional 70m dollars for the second phase.He said the plan will be completed with the building of 230 community information centres as access points for ICT in the rural communities. Already, 90 of such centres have been completed. Dr Aggrey Ntim said there is need for public and private sector participation to bridge the digital divide within the country.Source: Radio Ghana, Accra, in English 0600 gmt 27 May 08a8407ef3Document BBCAP00020080527e45r0012y

title: Tanzania-Zambia Railways Authority negotiating with China for $39-million loan (Duplicate of 845)
description: Tanzania-Zambia Railways Authority negotiating with China for $39-million loan692 words9 July 200908:53 AMBBC Monitoring AfricaBBCAPEnglish(c) 2009 The British Broadcasting Corporation. All Rights Reserved. No material may be reproduced except with the express permission of The British Broadcasting Corporation. Text of report by Zambian privately-owned daily newspaper The Post website on 9 July Tanzania Zambia Railways Authority (TAZARA) is in negotiations with the Chinese government for a US $39 million loan to help revamp the operations of the Uhuru railway line. Last Wednesday, TAZARA clocked 33 years of service having commenced operations on July 1, 1976. According to the 2009/2010 budget presented to the Tanzanian Parliament last week, the Minister for Infrastructure Development Dr Shukuru Kawambwa said the loan would be signed during the 2009/2010 fiscal year. Dr Kawambwa said planned capital injection from China would help to revamp the railway jointly owned by Zambia and Tanzania. He said China had also agreed to continue offering tools and technical help to TAZARA. 'A soft loan agreement of about US $39.3 million from the government of China will be signed during the 2009/10 fiscal year... this loan will be used to improve the company's engines, wagons and rollers and develop workers' skills,' Dr Kawambwa said. TAZARA currently has a US $100 million (K500 billion) debt which is costing about K4 billion every month to liquidate as the railway line strives to become debt-free by 2012. Acting managing director Henry Chipewo said in spite of the debts that TAZARA did contract over the years, the position could be liquidated if the railway line could hit 1.2 to two million tonnes per annum of traffic. Earlier this year, Tanzania and Zambia said they planned to concession the bilaterally-owned railway line but past efforts to privatize it had collapsed. 'Discussions with various financial institutions and investors into concessioning TAZARA to improve its services are still going on,' said Dr Kawambwa. And Chipewo recently objected to attempts to concession the railway line to the Chinese, arguing that it needed efficient and focused management for it to remain afloat. Chipewo said the Chinese should continue to support TAZARA without concessioning it to them. 'The Chinese have been supporting TAZARA through the protocols and to them they feel it is the best they can do to give TAZARA the locomotives, the wagons. The technical assistance that the Chinese are giving is more than enough. All we need in TAZARA is efficient management with a focus and vision and inculcate the culture of responsibility in the employees,' said Chipewo. 'The issues of concessioning came about because TAZARA had actually stopped running. So, the only alternative was to look for a concessionaire. But in a situation where the Zambians are able to do that and they are supported, to me I don't buy the concept of concessioning. One thing is true; there is no concessioning that has been successful in Africa or the world over. It is just that in Africa, we don't understand transport, later on, railways.' And deputy managing director Damas Ndumbaro said TAZARA had embarked on an ambitious programme to boost its haulage capacity to tap into freight cargo destined for the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC), Rwanda, Burundi and Zambia. Ndumbaro said the railway network hoped to capture freights landing at the Dar es Salaam Port for haulage to the landlocked countries in partnership with the Tanzania Ports Authority and Ticts. 'When Tazara took off, it had a total of 100 locomotives, but currently there are only 22 locomotives. We intend to boost our capacity by repairing the defective ones,' Ndumbaro said. 'The strategic plan for the entity includes reviing six defective locomotives, at least one each year at the cost of US $4.8 million.' Official statistics indicate that currently, the flow of goods from the port to inland destinations was done mainly by trucks, which caters for over 93 per cent of cargo while the remaining seven per cent is done by rail. One train has the capacity to haul an equivalent of 60 truck load. The entity rakes in an average of US $3 million per month, which is adequate to pay both workers salaries and fund Tazara development programmes. Source: The Post website, Lusaka, in English 9 Jul 09

title: Concessional Loan on ICT (Duplicate of 901 and 680)
description: On April 16, 2010 Tanzania and the Exim Bank of China signed a concessional loan of 700 million yuan to finance Phase 2 of the Tanzanian National Information and Communication Technology (ICT) Broadband infrastructure Backbone Network Project. The project seeks to support the government's effort to improve Tanzanian communication technology. Tanzanian Minister of Finance and Economic Affairs Mustapha Mkulo and Zhu Hongjie, vice-chairman of the Exim Bank of China, attended the signing ceremony ceremony.     The Tanzanian Minister of Communication, Science and Technology of Tanzania Prof. Makame Mbarawa stated during  meeting in early 2012 that the project was effectively launched on February 1, 2009 and by June,  2010 Phase I was completed with 4,300km of fiber backbone operational. Phase II became effective from August 1, 2010 and to date the construction of 3,000km of fiber backbone and installation of transmission equipment is complete, awaiting Provisional Acceptance Tests (PAT) planned to commence on 1 April, 2012. PPIAF-ID:282
donor_agency: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency

title: Acrobatics Props (Not a Project, NGO-NGO)
description: China donates acrobatics props to Tanzanian arts instituteguochunju258 words1 September 201001:23 PMXinhua News AgencyXNEWSEnglish(c) 2010 Xinhua News AgencyBAGAMOYO, Tanzania, Sept. 1 (Xinhua) -- China donated a number of acrobatics props to a Tanzanian arts institute on Tuesday in order to boost cultural exchanges and cooperation between the two countries.Speaking at the hand-over ceremony held at the Tanzania's seventh world heritage site in the east of the country,Director of Culture Development of Ministry of information, Culture and Sports of Tanzania Herman Mwansoko expressed gratitude to China's assistance to his country in the sectors of cultural and education, as the bilateral people-to-people exchanges have been strengthened in the past years.He added that the donation by China Federation of Literary and Art Circles of acrobatics props, with total value of 11,764 U.S. dollars, would further enrich the Tanzanians' knowledge about China and its arts and culture including acrobatics.For his part, Liu Xinsheng, the Chinese ambassador to Tanzania, hailed the cultural exchanges and cooperation between China and Tanzania, which started from the establishment of the diplomatic relations between the two countries in 1964, noting that it has become more frequent and fruitful after the First Ministerial Conference of Forum on China-Africa Cooperation in Beijing in 2000.The Chinese ambassador also commended the Institute of Arst and Culture of Bagamoyo (known as TASUBA in Swahili) for its contribution to the friendship and cultural exchanges between the two countries in recent years with wonderful performances, which made Chinese people more interested in Tanzania and more familiar with its culture.Enditem

title: 406 buses!
description: Auto EventsChina's Xiamen King Long United Automotive Industry Co will supply 406 buses to Senegal this year in an effort to upgrade Senegal's public buses.The deal is part of a $90 million-loan granted by the Chinese government to the South Africa country. The loan includes a grant of around $18 million, a loan of $49 million for national security and a second loan of $23 million to upgrade the country's public transportation buses.With the deal, a total of 402 buses will be exported to Senegal in complete knock-downs (CKDs), and the other four units will be delivered to serve as samples for the bus assembly at the local plants. King Long will also help Senegal build assembly plants and business network, sending a team of 24 technicians and experts to the country to supervise the program.

title: Plans for New $40 Million Five-Star Hotel (Not a project)
description: 9 October 2008 07:11 AMAll Africa AFNWS English (c) 2008 AllAfrica, All Rights Reserved Nyarugenge, Oct 09, 2008 (The New Times/All Africa Global Media via COMTEX) -- New Century Development Limited, a Hong Kong registered company yesterday unveiled a plan for a Five Star Hotel they will construct in the heart of Kigali City.The Hotel, which will be located at the current Jali Club and the Headquarters of both Rwanda Television and Nyarugenge District premises, will be constructed at a cost of $40m (approx. Frw22bn).'The construction begins in January next year and will take two years for the hotel to be fully finished,' said Billy Y.T Cheung, the Chief Executive Officer of African Star Limited, a subsidiary of New Century Development.According to Cheung, the hotel, which will have over 200 luxury rooms, is the first investment the company, which mainly deals in real estate development, is sinking on the African continent.'We chose to invest in Rwanda before any other African country because of, among others, the political stability this is what investors look for in the first place,' said Cheung at a press briefing that took place at Kigali Serena Hotel yesterday.He added that the political will and the reception given to investors was another factor that attracted them to Rwanda.'It is amazing that it only took us a day to have our company registered here,' he said, adding, 'We went to different countries including Kenya, Uganda and Tanzania for a survey but we chose to start our investment from Rwanda.'According to Cheung, upon completion, the hotel will be opened to a hotel management company to run it and that they have already bought the land where the hotel and a commercial complex will be built.The commercial complex that will have a conference centre and a 20-story office building, will be realized in what Cheung said will be the second phase of the project.He estimated the complex which will be built just next to the hotel to cost between $30 and 40 million.Cheung added that they are envisaging more investments in Rwanda especially in the manufacturing industry.'Since we deal mainly in construction, we are looking at possibilities of tapping into this industry especially by manufacturing construction materials that will be supplied throughout the East African region,' he said.He further said that he was optimistic that many Chinese companies will come to Rwanda in the future, attributing it to the investment atmosphere that is championed by President Paul Kagame.New Century Development deals in real estate development and manufacturing and they have different investments in Asian countries that include Hong Kong, China, Malaysia and Indonesia.
sector: Trade, Tourism, Banking and Financial Services

title: Power Supply Project
description: In 2006, an agreement between Hu Jintao and Senegalese president Abdoulaye Wade for the construction of a new electricity project was signed. On January 21, 2009, the groundbreaking ceremony for a new 90 kW power transmission project was held in Dakar. The project is financed with a 370 million CNY concessional loan from the Export-import Bank of China. Implementing the project together are the Senegalese national electric company, SENELEC, and China National Machinery   Equipment Import   Export Corporation (CMEC). The project includes a 26 kilometer underground network of electric cables, and 29.5 kilometers of fibre-optic cables to improve SENELEC's services. The project is expected to be completed in 2015.

title: US$2m cash grant
description: Chinese Firms Keen to Invest in Zambia589 words13 November 200303:03 PMAll AfricaAFNWSEnglish(c) 2003 AllAfrica, All Rights ReservedNo 13, 2003 (The Times of Zambia/All Africa Global Media via COMTEX) --MORE than 70 Chinese companies in textile manufacturing, construction, telecommunications and agricultural businesses are interested in exploring investment opportunities in Zambia.President Mwanawasa disclosed this yesterday at the Lusaka International Airport on arrival from a six-day State visit to that country.He said he was pleased that next month Zambia would be accorded the status of 'final destination' for Chinese tourists in order to boost the tourism industry.He described his visit to China as fruitful and a further demonstration of good and strong bilateral relations that existed between the two countries.President Mwanawasa, who was accompanied by First Lady Maureen, was welcomed on arrival by Vice-President Nevers Mumba, several Cabinet ministers, their deputies, defence chiefs and several party members.He said his visit to China coincided with an investment promotion mission from Zambia, and he was also privileged to officiate at the first Zambia-China investment seminar which was attended by more than 70 Chinese companies.'All these are keen to establish themselves in Zambia through direct investment or through joint ventures with Zambian companies,' the President said.The two governments have also signed a US$ 6 million grant, some of it in cash form, and the rest to be used for projects mutually agreed upon.Giving a breakdown of the grant, Mr Mwanawasa said US$ 2 million would be in cash form and US$ 4 million would go towards various projects to be initiated in the country.President Mwanawasa said the assistance had come at an opportune time and the money would be utilised effectively and efficiently as Government was in need of resources to implement the Poverty Reduction Strategic Paper (PRSP).On debt relief, the two countries had agreed on possibilities of discussing a further debt relief to Zambia.China last year cancelled a US$ 10 million debt to Zambia.'Given the huge burden the country continues to face and the difficulties we have in servicing these loans due to financial constraints, I requested my counterpart for further debt relief. Technical experts from our two countries will consult on this,' he said.President Mwanawasa said the Zambian Government had signed a letter of intent with Sinohydro Corporation, among other companies who are interested in investing in the energy sector, especially in the hydro power plant projects in Kafue Gorge Lower for 600 megawatts and in the Itezhi Tezhi for 180 megawatts.Another agreement was signed with the municipal people's government of Quindao on the establishment of the Mulungushi industrial park as a joint venture project.Quimdao Kailan group of companies also signed an agreement for the establishment of a chemical fertiliser and pesticides project at a cost of US$ 10 million with an expected production of 200,000 tonnes and 10,000 tonnes, respectively.Meanwhile, President Mwanawasa says he has not yet received a report on the revocation of title deeds from Minister of Lands Judith Kapijimpanga and Copperbelt Minister Webby Chipili by the lands tribunal.Responding to a query, Mr Mwanawasa said he was yet to be briefed on the matter before he could make a decision.The lands tribunal in its ruling on Monday revoked titles for a commercial plot jointly owned by the duo through their companies Pineland Investment and WC Engineering.The two ministers have since indicated that they would be appealing to the Supreme Court against the decision of the tribunal, which was chaired by Mr Sebastian Zulu.

title: Not a project: Interest in Olokola Free Trade Zone
description: 'Chinese Oerseas Shipping Company (Cosco), the second largest shipping company in the world, has expressed interest in the Olokola Free Trade Zone, a joint project between Ogun and Ondo state governments.An indication to this emerged during a meeting between Ogun State Governor, Otunba Gbenga Daniel, COSCO Vice President, Mr Li Jiang Hong and management, held at its headquarters in Beijing, China.Press officer to the governor, Mr Kehinde Onasanya, in a statement, said the meeting was also attended by representative of the Ondo State government and Special Adviser to the governor on Investment, Chief Olabode Sunmonu, Chairman of the Lee Group of Companies, Mr Malim Lee, Head of the GMT Group of Hongkong, Mr Ngan and officials of Shanghai Waterway Engineering Company.Welcoming the governor to the meeting, Hong said the company was the largest shipping company in the world, with more than 50 businesses in more than 50 countries and 100 ports in the world. He said the company was into finance guarantee, insurance and international trade, with revenue in business in excess of $10 billion.He assured Daniel that COSCO group would study the Olokola Deep Sea Port and facilitate further discussions to facilitate signing of necessary agreements on the project. Introducing the project to the key investors, Daniel said OKFTZ is the first of its kind in the country, with over $12 billion investment profile.He said the port would have the capacity for haulage, transshipment, Roll on Roll Off (roro) port, as well as bulk cargo, with location highly conducive for investment. '
sector: Trade, Tourism, Banking and Financial Services
donor_agency_count: China Overseas Shipping Company, Private Sector
recipient_agencies: China Overseas Shipping Company, Private Sector

title: Ghana seeks Chinese $9B funding for infrastructure projects
description: In 2010, Ghana signed a deal with China's Export-Import Bank worth $9.87 billion USD for road, railway, and dam projects. It is unclear exactly what the breakdown of the loan is and how it has been implemented.

title: Duplicate: Donation to the Diplomatic Academy of Morocco
description: In 2010, Minister of Foreign Affairs and Cooperation Taieb Fassi Fehri and his Chinese counterpart Yang Jiechi signed an agreement by which Morocco recognized China's market economy and another agreement by which China made a donation to the Diplomatic Academy of Morocco. The status of the donation is uncertain.
