title: Rice irrigation project in Uganda (Commitment year too early)
description: 11 February 2010Kampala, Feb 11, 2010 (New Vision/All Africa Global Media via COMTEX) -- AGNES Muyagu is a widow. With eight children to take care of single-handed, her challenges are countless. But Muyagu is not one to sit back and wallow in self-pity. She invested her energies in the production of rice in Doho Irrigation Rice Scheme (DIRS). She has a three-acre piece of land from which she reaps over 1,000kg of rice per season. There are two seasons in a year.'This irrigation scheme has helped me pay school fees for my children and provide for my family. Sometimes I wonder how life would be without it. The only challenge though, is that it demands very hard work. But I know success comes from hard work. So I am not complaining,' she says.Doho Irrigation Rice Scheme in Nampologoma village, Mazimasa sub-county in Butaleja district, has been a source of livelihood for many families in the area. Almost every family is engaged in rice farming and production.Needless to say, there is hardly any bare ground in Nampologoma village. From a distance, one may think the ground is covered with a carpet.Whether it is a road or just any bare surface, every available space is used for drying rice.In his state-of-the-nation address on New Year's Day, President Yoweri Museveni, reiterated the need for the construction of water dams to ensure that there is enough water for farming throughout the year.He also promised support for people engaged in income-generating activities under the increased household incomes (bona bagaggawale) programme. The Rice People - an organised group called Doho Rice Scheme Farmer's Association (DRSFA) with a membership of over 4,380 farmers - would fit in this programme very well.The group was formed and registered with the Government in 1993 to replace the cooperative society. Members make an annual contribution of sh20,000 that brings enormous benefits like accessibility to small loans, rent-free land in the irrigation scheme, technical services and much more.The Government provides technical support which includes maintaining and rehabilitating the irrigation system, provision of improved rice seeds and agricultural extension services to the farmers.Wilberforce Sagula, the assistant agriculture officer at Doho Irrigation Rice Scheme, says: 'From the cultivatable area of 2,380 acres, about 6,800 tonnes of rice are harvested per year. However, there is still a challenge of collective marketing. Currently each farmer harvests and individually markets their rice produce.'The farmers used to grow rice on a small scale but the yields were low due to poor management of floods and poor rice variety.The farmers also lacked rice hullers to shell and grade their rice and they used to transport their produce on bicycles to Mbale to hull and sell.With the help of the Chinese government, the Ugandan Government constructed the irrigation scheme and trained farmers in the management of floods and pests.From 1984-1996, their yields improved from subsistence production to producing over 2,000kg of milled rice per acre. And in a gesture that meant a lot for these farmers, the Government bought rice hullers for the scheme while the Chinese brought better varieties of rice that had been tested at Kibimba Irrigation Scheme. The rice grown on Doho Rice Scheme is K5, K85 and K98 which is sold as Kaiso on the local market.The story of 'The Rice People of Doho' comes a long way. In fact, rice growing in Butaleja dates way back to the 1940s. In 1976, the Chinese constructed Doho Rice Irrigation Scheme, which was completed in 1984.In 2000, Japan International Co-operation Agency (JICA) in conjunction with the agriculture ministry sensitised farmers to increase yields. In 2003, they trained farmers and co-opted technical staff on government payroll to oversee the scheme. Some farmers were taken for training at Kilimanjaro Agricultural Training Institute in Tanzania.Doho Rice Scheme covers an area of 2,500 acres, of which 2,380 are arable. The rest is for irrigation structures, farm roads, irrigation canals and embankments that protect the garden from flooding.The scheme is divided in blocks that are allocated to farmers on recommendation of community leaders depending on the capability of the farmer. The community leaders consider the applicant's discipline and his or her ability to work the acreage applied for.The farmers at Doho Rice Scheme sell a kilo of rice to middle men at sh1,200 in a good season to sh1,400 in a bad season. In spite of the bad farm-gate price, rice remains both a source of livelihood and food security for the people of Doho. But Wilberforce Sagula says most of the rice is lost during the hulling process because the machines are old.'They crash the rice into small pieces that cannot be sold on the market. They are also exploited by middlemen who buy the rice cheaply and sell it expensively,' says Sagula. But all said and done, children in Butaleja are not like other Ugandan children for whom rice is a delicacy, reserved for only big days like on Christmas or Idd.Document AFNWS00020100211e62b000jz

title: Gas Fired Plant
description: In 2006, Nigeria and China agreed to jointly construct one hydropower plant and one gas-fired plant, according to Nigeria's minister of power and steel, Senator Liyel Imoke. No additional information was provided about the gas-fired plant.The status of this project is uncertain.

title: China donates goods worth 10m RMB yuan (duplicate of 2273)
description: In February of 2006, China gave Zambia $1 million USDLusaka, 9 February: China has given drought-hit Zambia 1m US dollars for it to purchase relief food. At the signing ceremony held here Thursday [9 February] of the notes to acknowledge receipt of the fund, Chinese Ambassador to Zambia Li Baodong said that this donation is in the conditions that Zambia is suffering the food shortage because of drought.The ambassador said that the Chinese government is doing the job to help the Zambian government to implement the project of maintenance of water supply in Lusaka, Ndola and Kitwe with about 80m RMB [renminbi] yuan (about 10m dollars).The Chinese government has also agreed to provide the government with a batch of goods worth 10m RMB yuan (about 1.2m dollars) to be used in the elections later this year.On occasion Zambian Finance Minister Ng'andu Magande thanked the Chinese government for the assistance. The minister assured the Chinese ambassador the grant will be utilized to purchase relief food to benefit the hunger stricken people and accountability and transparency in the utilization of grant is strictly observed.It is estimated that 1.7 million Zambians are facing food shortage due to the drought that hit most part of the southern African country in the 2004/05 farming season. In November, 2005, Zambian President Levy Mwanawasa declared the hunger situation in the country as a 'national disaster', calling for international food aid.Source: Xinhua news agency, Beijing, in English 1154 gmt 9 Feb 06

title: China to cancel US$250m debt
description: In 2006, China was expected to cancel $250 million USD worth of Zambian debt once all necessary requirements were concluded.

title: Chinese construction firm builds highway in Uganda (SBI is not a Chinese firm)
description: In October 2011, Chinese construction firm SBI was working bitumen on a 152 million USD Kabale--Kisoro road project near the Rwandan and Congolese borders. The current status, flow type, and start and end dates are unknown.Just like the open market where China is chasing customers like any other trader to efforts to woe government monies, China's aggressiveness is the same. Large Chinese construction companies are in the countryside opening new highways at multi-billion dollar contracts. The Chinese construction firm, SBI rebuilt a 75-kilometer stretch of tarmac road from Fort Portal to Kasese Town just after they had completed a longer, over 100 kilometer Mbarara--Kasese Road through Bushenyi District.The construction firm is now working bitumen on a $152 million Kabale--Kisoro road project near the Rwandan and Congolese borders.Mr Kevin Chen, the CEO of a $15m digital TV investment project, Star Times, says China's aggressive drive into Africa is driven by largely two factors; the money for capital investment and the technological knowhow.'The driving force now is capital; we have the money, enough capital and because of this we have to look for investment opportunities to make more money,' says Mr Chen, adding rather brusquely; 'China is opening up and expanding. When you open up you have advantages, for a long time we were closed but now we are opening.'Because of the sudden turn-around, Chinese investors are not blind to the challenges of infrastructural inadequacies in Africa, as Mr Chen says the potholes might be a menace but not as bad and, therefore, tolerable. He, however, notes that intermittent power supplies and a high cost of fuel to run diesel engines coupled with erratic mobile telephone networks still present major obstacles.Does China care about political stability? Mr Chen says it does, especially for its investment projects.'(Political) stability is important, now it is difficult for Chinese investors to go into a country such as Libya. Uganda is much more stable.'Investment is not like trading, Chen says, but the Chinese are doing both here and elsewhere. The numbers have grown so big in a very short period of time that recently, a Chinese event was held at the five-star Kampala Serena Hotel.Pioneer Chinese investor Fang Min, who arguably opened the door for Chinese investment and trade in Uganda, is seen here as an iconic figure. Her country even honoured her on its postage stamps.When Chen begins to reel off Chinese businesses in Uganda at the snap off the finger--his countrymen are into steel rolling and are exploring investing in mineral exploration and expanding into the hospitality industry more aggressively than the cautious Fang Min.Mr Uwihanganye says China is pushing in all directions and, in his view, appeasing African governments with not only cheap credit but large construction projects.Evidence abounds to vindicate this view. The Ugandan Ministry of Foreign Affairs is housed in a gleaming six-storey block donated and constructed by China.Two new towers that will house the President's Office are nearing completion on a plot between the Kampala Capital City Authority (KCCA) and Parliament and overlook the ministries of finance and foreign affairs. The two towers dwarf all the other buildings.In nearby Lugogo, a new hospital is nearing completion to ease the pressure on the country's only national referral hospital, Mulago.Mr Uwihanganye says government seems to have been blinded by apparent extreme Chinese generosity to put any checks. There are hardly any local partnerships between the Chinese investors and local people; they are taking all.'They are finding a culture which is too liberal, which does not require them to partner,' he says, noting that Africa has not learnt from the experiences of exploitation first by colonial invaders and later by Indian and Asian business people who invest and repatriate all their profit while keeping closed communities of their kith and kin without integrating into the local communities.But China has been willing to engage, to negotiate without putting conditions like their western rivals who put human rights and governance as key to their aid or pre-conditions they wave at their companies seeking opportunities in Africa. China is also not know for issuing sometimes distabilising advisories to its citizens venturing into Africa, a position many African leaders fancy as they battle to re-assert their authority in the post-independence era.All Africa Global MediaDocument AFNWS00020111018e7ai000g3
donor_agency_count: SBI
recipient_agencies: SBI

title: 2D Seismic Mapping (Duplicate of 2388)
description: 19 January 2007UpstreamUPSTRM24English(c) 2007, Upstream. To read more Upstream stories you can get a FREE two-week trial of LIVE news, Upstream Hardcopy and Upstream archive news at www.upstreamonline.com [http://www.upstreamonline.com]. Do note that all Upstream articles are protected by copyright. Any unauthorised reproduction is strictly prohibited.China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC) is currently shooting 1250 kilometres of 2D seismic on the adjoining Bilma block where the Chinese giant holds 100% of the concession, writes Barry Morgan.Although the first exploration period demands no well commitment, the seismic programme will be extended, says the Ministry of Mines   Energy's head of petroleum Ousseini Assane Boureima.Sonatrach International Exploration   Development, the overseas arm of the Algerian state-owned oil company, is also actively pursuing acreage in Niger, having snared the Kafra block in 2005.The block is adjacent to its Tafassasset permit on the Algerian side of the border.Boureima says the company plans 1500 kilometres of 2D seismic in the south towards Bilma, about 50% more than the committed volume.However, proposed co-ordinates have not been determined.Sonatrach's acreage lies north of Tenere and TG World Energy believes Kafra is an extension of the Cretaceous-Tertiary Rift basin in Algeria.TG World earlier worked closely with Sonatrach on Tenere, and its re-entry into Niger bodes well for exploration and production in the country, according to TG World chief executive Cliff James.Sonatrach is committed to spending $30 million in-country during the four-plus-four-plus-four exploration period.Although no well is required during the first four-year phase, two are due for the second. 'This adds to the momentum generally, and to those forces keeping the door open for an eventual pipeline system to the Mediterranean through Algeria,' says James.Sonatrach is already in advanced talks for Djado-1, a block contiguous with the Libyan border and believed by Niamey geologists to be extension of the prolific Mosul basin and 'very prospective'.Niamey feels it needs to tighten up further on future suitors, now preferring to offer exploration terms on a four-plus-three-plus-two basis but few stumbling blocks are thought lie in the way of Sonatrach acquiring this block in March.Hunt Oil walked away from Niger's Djado-Mosul basin in the 1990s after the play failed to excite, just as it had with Total in the 1960s.The play is higher risk than Tenere, says Nubian Consulting chief Daniel Clark-Lowes, an ex-Shell geologist and expert on North African geology who built his career in southern Libya and examined data from several operators. 'The Hunt wells were not dry. One had an oil discovery of small quantities, another had shows, while the other demonstrated oil shales, source rocks which could generate much more. So I think Djado is certainly more prospective than one might think by just looking at the test results,' he says.'But one should not conclude that more drilling will yield (any elephants) though that's what some Asian players and western mid-tiers are banking on.'Sonatrach has also carried out a study of the Tamesna block where French independent Societe de Participations Petrolieres (Petropar) drilled some dry holes in the 1960s, but has not initiated talks to acquire acreage there.Petropar's probe on what is now dubbed the Azawak block on Niger's western border also disappointed but companies may be persuaded to return, given the resurgence of interest in Mali's Iullemeden basin.Elsewhere there is little to engage suitors. No wells have been drilled in Tadarast across the border from north-western Nigeria while just one well was sunk in Dallol without a discovery, by Sun Oil in 1975.However, Niamey insists companies from Australia, Canada, the UK, Europe, China and India have contacted the Ministry for a spread of open blocks, awaiting the green light to open negotiations.Independents from Pakistan, South Africa, Nigeria and Malaysia have also shown interest in the data, which French consultant Beicip has packaged for suitors.Document UPSTRM0020070118e31j00023
donor_agency_count: China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC), State-Owned Company
recipient_agencies: China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC), State-Owned Company

title: Limousines for Guinea's jubilee
description: Text of report entitled 'Politics: Does Minister Ousman Dore want to sabotage Guinea's fiftieth anniversary celebration?' published on Guineenews web site on 9 SeptemberThree weeks to the Guinea's 50th independence anniversary celebration, the minister of economy and finance and chairman of inter-ministerial committee for organization the celebrations, Ousman Dore, has not yet released funds needed for the festivities, Guineenews learnt from reliable sources.It is said that 'he has been in charge of the golden jubilee budget for a long time but he refuses to pay! Few days to 2 October, up to now, nothing has been done towards the 50th anniversary'.The official programme for the 50th anniversary ceremonies makes provision for, important cultural shows, conferences, seminars on 50 years of independence, an international football match between Guinea and a selection of world players, among others.But up to now, the invitations letters have not yet been sent, cleaning has not yet been completed at Gbessia Airport, the Golden Jubilee Villas in Kipe are at foundation level, the decoration of Conakry with flags remains uncertain, hotel reservations for participants at conferences and invited guests are yet to be booked, no announcements have been made by the national international media etc.China, a friend of Guinea, has played her role as promised: the free renovation of the People's Palace and the free offer of 50 limousines for the 50th anniversary. In January, Chinese engineers started the renovation of the People's Palace. The building is almost new today and also 50 Chinese 'Red flags' type limousines will officially be handed over tomorrow Wednesday [10 September], according to information.The Guinean side which is supposed to take care of the open area of the People's Palace has not done anything. Last week end, 400 young volunteers cleared the surroundings of the Palace as their contribution to the Golden Jubilee celebration.The organizers and cultural operators are desperate. Our numerous calls to Minister Dore have been in vain.Any regrets? They will definitely come in two years, when Senegal, Cote d'Ivoire, Mali, Niger, Burkina-Faso or even Benin will organize their 50th anniversaries, and Mr Dore will be invited as prime minister of Guinea.Source: Guineenews website in French 0000 gmt 9 Sep 08

title: China, South Africa sign agreements (duplicate)
description: 318 words25 April 2000China DailyCHNDLYEnglish(c) 2000 by China DailyBy HU QIHUA, China Daily staff.JOHANNESBURG: President Jiang Zemin arrived here yesterday evening to kick off his state visit to South Africa. Jiang's three-day visit, at the invitation of President Thabo Mbeki, is the first by a Chinese head of state. Upon arrival at the airport, Jiang said the Chinese Government has paid close attention to the development of relations between the two countries, which have been strengthened with good prospects for further expansion. Sino-South African relations have developed rapidly since the establishment of diplomatic ties in 1998. More initiatives are now being negotiated on customs, health, police co-operation, taxation, merchant shipping, national defence and other fields. South Africa is China's the largest trading partner in Africa. Trade volume between China and South Africa amounted to US$1.558 billion in 1998. The total volume of investment by South Africa in China at present is about US$130 million. The two governments have signed agreements on investment protection, the establishment of joint economic and trade commission, trade and economic technical co-operation and the draft agreement on double-taxation evasion. Jiang said that he was looking forward to seeing the achievements made by the people of South Africa in nation-building and to have an in-depth discussion with South African leaders on diplomatic relations. The upcoming meeting of African foreign and economic ministers in Beijing will be discussed during this visit. The October meeting is seen by analysts as an attempt by China to boost Sino-African economic and political co-operation. Jiang is to hold talks with President Mbeki this morning and is scheduled to meet with Deputy President Jacob Zuma and former President Nelson Mandela in the afternoon. South Africa is the last leg of Jiang's two week tour, which has taken him to Israel, Palestine, Egypt, Turkey and Greece.

title: Resettlement of Refugees - Construction of Simple Housing (Duplicate)
description: 新华网内罗毕９月２６日电（记者赵卓昀）中国驻肯尼亚大使张明２６日代表中国政府向肯尼亚政府转交了总计近３００万美元的紧急人道主义援助资金和物资，以帮助肯尼亚骚乱后的经济重建和受害民众安置。    张明大使和肯尼亚代理财政部长约翰・米丘基分别代表各自政府在有关文件上签字。中国政府这次提供的援助包括１００万美元现汇和价值近２００万美元用于搭建简易住房的波纹铁皮。    张明说，肯尼亚今年初的选举危机造成许多民众流离失所，中国政府和人民对他们深表同情，并提供了力所能及的人道主义援助。他说，中肯两国在各领域保持着良好的合作关系，为进一步表达对肯政府的支持，中国政府决定再向肯方提供上述紧急人道主义援助。    米丘基对中国提供的援助表示感谢，称赞此举将进一步加强肯中两国人民的友谊。    肯尼亚去年年底举行的总统选举引发争议和严重骚乱，到今年初共造成１０００多人死亡，３５万人无家可归。在非洲联盟调解下，肯两大政党２月底达成权力分享协议，４月中旬组成了联合政府。

title: Agreement on mining cooperation
description: 235 words14 September 2001AsiaPort Daily NewsAPRTPage 1English(c) 2001 Alestron, Inc. All Rights Reserved.BEIJING, September 14, AsiaPort -- China and South Africa's Mining Industry Study and Cooperation Meeting was held in Beijing on Sep., 6. Some top officials and dozens of mining industry companies took part in it.South Africa is rich in minming resouces, especially in gold, copper, magnesium, chromium etc. Its gold reserves is 40% to the world total and sales volume 48% to the whole nation's; chromium mining reserves is 40% to the world total with an import volume 60% to the whole world's. Mining industry is conducive to South Africa's economy and developed fast in recent years.During the meeting, the sectary of China's Mining Industry Federation Mr. Wang introduced the function, management structure, ect. of the federation. According to Wang, the federation will provide foreign companies the latest news, relevant laws, policies, market analysis etc. for their investment in China and organize foreign companies to take part in China's mining forums and some relevant meetings on mining industry. He pointed out that both South Africa and China are rich in mining industry and there is a big potential for the cooperation of these two nations.Bisides, the board chairmen and general managers from svevn giant companies in South Arica introduced their own enterprises in detail. A top official from a China's coal industry Co. said this kind of meeting is of great significance.Document aprt000020010914dx9e0000y

title: China Wuyi to construct road in Nyanza Province
description: In 2010, China Wuyi, a Chinese construction company, was awarded a 220 million Yuan contract for the rehabilitation of highway projects in the province of Nyanza. Today announced the company received the office of the Permanent Secretary, Ministry for Kenya road winning notice, to about 220 million yuan, the duration of 30 months, successful province of Kenya Nyanza (Nyanza) D246/E126/E139 highway projects.China Wuyi, said the contract had not yet been formally signed outside the project there are political and foreign exchange rate risk. movedChina-SAfrica-Africa-diplomacy,2ndleadCAPE TOWNSouth Africa and China sign a key pact to cushion the impact of Chinese textile imports here as Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao began the highest level Chinese visit to the country in 50 years.650 words moved by Jan Hennop. Pictures-- ASIA BUSINESS --Japan-economy-trade,3rdleadTOKYOJapan's trade surplus jumps more than 35 percent in May, the first rise in the past 17 months as the world's second largest economy ships out more vehicles in a sign of a recovering economy.500 words 0330 GMTEurope-Russia-steel-company-Arcelor-Severstal,5thleadChinese premier boosts trade with seven-nation Africa tour: Booming economy spurs hunt for natural resources: Oil is chief interest but nuclear accord also likelyRory Carroll, Johannesburg923 words22 June 2006The GuardianGRDN19English© Copyright 2006. The Guardian. All rights reserved.China's economic and diplomatic push into Africa has gone into overdrive this week with a seven-country tour by its premier, Wen Jiabao, to secure trade deals.After warm welcomes in Egypt, Ghana, the Democratic Republic of Congo, and Angola, Mr Wen arrived in South Africa yesterday for two days of talks on nuclear power, textile imports and regional alliances. The visits form part of what Beijing foreign policy officials have dubbed the 'year of Africa', a drive for access to the continent's natural resources to fuel China's booming economy.Mr Wen was greeted at the Tuynhuys presidential office in Cape Town with a red carpet, two lines of cabinet ministers and a South African navy brass band. It was his fifth such ceremony in as many days, with two more later this week in Tanzania and Uganda.The pomp reflected a burgeoning influence in Africa, which is rapidly catching up with that of the United States and the old colonial powers, Britain and France. Mr Wen said China's relations with Africa were based on mutual benefit and posed no threat to US interests.China's trade with the continent reached a record $39.7bn (pounds 21.5bn) last year, almost four times the figure in 2001. As ubiquitous as Chinese technicians building roads and railways are Chinese-run shops and restaurants. Schools have started teaching Mandarin and direct flights to Beijing and Shanghai are proliferating.Mr Wen, the first Chinese premier to visit South Africa in half a century, was due to sign a pact on textiles to ease a trade imbalance blamed for the loss of 25,000 South African jobs, a touchy issue that has soured feelings towards Chinese immigrants. After talks with the South African president, Thabo Mbeki, the premier was due to meet oil executives and expatriate Chinese business leaders.An accord on mining South Africa's rich uranium deposits and developing peaceful nuclear technology, with both countries sharing French-designed reactors, was also expected.Further talks are scheduled for today to cover climate change, peacekeeping and the alleviation of poverty, a sign that China's engagement has broadened beyond a hunt for raw materials.The Asian giant signalled its ambitions in January by publishing an Africa policy paper, followed by a tour of three countries by the president, Hu Jintao. In November Beijing will host a China-Africa summit that is expected to attract about 40 heads of government and state.Mr Wen's tour is a showcase of Chinese deal-making. Accords in Egypt on oil, natural gas and telecommunications were followed by a $66m loan to Ghana for a telecommunications project and hints of $600m for a hydroelectric dam. Congo was offered economic, commercial and technical cooperation. Tanzania and Uganda are expecting fresh credit lines and infrastructure projects.There was no doubting the trip's chief interest: oil. With an economy that grew by 10.3% in the first quarter of this year, China's need is ravenous. Worried by Middle Eastern instability, it wants more oil from Africa, which already accounts for up to a third of its supply.Mr Wen's visit to Angola consolidated last month's $1.4bn deal between China's state-owned giant Sinopec and the host's state-owned oil producer, Sonangol, to develop new fields. Angola recently overtook Saudi Arabia as China's biggest oil supplier.Without giving details, a joint communique said China would extend more credit and expand technical assistance for Angola's postwar reconstruction.The president, Jose Eduardo dos Santos, praised the lack of preconditions. 'We hail China's pragmatism towards Angola, which has allowed us to speed up the country's reconstruction.'Watchdog groups said that was a euphemism for China turning a blind eye to the Angolan government's corruption and human rights abuses. Similar criticism has been levelled at Beijing's dealings with Sudan and Zimbabwe.Chinese diplomats say it is a matter of respecting sovereignty. Privately they add that their approach is more honest than the west's, which chides some regimes but ignores allies' abuses.guardian.co.uk/china >Sunday 18 JuneEgyptCll: 5,493Exports to china as a % of total: 2.27% Signs agreements on energy and telecoms china also agrees to %50m loan provides $10m to build an investment centreMondayGhanaCll 5.034, extremeExports to China: 3% Commits to low-interest loan of $66m. Beijing may also fund $600m hydroelectric damMonday/TuesdayCongoCll 1.271, extremeExports to China: 70.5%Signs economic and health agreements. Brazzaville agrees to buy two Chinese-made aircraft. Congo produced est 267,000 bpd of crude last yearTuesdayAngolaCll: 1.393, extremeExports to China : 37%Signed cooperationa agreements and a further credit deal, following $3bn oil-backed loan. Angola is sub-saharan Africa's second largest oil-producerWednesdaySouth AfricaCll: 4.527, highExports to China: 6.23%Due to sign agreement to co-operate on peaceful nuclear technology and will discuss a deal on textilesThursday/FridayTanzaniaCll: 5.404, mediumExports to China: 0.32%Likely to discuss deals on textiles and projects to build highways and bridgesUgandaCll: 5.823, mediumExports to China: 1.72%Likely to discuss details on textiles and projects to build highways and bridgesDocument GRDN000020060622e26m0001j

title: Office supplies to Moroccan Parliament
description: From September 4th to 6th 2005, China's National People's Congress Standing Committee Chairman Wu Bangguo was on an official goodwill visit to Morocco. During the visit, the Chinese National People's Congress presented to the Moroccan parliament office supplies.  The office supplies will be distributed to the two houses of parliament. On September 5th, a brief office supplies gift ceremony was held, Chairman Wu Bangguo and the Moroccan House Speaker Abdullah Delek • WahaDe • Radi, Vice President Mustafa • Okacha gift gift list, and posed for pictures.

title: Not a project: Car Factory
description: 377 words4 June 2010The StarTHESTRE15English© Copyright 2010 Independent Newspapers (UK) Limited. All rights reserved.Zhejiang Gonow Auto, the manufacturer of the Gonow range of vehicles from China, has appointed a new southern African distributor and has plans to invest $10 million in South Africa to establish an assembly plant by 2013.Ruan Zaosheng, the executive director of Gonow Auto International, said yesterday the plant was likely to be set up either in Durban or Pretoria.Ruan said Gonow had established three factories outside China, in Thailand, Egypt and Iran, and its vehicles were now exported to 80 countries.Its future international market expansion involved plans to build another three assembly plants located in South America, South Africa and Poland.Ruan was speaking at the official launch of Vermillion Motor Holdings, the wholly Chinese-owned company whose six Chinese shareholders are permanent residents in South Africa, that has been appointed the distributor of the Gonow range in South Africa.Gonow was previously launched into the country in 2007 by GoNow Auto South Africa, a 100 percent empowered subsidiary of holding company Boston Super Group in Boksburg, which went into liquidation in October last year.Vermillion has been established specifically for the purpose of being a multi-brand importer/distributor of automotive product from China.Jonathan Qin, Vermillion's managing director, said yesterday the company had signed import distribution agreements with two manufacturers, Zhejiang Gonow Auto from Taizhou and Tianjin-based Tanqi Tianjin Meiya, which manufactures and markets the Meiya vehicle brand, and negotiations with several other Chinese manufacturers were taking place.The Meiya brand is also not new to the country. It was launched in the country in 2007 by McCarthy Motor Holdings (MMH), part of the listed Bidvest Group, but withdrawn from the market towards the end of 2008.Imperial Holdings and MMH subsequently established a joint venture import and distributorship company for their Chinese brands, Chery and Foton, but the venture plans to expand the Chinese brands it represents in South Africa.Qin said this was Vermillion's entry into the motor industry but the investors had diverse holdings in property, consumer goods and the mining industry.It had invested more than R20m in its operations and created about 50 jobs, excluding its dealer network.7653536Document THESTR0020100604e66400038
recipient_agencies: Zhejiang Gonow Auto Co., Ltd. (GAC Gonow), State-Owned Company

title: Stake in Lender
description: 329 words7 January 200801:37 PMAssociated Press NewswiresAPRSEnglish(c) 2008. The Associated Press. All Rights Reserved.JOHANNESBURG, South Africa (AP) - Chinese foreign minister Yang Jiechi began a two-day visit to South Africa Monday, marking 10 years of diplomatic relations between the two countries.Yang paid a brief courtesy visit to President Thabo Mbeki before meeting with foreign affairs minister Nkosazana Dlamini Zuma in Pretoria. It was the start of a tour of Africa, where China foreign ministry officials have traditionally started the year in a sign of the importance they place on the resource-rich continent.Yang was also to visit Congo, Burundi and Ethiopia.Yang said the China-South Africa relationship is of great importance, the South African Press Association reported.Trade between South Africa, the continent's economic powerhouse and a major gold-producing country, and China reached US$240 million in the first 11 months of 2006, an increase of 34.5 percent from the previous year.Last year China's biggest bank, the state-owned Industrial   Commercial Bank of China Ltd. bought a 20 percent stake in South Africa's biggest lender, Standard Bank Group Ltd. in one of China's biggest foreign corporate acquisitions to date.Chinese investments into South Africa amount to US$130 million, mostly in a chromium mine while South African investments in China stand at about US$400 million including investments by Anglo American, SAB Miller and a US$120 million investment by a property group.Yang's visit comes a year after Chinese President Hu Jintao visited South Africa in early 2007.South Africa and China on Monday established a diplomatic mechanism to enhance political, economic and trade relations.Yang and Dlamini Zuma were also expected to discuss co-operation between the two countries in international affairs as well as Chinese support for peacekeeping operations in Africa.7Document APRS000020080107e41700378

title: Exploring offshore oil block (Taiwan company)
description: BEIJING (Dow Jones)--A subsidiary of state-owned China National Petroleum Corp. (CNPC.YY) has secured a bid to explore an oil block offshore Libya, the Chinese Ministry of Commerce said in a statement posted on its Web site Monday.The subsidiary, China National Oil and Gas Exploration and Development Corporation, signed an exploration and production sharing agreement with Libyan National Petroleum Company on Dec. 7.The offshore 17-4 oil block covers an area of 2,535 square kilometers.CNPC officials declined to comment when contacted, and the statement from the Ministry of Commerce didn't disclose terms of the E P agreement or estimated oil reserves.This marks China's first foray into oil field exploration in Libya, and the Chinese Ministry of Commerce plans to increase energy cooperation with Libya.In May, Libya offered around 44 oil blocks spanning an area of 101,672 square kilometers, according to another statement on the ministry's Web site.Ministry of Commerce Web site: http://www.mofcom.gov.cn [http://www.mofcom.gov.cn]-Renya Peng contributed to this story, Dow Jones Newswires; 8610 6588-5848; renya.peng@dowjones.com-Edited by Tracy Gan-0-Document DJCFWE0020051212e1cc008hq//台湾政府企业中国石油公司(Chinese Petroleum Corp. CPC.YY，简称：台湾中油公司)的一位高级管理人士周二表示，该公司将投标一个或多个利比亚勘探项目。　　台湾中油公司探采事业部副总裁S.H. Chuo表示，公司已决定推进在利比亚的投资。该公司董事长陈宝郎最近访问了利比亚。　　对台湾中油公司而言，石油勘探已经变得越来越重要。原油价格高企以及本地售价提升空间有限导致该公司今年出现亏损。　　不过，Chuo拒绝透露台湾中油公司将投标一个项目还是多个项目。　　台湾中油公司一位公共关系负责人称，有意参加利比亚第三轮国际许可招标的投标人需在12月10日前递交标书。　　台湾中油公司从去年开始研究将利比亚作为可能的石油勘探目标。美国2004年取消了对这个非洲国家的大部分制裁。　　台湾中油公司的数据显示，到目前为止，该公司在海外的现有石油勘探项目(包括在美国、委内瑞拉、澳大利亚、厄瓜多尔和乍得)收效甚微。　　台湾与上述国家没有官方联系。

title: Horn of Africa Famine Relief
description: International online news (reporter Pan Ying): 17 journalists learned from the Red Cross Society of China, the Chinese Red Cross has emergency financing of 800 million yuan, and humanitarian assistance to famine on the Horn of Africa region.According to reports, this aid, 200 million assistance to the Kenyan Red Cross, 200 million assistance to the Ethiopian Red Cross Society, 400 million by the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies to other affected countries assistance. By the International Federation assistance of $ 400 million, including the Shenzhen One Foundation Community Foundation and Alibaba Group companies each donated 1 million yuan for humanitarian assistance in Somalia. The Red Cross Society of China will continue to pay attention to the famine disaster in the Horn of Africa, efforts to solve the increasingly serious humanitarian crisis in the region.East Africa, the Horn of Africa region is experiencing the most severe drought and famine since the 80s of the last century, in most parts of Somalia, Kenya, Djibouti and Ethiopia were affected, 12.4 million refugees urgent global rescue.

title: China Increase Number of Scholarships offered to South African Students Inactive
description: China, SAfrica agree to work together on mining   251 words26 September 200711:55 AMReuters NewsLBAEnglish(c) 2007 Reuters Limited   BEIJING, Sept 26 (Reuters) - Companies from China and South Africa will be able to tap the China-Africa Development Fund for investment in minerals, energy and other industries, the two countries said in a joint communique on Wednesday.   The two countries will 'explore ways to enhance capacity building in mining, construction and other industries' according to the communique, issued during a visit to the Chinese capital by South African Deputy President Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka.   In June, Beijing launched the $5 billion China-Africa Development Fund, with initial capital of $1 billion, to help finance Chinese investments in Africa, part of Beijing's pledge to double its aid to the continent.   Beijing is increasingly using its massive foreign reserves to lend to Africa, paving the way for its state-owned firms to bid on mining and infrastructure projects as it tries to secure raw materials supply for its booming economy.   The countries also agreed to expand exchanges and cooperation in a variety of fields, particularly aquaculture and agricultural products. China increased the number of scholarships offered to South African students.   'The Chinese side noted with appreciation the position taken by South Africa and other countries, against Taiwan's bid for U.N. membership during the 62nd session of the U.N. General Assembly,' the communique said.   CHINA-SOUTHAFRICA|LANGEN|AFA|CSA|LBY|RWSA|RWS|REULB|GNS|G|RBN|ABN|M|D|AFN|SF|C|MTL|GRO|SOF|RNP|DNP|PGE|SXNADocument LBA0000020070926e39q001ds

title: Lucy Kibaki hospital (Duplicate)
description: On June 20, 2011 Kenyan Medical Services minister Prof Anyang Nyong'o  announced the refurbishing and renaming of the Embakasi District Hospital. The new Mama Lucy Kibaki Hospital Embakasi, located in the Nasra Gardens near Umoja in Embakasi constituency, was a 'gift' from China. President Mwai Kibaki and his wife, the First Lady,  picked the Embakasi District Hospital as the beneficiary of the Chinese offer to upgrade 1 hospital. China has fully funded the furnishing of the institution.

title: High-speed Rail link [nothing was signed...not a project]
description: In 2010, China Railway Group signed an MoU with Standard BankTalks have begun between the government and China Railway Group on the feasibility of the project.China Railway chairman Li Changjin said discussions were at an early stage and no funding was in place. Li was speaking on the sidelines of the China-Africa investment forum in Beijing, to which President Jacob Zuma is leading a delegation of 13 ministers.Martyn Davies, the chief executive of Frontier Advisory, said yesterday the high-speed railway link was 'very viable', depending on how the project was structured.Erik Larsen, a spokesman for Standard Bank, said a memorandum of understanding signed with China Railway, which was announced yesterday, did not relate to any specific project, but was a general undertaking between Standard Bank and China Railway to cooperate across a broad spectrum of opportunities.Davies said although it was premature to talk about the details, Standard Bank was positioning itself as the preferred financier for the project.The Industrial   Commercial Bank of China holds a 20 per cent stake in Johannesburg-based Standard Bank.Li said South Africa was hoping that Chinese state-owned banks could provide loans for the project. China Railway wants South Africa to contribute 30 per cent to 40 per cent of the capital, he said.Davies said South Africa needed to look at how to integrate the economy through infrastructure development, which the Chinese had been doing through a significant roll-out of high speed trains. China was looking to take its technology global, Davies said.The New York Times reported earlier that China intended to link its own provincial capitals with bullet trains and was also building high-speed rail routes in Turkey, Venezuela and Saudi Arabia.Henk Langenhoven, a senior economist at the SA Federation of Civil Engineering Contractors, said the precedent was that if the Chinese financed a project, they would also build it, excluding the local construction and engineering sector.He said the biggest benefit to the South African economy was the financing because the country 'did not have big financial muscle behind the construction industry, which is a uniform problem in Africa'.Langenhoven said many technical details on the project were not known but if the principle was to move freight from road to rail it was sound.Phillip Taaibosch, the general secretary of the SA National Taxi Council (Santaco), said the taxi industry was not opposed to the project, provided the industry was engaged.'With the diversification programme within Santaco, we are very open to discussions to see how we can participate in programmes of this nature that will benefit taxi operators who use long haul routes.'He said 'a fairly high proportion' of Santaco's members operated on the route.Taaibosch said the reason for the taxi industry's negative response to bus rapid transit systems was that the industry was not approached in a way that allowed it to 'play a pivotal role in the discussions'.Passenger volumes on trains between Johannesburg and Durban are about 270,000 people a year, meaning that a high-speed train service would also target business travellers and holidaymakers who fly. About 2.7 million people fly between Durban and Johannesburg each year.Gidon Novick, the joint chief executive of Comair and kulula.com, its low-cost division, said a high-speed train was 'very much a pie in the sky concept'.He added that the government had spent about R20bn on upgrading airports and building the new airport in Durba n and it would want to recoup that investment.Source: Business Report website, Johannesburg, in English 25 Aug 10ac7985ddDocument BBCAP00020100825e68p001jm193 words9 September 2010New Zealand Transport Intelligence BriefingTMRTNLEnglish(c) 2010 The Main Report Publications LtdBloomberg 02/09/2010. South Africa signed a memorandum of understanding with China to improve the African nation's railway services, the Department of Transport says. The Department of Transport and the Passenger Rail Agency of South Africa plan to spend 95bn rand ($13bn) on buying new stock over the next 18 years, Director-General George Mahlalela told reporters in Johannesburg. The department will seek approval for the spending at a Cabinet meeting this month, he says. 'The challenge we are facing is that most of our commuter- rail system has reached the end of its lifespan,' Mahlalela says.'We believe that an ambitious program of introducing new rail stock and technology in our system is an absolute necessity and will protect our historical investment in the sector.' From October, South Africa will investigate whether there is enough demand to justify the construction of a high-speed railway link between Johannesburg, the commercial hub, and the eastern port city of Durban, according to Mahlalela. More ... http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2010-09-01/south-africa-to-test-market-demand-for-high-speed-rail-link-from-october.html [http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2010-09-01/south-africa-to-test-market-demand-for-high-speed-rail-link-from-october.html]Document TMRTNL0020100908e6990000s

title: Zimbabwe reportedly buys arms, riot gear from China (duplicate #18101)
description: On November 11, 2004, Mugabe purchased arms and anti-riot equipment from China. Defense Minister Sydney Sekeramayi helped Mugabe negotiate the deal. The arms reportedly cost $240 million by themselves. A shipload of the Chinese-made armored personnel carriers (APC), riot gear, and water cannons arrived on November 17th, and another load of APCs in January of 2005. The implementing Chinese organization for this project is unknown.

title: China to Bail Out Ailing Zimbabwean Parastatals
description: On November 19, 2004, In the framework of his economy policy for 2005/6, Zimbabwean Acting Finance Minister Herbert Murerwa announced that China will play a key role in propping up Zimbabwe's ailing parastatals. Zimbabwe foresees 'ceding control' over most of its loss-making parastatals to China, but will also receive loans for the rehabilitation of others. Both countries have recently signed an investment agreement to underpin this support (see Zimbabwe: 4 November 2004: 'Look East' Investment Agreement BetweenZimbabwe and China).Significance: A number of Zimbabwe's parastatals are in a decrepit state, brought down by foreign-exchange shortages and, probably more importantly, outright mismanagement, and continue to be a drain on public resources (see Zimbabwe: 9 November 2004: Reserve Bank of Zimbabwe GovernorCriticisesGovernment ExpendituresonParastatals). This formal announcement indicates that the cash-strapped Zimbabwean government is running out of room to manoeuvre. For President Robert Mugabe's regime, the Chinese support - driven by China's need to ensure access to commodities, but also its search of markets for its manufactured goods - is more than welcome. China's government has less issues with governance and human rights concerns, to the extent that it is willing to supply Zimbabwe with weapons (see Zimbabwe: 1 November 2004: Zimbabwe to Swap Weapons for Market Access with China?). Moreover, China has the economic means to easily give Zimbabwe the financial support needed. However, its growing presence in Zimbabwe has not been met with a warm welcome from Zimbabwe's manufacturers, who have been priced out of the market (see Zimbabwe: 21 September 2004: Zimbabwe's 'Look East' Policy Meets with Local Resistance). The Confederation of Zimbabwe states that 40 companies have closed down after losing their market share to Chinese competition.Document WDAN000020041119e0bj0002o

title: Zongo II Hydroelectric Power Plant (Duplicate of 460)
description: China will loan Democratic Republic of Congo $367.5 million to construct a 150 megawatt hydroelectric plant in southwest Bas-Congo province, according to the Chinese embassy in the central African nation.The Zongo II plant will be built by Sinohydro Corp., China’s largest water projects developer, with concessional loans from China’s Export Import Bank. Construction will take three years, creating 2,000 temporary and 300 permanent jobs, said the statement, which was published on the embassy’s website.Congolese Finance Minister Matata Ponyo, who signed the agreement Jan. 29, was in a meeting when contacted by phone and did not immediately respond to requests for comment by e-mail.In 2008, Congo and China signed a $9 billion deal to swap minerals for infrastructure projects. The total amount of the deal was reduced in 2009 to about $6 billion at the request of theInternational Monetary Fund, which said the debt load was unsustainable.Only about 9 percent of Congolese had electricity in 2010, according to Congo’s Ministry of Energy.
donor_agency: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency

title: China sends 11th peacekeeping mission to Liberia (duplicate with ID: 1732)
description: 日前，中宣部在人民大会堂隆重举行了“蓝盔铁汉”江汉刚先进事迹报告会，而由他所在集团军组建的中国第十一批赴利比里亚维和运输分队第一梯队120名官兵，也在今天奔赴北京国际机场，乘包机飞往利比里亚首都蒙罗维亚，履行维护世界和平的神圣使命。    根据联合国维和部队轮换要求，此次轮换的运输分队共有240名官兵，计划分两梯队前往利比里亚，第二梯队人员将于12月27日从北京出发前往任务区。中国赴利维和运输分队是联合国利比里亚特派团直属的唯一专业运输分队，担负着利比里亚境内所有维和部队的装备器材、生活物资、值勤用油的运输保障和部队部署换防任务，同时执行国际援助物资、援建物资的运送、难民和前武装人员的遣返等任务。    江汉刚所在集团军的官兵们，在得知集团军组建赴利比里亚维和运输分队的消息后，踊跃报名，积极请战，以实际行动掀起了“忠实履行使命，维和世界和平”的热潮。大家纷纷表示，要努力学习“蓝盔铁汉”江汉刚的先进事迹和维和精神，在国际维和战场上争当一名维和尖兵，为世界和平发展做出贡献。    中国第十一批赴利比里亚维和运输分队组建后，部队严格按照《联合国维和训练与考核大纲》要求组织训练，经过一个半月的国内封闭式强化训练后，分队官兵基本具备了在各种复杂条件下独立执勤、自我保障、野外生存等维和能力。
sector: Humanitarian and Disaster Relief and Preparation
donor_agency_count: Chinese Government, Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Chinese Government, Government Agency

title: Zimbabwe to Import Fertiliser from China
description: The Zimbabwe government will import around 387,000 tons of fertiliser from China to narrow the gap in the domestic market. Zimbabwe, which has been self-sufficient in fertiliser production during the past, has secured a US$490 million loan facility from China in recent weeks, of which US$200 million is earmarked for agro-support (see Zimbabwe: 14 September 2006: ). The loan facility will not only be used to import fertiliser but will also be directed towards the payment for agricultural equipment, chemicals and other critical requirements. The shipment is expected to reach Zimbabwe in early October 2006.Significance: Although Zimbabwe received more than adequate rainfall during the 2005/2006 agricultural season, the country remained dependant on grain and maize imports to supply in the domestic demand of the country.The below-average agricultural year was the result of severe shortages in foreign exchange that increases the lack of much needed agricultural inputs such as fertiliser and fuel. The latest financing secured by the Zimbabwe government, the first since the controversial land reform programme was introduced in 2000, could alleviate some of the demand pressures for fertilisers. It remains to be seen if the necessary input will reach farmers in time to ensure a better harvest, especially in the tobacco sector, this year.Document WDAN000020060928e29s00039

title: China pledges over $3B in loans to Zimbabwe
description: UN Food Agency to Scale Back Aid to Zimbabwe, as China Steps InKissy Agyeman423 words15 November 2006Global Insight Daily AnalysisWDANEnglishCopyright 2006, Global Insight Limited. All Rights Reserved.As Zimbabwe approaches its lean season—when the previous year's harvest runs low and the current year's harvest is not yet in—the prospect of food shortages is becoming a grave reality for an estimated 1.4 million Zimbabweans. The UN’s food agency, the World Food Programme (WFP), announced earlier this week that it will have to scale back the amount of aid it gives to the Zimbabwean population because donor funding is at an all-time low. The low levels of donor assistance are being attributed to the fact that the Zimbabwean authorities have repeatedly announced that the country can indeed take care of its food shortages, while expecting bumper crops in the November harvest (see Zimbabwe: 12 October 2006: ). However, the WPF has announced that of the 65,000 tonnes of grain necessary to sustain the population, only 39,000 tonnes could be provided because of a shortage of funds.According to an aid agency based in Zimbabwe, Christian Care, the situation continues to look bleak and the places worst affected are the arid areas situated in the region of Lowveld in Masvingo province, Matabeleland North, and Matabeland South. It has been predicted that rampant inflation will cause the number of those in dire need of food assistance to increase to 2 million in the near future. This announcement comes at a time when the Chinese authorities have pledged to disburse US$3 billion inpreferential loans to Zimbabwe. Significance: It is feared that a general decline in agricultural productivity across the whole of southern Africa will occur in the not-too-distant future, fuelled by several factors, including the scarcity of resources, hampering countries’ abilities to purchase various inputs such as fertiliser. Also, deforestation, land degradation, and climate change pose a significant threat to food security. For Zimbabwe, however, the situation may be alleviated by the Chinese government's pledge to disburse US$3 billion in preferential loans to Zimbabwe, following the caucus which took place in Beijing last week. China has also despatched some 22,000 tonnes of fertiliser to Zimbabwe, which is said to be the first shipment of its kind, out of an estimated 200,000 tonnes. Therefore, with China offering the chance to form a 'strategic partnership' with Zimbabwe, there could be a shift in the traditional axis of support for the country, with more emphasis being placed on the 'Look East' policy as a remedy to poverty.Document WDAN000020061115e2bf0002o

title: Zimbabwe, China to Negotiate Us$2bn Deal
description: Harare, Dec 22, 2006 (The Herald/All Africa Global Media via COMTEX) --ZIMBABWE and China will soon open negotiations for a US$2 billion loan facility to help stabilise the economy, Zimbabwe's Ambassador to China, Mr Chris Mutsvangwa, said yesterday.'China's government is ready to negotiate with the Government for a US$2 billion loan facility to help it fight inflation and other aspects of the economy,' said Ambassador Mutsvangwa.He said the Chinese government had appointed a project officer to handle the matter and would soon start talks with Finance Minister Cde Herbert Murerwa and Reserve Bank Governor Dr Gideon Gono.Cde Mutsvangwa said this at a ceremony in Harare at which the Chinese government handed over more than 22 000 metric tonnes of compound D fertilizer for Zimbabwe's agricultural sector.He said China's assistance to Zimbabwe would help to dispel the myth perpetuated by the United States and Europe that the country's economy has collapsed beyond redemption.In a speech read on her behalf by Cde Murerwa, Vice President Joice Mujuru commended the Chinese government for its concerted efforts and support aimed at stabilising and expanding Zimbabwe's productive base.'The support being extended to us by the People's Republic of China is critical as it comes at a time when we have embarked on an agricultural revival programme.'The timely delivery of agricultural inputs and good rains we are receiving will ensure the achievement of the projected growth rate of 9,4 percent in the agriculture sector in 2007,' said Cde Mujuru.The fertilizer consignment was procured under the US$200 million buyers credit loan facility from the Export and Import Bank of China.Cde Mujuru said the facility demonstrated the strong multi-faceted bilateral relations that existed between the two countries.She said the bilateral relations which date back to the days of the liberation struggle were now bearing fruit in several areas of economic co-operation.Chinese Ambassador to Zimbabwe Mr Yuan Nansheng said the fertilizer was the first consignment shipped from China to Africa following the Sino-African Summit held in Beijing last month.'What we see here is only a small part of the whole consignment. I do hope that those goods will work best for the current agricultural season in Zimbabwe,' said Mr Yuan.He said he was delighted that Sino-Zimbabwe trade and economic co-operation were growing at a fast rate.'Those scopes of co-operation are expanding constantly. Gratifying achievements have been made in the fields of trade, investment and contracting between our two countries.'All these have laid a very solid foundation for the further development of our economic and trade relations,' he said.Mr Yuan said the win-win economic and trade relations between China and Zimbabwe would serve as a strong driving force for common development and shared prosperity.Document AFNWS00020061222e2cm000hm

title: Consignment of tractors and farming equipment
description: Harare, Nov 02, 2007 (The Herald/All Africa Global Media via COMTEX) -- A Consignment of 1 000 more tractors and an assortment of other related farming implements worth US$100 million from China is expected to arrive in Zimbabwe in three months' time.The implements, which include combine harvesters, irrigation pumps, disc harrows, planters and electricity generators, among others, went onto the sea last week, after undergoing compliance inspection tests from a team of Zimbabwean Government officials. They are now on their way home. In an interview on the sidelines of the China International Travel Mart, Zimbabwe's Ambassador to China, Cde Frederick Shava, said the consignment was the last batch of equipment procured from a US$200 million Chinese government loan.'As we are speaking, the consignment is now on the high seas on its way home. The consignment includes 1 000 tractors, combine harvesters, generators and planters plus several other related equipment. 'The generators in particular, will alleviate electricity outages in irrigation areas where we plant out winter crops,' said Cde Shava. He said although the equipment will arrive home way into the summer farming season, it was important to note that the equipment could not be shipped until the Government sent inspectors for compliance purposes.'The equipment might get home way into the summer farming season but we are sure that it is compliant to our needs because our inspectors who came here recently approved the consignment after carrying out tests. 'The pre-shipment team had to come first to inspect the equipment. By the end of November or beginning of December, we should see the consignment starting to arrive home but by mid-farming season, the entire consignment should have landed home.'Our winter farming season should be different from the previous one, as we have moved to alleviate power outages,' Cde Shava said.All Africa Global MediaDocument AFNWS00020071102e3b20008f

title: Chinese military training in Zimbabwe
description: Continued assistance from project #18379China Vows Support170 words7 March 200805:49 AMAll AfricaAFNWSEnglish(c) 2008 AllAfrica, All Rights ReservedHarare, Mar 07, 2008 (The Herald/All Africa Global Media via COMTEX) -- The People's Republic ofChina will continue giving the Zimbabwe Defence Forces more technical support to boost the cordial relations between the two countries, head of the People's Liberation Army Instructors Training Team has said.Speaking at a welcome and farewell reception for PLAITT officers attached to the Zimbabwe Defence Forces, Senior Colonel Sun Xu hailed the friendship between the two countries. Col Xu said that his country would assist Zimbabwe in all aspects including agricultural development. 'China will continue to work with the Zimbabwe Defence Forces and we will continue to make contribution to build the friendship between the two countries. 'We would also continue to offer technical assistance to Zimbabwe even in agriculture so that farmers can produce sufficient food for the people,' he said.Snr Col Xu said Zimbabwe boasts of vast tracts of fertile lands that could be sufficiently utilised hence the need for technical assistance from other countries.All Africa Global MediaDocument AFNWS00020080307e437000ki-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Zimbabwe: Army chief lauds China's 'continued' support, military training179 words7 March 200801:29 PMBBC Monitoring AfricaBBCAPEnglish(c) 2008 The British Broadcasting Corporation. All Rights Reserved. No material may be reproduced except with the express permission of The British Broadcasting Corporation.Text of report by Zimbabwean TV on 6 March[Presenter] The Zimbabwe Defence Forces has commended the People's Republic of China for their continued support in the military, peacekeeping and technical fields. Let us hear more from our correspondent.[Correspondent] Speaking at a function to bid farewell and receive the incoming group of Chinese army instructors' training teams at the army headquarters in the capital Harare, army commander General Constantine Chiwenga commended the People's Republic of China for its continued support of the country. He said the Chinese people have continued to train the Zimbabwean defence forces. The army commander said the training is continuing to give skills to the army inaid of defending sovereignty, peace and national independence of Zimbabwe. The relationship between China and Zimbabwe dates back to the days of the liberation struggle when Chinese instructors trained a number of Zimbabwean comrades in China and as well as the Republic of Tanzania.Source: ZTV1, Harare, in Shona 1530 gmt 6 Mar 08a7d63f4fThe British Broadcasting CorporationDocument BBCAP00020080307e437002xl

title: Expansion of the Port of Dar es Salaam (Commitment post 2011)
description: In a brief press conference by Tanzania Port Authority's Director General Ephraim Mgawe he said after a master plan study of Dar e salaam port authority in 2009, the finding showed that Dar es Salaam Port needed two more berths for handling container traffic. 'A Chinese Communication Construction Company Limited carried out a feasibility study for developing two berths.The study ended in May 2010. The scope of work entails construction of two berths, dredging of entrance channel and creation of a container stacking yard among many other things,' he said. The study indicated that the two more berths would increase efficiency of Dar es Salaam Port.The improvement to entrance channel and associated structure would allow entry of large vessels. 'The project is estimated to cost 524 million US dollars. However, the negotiation on project finances between the government of Tanzania and the China Exim bank are in progress, ' said the DG.'This is after submission of an official application by the government of Tanzania to the Exim Bank of China for concessional loan to finance construction of the project,' he added. Minister for Transport, Eng Omari Nundu said there were approximately 12 companies who had shown interest in building the two berths.

title: MoU for infrastructure
description: In 2004, Mozambican President Joachim Chissano signed an MoU with the Chinese government regarding dams and irrigation systems, possible Chinese involvement in reconstructing the Sena rail line, which was destroyed in the civil war, the reactivation of the Moatize coal mines, the resumed construction of the Mocuba textile factory, assistance with increased agricultural production (especially cash crops like cotton and cashews), and parliamentary exchanges to deepen the relations between the two countries. The meeting was sealed with a $3.6 million USD  grant in development aid.

title: 2 Primary Rural Schools (Duplicate)
description: ''In addition, the Chinese government helped Botswana improve her educational infrastructure,' said the Chinese ambassador.As one of the follow-up actions of Beijing Summit of Forum on China-Africa Cooperation (FOCAC), the Chinese government donated two rural primary schools to Botswana -- one in Serowe in the central part of the Southern African country and Maun in the Ngamiland district of Botswana. Each school comprises classroom blocks, library, kitchen, staff offices and outdoor sport facilities.'

title: Building Processing Factories and Providing technical and management training
description: BEIJING, Jan. 15 (Xinhua) -- Resources cooperation between China and Africa will help Africa to realize sustainable development, Chinese experts on African studies told Xinhua in recent interviews. In a policy paper aimed at strengthening its ties with Africa, China is working to explore the prospect of Sino-African cooperation in 30 concrete fields. In China's first-ever African Policy Paper released here Thursday, China highlighted its readiness to facilitate information sharing and cooperation with Africa in resources development. 'To translate Africa's advantages in resources to competitive strength, and to realize sustainable development in Africa is our aim in the resources cooperation,' said Wang Yingying, a researcher on African studies with the China Institute of International Studies. Despite their remarkable economic growth in recent years, African countries are still vulnerable in their economy as the majority of their exports are unprocessed raw materials, Wang said. China has helped African countries build processing factories and provided technical and management training courses in a bid to increase the added value of their exported commodities, thus increasing the competitiveness of their products. The Chinese government encourages and supports competent Chinese enterprises to cooperate with African nations in developing and exploiting rationally their resources. 'While the Chinese enterprises are involved in resources exploitation in Africa, they contribute to the continent's development at the same time,' Wang said. Elaborating her viewpoint, she said that China refunds the profits it has earned by reinvesting in infrastructure construction such as building power stations. 'The investment has brought real benefits to people in Africa and the continent as a whole,' the researcher said. 'Unlike some western countries, China's cooperation with African countries is based on boosting sustainable development in Africa,' Wang said. While developing oil, iron ore and mineral resources in Africa, China pays much attention to protection of local environment, she said, adding, 'We also help train personnel in various fields in an effort to guarantee sustainable development in Africa.' An Yongyu, president of the China Society for African Studies, said China sticks to a policy of sustainable development. Consequently, it lays stress on sustainable reproduction of resources in its cooperation with African countries. For example, An said, when exploiting forest resources in Gabon, China adopted a method of planting saplings at the same time to make it renewable. Currently, many African-made products are sold 'cheaply' due to their unfavorable position on the world market, causing huge losses to these countries. In energy cooperation with African countries, China purchased their products at a reasonable price in international market in stead of forcing prices down, said An, who used to serve as former Chinese ambassador to several African countries. 'These examples show that China does attach importance to sustainable development in Africa,' An said.

title: Cancelling 31 African countries' debts totalling US $1.27 billion
description: Beijing has fulfilled its commitment by cancelling 31 African countries' debts totalling US $1.27 billion.

title: Chinese-Gabonese industrial fishing and timber companies
description: The cooperation between Gabon and China, which have had diplomatic relations since 1974, is not limited to the health sector since there is a Chinese-Gabonese industrial fishing company and two timber products manufacturing companies. Furthermore, China funded and built the [Gabonese] National Assembly building and is currently building the senate's building. '新华网利伯维尔２月１日电（记者毛雪良 任亚秋）中国和加蓬建交３０周年之际，中国国家主席胡锦涛应加蓬总统邦戈的邀请，将于２月１日至３日对加蓬进行国事访问。这次访问必将把两国关系推向新的高度，为两国友好合作谱写新的历史篇章。　　中国和加蓬１９７４年４月建交以来，两国关系发展顺利。尤其是进入新世纪以来，两国在政治、经贸、军事、文教、司法、科技和医药卫生等领域的交往与合作不断扩大和深化，双边关系开始形成多层次、全方位发展的格局并呈现出蓬勃发展的势头。　　中加关系的一个显著特点是，双方政治交往频繁，保持高层互访势头，为两国发展长期友好合作打下了坚实的基础。加蓬总统邦戈曾先后８次访华，他称中国是可信赖的朋友。加蓬政府一贯坚持一个中国的立场，支持中国统一大业。新世纪以来，加蓬总检察长、国防部长、文化部长、外交国务部长等相继访华。时任中共中央政治局常委、书记处书记尉健行，时任中国外交部长唐家璇等也分别率团访问了加蓬。　　政治关系的稳定发展为中加两国经贸和技术合作提供了良好契机。加蓬地处非洲中西部，自然资源极其丰富，享有“资源宝库”和“绿金之国”的美誉，是非洲木材、石油和锰矿砂生产大国。长期以来，两国始终在经济和贸易领域等保持着积极合作。　　建交以来，两国经济技术合作方兴未艾，涉及农业、渔业、公共工程、文化教育和医疗卫生等领域。两国已成功实施了多个合资、合作项目，其中包括中加渔业公司、投资贸易促进中心、中加制药厂等。目前双方正就实施加蓬广电大厦项目进行协商。该项目系中国在加蓬的第一个出口信贷项目，将对中加经贸合作多样化和拓宽两国合作领域起到积极推动作用。　　与此同时，两国贸易也取得了长足发展，双边贸易额已从１９９４年的８８００万美元上升到２００３年的约３亿美元。加蓬已成为中国在中西非地区的第二大贸易伙伴。中方主要从加蓬进口木材、原油和锰矿砂等，向加蓬出口纺织品、日用品、小五金、家用电器及机电产品。中加经贸合作互利互补，前景广阔。两国政府均表示，将继续采取措施鼓励两国商界增加往来，加强合作。　　中加建交后，中国向加蓬提供了大量无私援助，为增强两国友好关系发挥了积极作用。１９７４年以来，中国向加蓬提供的各种经援已超过８亿元人民币。中方还在加蓬承担了许多技术合作项目，目前已完成的有１０个，其中包括加蓬国民议会大厦、利伯维尔中加合作医院、弗朗斯维尔中加友谊医院等。包括总统邦戈在内的加蓬许多政要称赞２００１年启用的加蓬国民议会大厦是“加中两国友谊的丰碑，加蓬人民的骄傲”。目前，中国正在加蓬首都实施加蓬参议院大厦项目。　　中非合作论坛部长级会议２０００年１０月召开以来，中国和加蓬两国人员往来不断，中国在外交、经济、军事、教育、科技和医药等领域对加蓬人员的培训力度明显加大。　　当地舆论认为，胡锦涛主席对加蓬的访问，将为两国关系长期稳定和健康发展奠定更加坚实的基础。'

title: zero tariff opportunity (Duplicate)
description: Meanwhile, Prime Minister Meles said the Ethio-Chinese trade and investment cooperation would further be strengthened. After holding discussions with Chinese Vice-chairman of Foreign Affairs Committee in the National People's Congress Ji Peiding, Meles said the trade and investment cooperation of the two countries should further be strengthened. Ethiopia had exported various agricultural products to China last year at zero-tariff opportunity offered by the Chinese government, Meles said. The Ethio-Chinese bilateral relations have reached to higher level presently, he said adding that the ever-growing bilateral ties of the two sisterly countries should be intensified. The participation of the Chinese entrepreneurs in development of infrastructure in the country has been increasing from time to time, the spokesperson of the ministry said. Briefing journalists after the discussion Peiding said the Ethio-Chinese bilateral ties has reached to a higher level. Meanwhile, Speaker of the House of Federation said that the economic cooperation between Ethiopia and China has been expanding. Receiving a Chinese delegation led by Mr. Ji Peiding, Vice Chairman of the Chinese Standing Committee of the National Peoples' Congress (NPC) yesterday, Degife Bula said that the volume of trade and investment between the two countries is encouraging. Ethiopia is looking forward to see more Chinese investors to invest in Ethiopia, he said. Degife said Ethiopians have a lot to learn from Chinese people success stories in their fight against poverty, backwardness and nation-building in general. The Speaker expressed the desire and profound hope of the Ethiopian people that the existing excellent political and diplomatic relations between the two countries be backed by solid economic interdependence. Mr. Ji Peiding on his part said that the two countries should add extra efforts with a view to further strengthening the existing Ethio-Chinese economic relation. China has registered dramatic economic growth over the past 27 years, Mr. Peiding said, and added that its annual revenue has reached 2.3 trillion USD. The Chinese government has been exerting efforts aimed at improving the livelihood of the public, the Vice Chairman indicated. China has a population of 1.3 billion.

title: Chinese firms have invested more than $70 million (Not project level)
description: (Copyright (c) 2007, Dow Jones   Company, Inc.) BEIJING -- An attack that killed nine Chinese oil workers in Ethiopia's desolate Ogaden Desert has provided a bloody reminder that China's world-wide pursuit of raw materials has taken it into some rough neighborhoods -- and that goodwill proclamations may not be enough to avoid getting caught up in local conflicts. Exposure to the military and political struggles that convulse Africa is one of the prices this fast-developing country is paying for its growing power and profile on the world stage. It is a new sensation for most Chinese, who are used to considering their country an economic actor that, unlike traditional powers, avoids interference in the domestic affairs of other nations. The nine Chinese were among 74 people reported killed shortly after dawn Tuesday in the desert of eastern Ethiopia. In addition, Chinese authorities said, seven Chinese oil technicians were kidnapped by the ethnic-Somali rebels who launched the raid. [But the group said it is only holding six Chinese workers, according to an Associated Press report on Thursday.] The captives joined a growing list. Already this year, 16 Chinese oil workers have been kidnapped in Nigeria and a Chinese engineer was killed and another injured in Kenya. The questions facing Chinese President Hu Jintao's government are twofold: how to better protect the four million Chinese working abroad and how to preserve the growing value of Chinese investments in places such as Ethiopia, where governments face instability. [On Thursday, China said it won't stop investing in Africa but plans to boost security measures, the AP reported.] 'China now faces the dilemma of any country that undertakes an active foreign policy, particularly one with a foreign policy in no small part based on the acquisition of resources,' said an analysis by Stratfor, a security-consulting firm based in Austin, Texas. 'It must now decide how much to get involved in other countries' internal security issues.' He Wenping, head of Africa studies at the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences, said safety issues were becoming increasingly important as the number of Chinese working abroad multiplies. Ms. He suggested to Beijing's Global Times newspaper Wednesday that Chinese companies evaluate the security situation before starting a project abroad. This is a sensitive political issue here. The Chinese public seems increasingly to demand that compatriots abroad be taken care of, even as the government expresses a determination to avoid involvement in local conflicts. Moreover, the urge to prop up endangered governments to preserve Chinese investments would go against its long tradition of noninterference. Reflecting the sensitivities, Communist Party censors sought Wednesday to limit comment on Internet sites about the killings in Ethiopia, according to site operators. But some telling observations got through the filters. 'If you want to make money there, why wouldn't you send your own troops to provide security?' one contributor wrote. 'It seems we should learn from the early colonial powers.' The Foreign Ministry, however, has long contended that China's economic activities in Africa are designed to benefit African countries and that China has no stake in the local political situation. Chinese officials repeatedly have said they have no desire to repeat the exploitative policies of colonial powers, which subjugated Africa to serve as a reliable source of raw materials and a market for exports. This was a major theme of a China-Africa summit in Beijing in November, when nearly 50 African heads of state and ministers gathered to proclaim friendship with China and discuss investment and aid. It also has been a major theme for Chinese leaders on frequent visits to Africa, including Mr. Hu's tour of eight countries in February. The pledge was repeated this week by Jia Qinglin, a member of the Politburo Standing Committee, shown on the front pages of official newspapers Tuesday -- the day of the Ethiopia attack -- being greeted by dancing women on arrival in Kenya. 'Chinese economic activities in African countries are on the basis of cooperation and friendship,' said Liu Lide, a retired ambassador who spent 22 years as a Chinese envoy in Africa. 'That's the context in which we encourage Chinese companies to go to Africa and invest. We want to work not only with African governments but also with African people, particularly businessmen.' As China's economic footprint grows, however, its policies have brought increasing criticism from African opposition groups that contend China's noninterventionism props up unpopular governments. In Tuesday's attack, the target was an exploratory drilling site run by a subsidiary of the China Petroleum   Chemical Corp., known as Sinopec that has operations in a dozen countries. The oil field was guarded by a 100-strong contingent of Ethiopian soldiers. China was Ethiopia's largest trading partner in 2006, with $450 million in exchanges. Chinese firms have invested more than $70 million in Ethiopia, and Beijing has provided road- and school-construction aid. 'These people had bad intentions,' said Mr. Liu, the former ambassador, speaking of the rebels who carried out the attack. 'Their goal was to sabotage China's relations with the Ethiopian government.'

title: 中国中铁拟投资18.33亿美元开发刚果铜钴矿 (Duplicate)
description: '世华财讯 中国中铁(601390行情,股吧)与中水电组成的中国企业集团与刚果矿业签署合资协议，各方拟合资设立公司投资开发刚果铜钴矿资源项目及建设基础设施项目。其中，中国中铁有关的金额约为18.33亿美元。　　中国中铁(601390)4月23日发布公告称，公司于2008年4月22日与中国水利水电建设集团公司及刚果民主共和国政府签署《关于刚果民主共和国矿业开发和基础设施建设的合作协议》。根据合作协议，公司的全资附属公司中国中铁（香港）有限公司、中国中铁华刚矿业股份有限公司及中国中铁资源开发股份有限公司与中水电的全资子公司中国水电建设集团国际工程有限公司、中国水电建设集团港航建设有限公司以及LaSino-Congolaisedes Mines（刚果国家矿业总公司）和GILBERTKALAMBABANIKA先生于2008年4月22日就成立合资公司签订了《设立合资公司协议》，各方将以'项目换资源'模式投资开发铜钴矿资源项目及建设刚果（金）基础设施项目。　　投资各方在刚果按刚果法律成立一家股份有限公司，名为Societe par Actions aResponsabiliteLimitee（华刚矿业股份有限公司），注册资本为1亿美元。其中，中铁香港、中铁华刚、中铁资源、中水国际、中水港航、刚果矿业及GILBERTKALAMBABANIKA先生分别持有合资公司20%，9.9%，13.1%，20%，5%，20%及12%的股权。各方出资方式均为现金，其中公司所属投资方将利用内部现金资源提供认购价款所需资金。合资公司设立后将从事矿产开发。　　根据协议，刚果矿业应将其拥有的位于刚果的铜钴矿区的采矿权转让予合资公司。根据初步的可行性研究分析，该矿区已探明的铜储量约680万吨、钴储量约42万吨、铜品位为3.3%，而钴品位为0.24%。根据北京山海天评估咨询公司就相关矿权出具的评估报告，截至2007年12月31日的评估价值约为19亿美元。　　根据公司聘请的专业机构中国恩菲工程技术有限公司进行的初步调研，中国企业集团需负责的前述贷款及融资的总额约为29亿美元，其中公司所属投资方应负责贷款及融资约18.33亿美元，中水电所属投资方应负责贷款及融资约10.67亿美元。公司所属投资方负责的约18.33亿美元的贷款及融资中约有5.5亿美元为无息贷款，其余约12.83亿美元为协助安排提供之融资（适用6.1%的年利率）；中水电所属投资方提供的约10.67亿美元的贷款及融资中约有3.2亿美元为无息贷款，其余约7.47亿美元为协助安排提供之融资（适用6.1%的年利率）。　　公司表示，该项目的实施将使公司既以合理价格获得国外的优质铜钴矿产资源，通过矿产资源开发获得较好的收益；又能以比较简捷的方式获取大额的、非竞争性的基建项目国际工程承包业务，在短期内扩大海外市场份额。公司将可从这两个方面获得战略收益并增加参与国际竞争的实力。 '

title: New Customs Building (Duplicate of 23231)
description: 22 January 2008Three of the biggest Chinese projects will be in Nigeria, Zambia and Tanzania, each ranked in the seventh category by Sinosure. One involves a US$250m copper smelter in Chambishi, Zambia, and another, the expansion of the port of Dar-es-Salaam in Tanzania, where China has already constructed a new customs building. Exports of copper from Chambishi will go through the port.
