title: Youyi Building (duplicate)
description: 'Aug 03, 2001 (Standard Times/All Africa Global Media via COMTEX)-The 30th Anniversary marking Sierra Leone-China Friendship Association has been warmly observed at the China House entertainment complex, King Harman Road Freetown. Gracing the occasion, the Chinese Envoy to Sierra Leone, His Excellency Ambassador Yu Wazhen described July 29th this year, which marked the 30th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the Peoples Republic of China and the Republic of Sierra Leone as a day worthy of jubilation. He said during these 30 years the two countries carried out effective and extensive economic and trade cooperation.'On many international issues the two countries have shared identical or similar views,' he noted. In his address, Sierra Leone's Foreign Minister, Dr. Ramandan Dumbuya said the Sierra Leone-China Friendship Society is one of a social organisation that has stood the test of time in this country, adding that through this organisation Sierra Leoneans and Chinese have learnt quite a lot about each other's culture and that many Sierra Leoneans who are registered members of this club have been privileged to visit the Peoples Republic of China and have a taste of their own culture.The Association, he said, has also sponsored a number of projects in Sierra Leone such as the magnificent China House complex. The Chairman of the Sierra Leone-China Friendship Association, Dr. Bobson Sesay commended the association for maintaining a long and difficult relationship of economic and diplomatic co-existence. Highlighting some of the assistance giving to Sierra Leoneans by the Association, Dr.Sesay said currently some students at the College of Medicine and Allied Health Sciences are on Chinese scholarships.He mentioned the construction of the Youyi Building and the China House which he said were products of that friendship. Secretary General of the association who is also lecturer at the Milton Margai College of Education and Technology, Mr Bassie Bangura thanked the Peoples Republic of China for their assistance to Sierra Leone and hoped the cordial relationship will continue to grow day by day.by Mohamed KakayCopyright Standard Times. Distributed by All Africa Global Media(AllAfrica.com)KEYWORD:     Sierra Leone.Document afnws00020021107dx83021fn'

title: (NOT A PROJECT?) China Investments in The Country Hits N888 Billion
description: 'Abuja, Oct 28, 2009 (Daily Trust/All Africa Global Media via COMTEX) -- China's investment in Nigeria has reach about N888 billion ($6 billion), the National President of the National Association of Nigerian Traders (NANTS) has said.Barrister Ken Ukaoha said yesterday in Abuja at the opening of a 3-day workshop that oil and gas account for 75 percent of the figure.The workshop was titled: 'Impact of China Africa Trade Relations: the case study of Nigeria.'He said China has over 30 solely owned companies or joint venture in Nigeria that is actively involved in the construction, oil and gas, technology, services and education sectors of the economy.He said China's exports to Nigeria includes, motorcycles, machinery equipment, auto parts, rubber tires, chemical products, textiles and garments and footwear, while exports from Nigeria to China include mineral fuel and lubricants, followed by crude materials.He said though formal trade between China and Nigeria did not begin until 38 years ago, Chinese traders and industrialists have established themselves in Nigeria since 1960sHe said after 38 years in Nigeria, Chinese products have found its way into every streets in Nigeria, adding that even in the face of import bans and prohibitions as well as other tariff and non tariff barriers, the role of smuggling by Nigerian importers and Chinese nationals have helped popularize Chinese products in Nigeria.He said that apart from South Africa, Nigeria is China's largest trading partner in Africa, adding, that more recently Nigeria's trade relations with China has evolved into a new China Africa Strategic partnership based on a win -win relationship.Ukaoha said that Chinese industrialists have been able to penetrate the African markets because of the cheap price of their products and the consideration of the low purchasing power of most developing countries.He advised Nigerian industrialists to emulate the Chinese strategies in order to develop the industrial sector. '

title: Donation of books and experimental equipment to Egerton University (Duplicate)
description: 近日，新华社记者在非洲采访并专题报道了我校对肯尼亚埃格顿大学的援助项目。10月27日，专题片通过新华社新媒体——中国新华新闻电视网英语电视台（CNC WORLD）在“全球视线（WORLD PERSPECTIVE）”栏目向全球播出。     在全长20分钟的专题片中，记者采访了我校长期派驻埃格顿大学参与教育援外项目的吴琴生和刘高琼两位教授，介绍了他们克服各种困难，长期坚守在肯尼亚，积极开展实用农业技术研究与推广的事迹。由于埃格顿大学地处高原，虽属热带气候，但常年气温较低，蔬菜花卉等园艺产量较低。两位中国教授将大棚温室技术在当地进行示范和推广，大大改变了当地的农业生产面貌并提高了效益，深受当地政府和农民的欢迎。       新华社记者还专门对我校从2008年起每年在埃格顿大学举办的农业生产技术培训班进行了宣传报道。每年我校均派出专家教授赴埃格顿大学为肯尼亚和周边共8个非洲国家培训近百名农业技术人员，同时也对埃格顿大学进行了对口援建，捐赠了大量图书资料和实验仪器设备，为增加非洲国家农民收入，推动其农业发展做出积极的贡献。     在记者采访中，吴琴生和刘高琼教授在埃格顿大学的同事和学生纷纷对他们做出的贡献表达了钦佩和敬意。他们十多年如一日，在艰苦的环境中默默坚守和无私奉献，是什么样的精神在支撑着他们？专题片结尾处吴琴生教授的一番话做出了明确的回答：“当我们踏上这片土地时，一种责任感和使命感油然而生，如果能利用我们所知道的为当地人提供一些力所能及的帮助，何乐而不为？”     据悉，中国新华新闻电视网英语电视台（CNCWORLD）是隶属新华社旗下的全新媒体，是一个全天24小时不间断播出的全英语电视新闻频道，设有“全球视线（WORLD PERSPECTIVE）”、“中国报道（CHINA REPORT）”等十余个栏目。该电视台自自去年开播以来，至今已通过卫星将信号覆盖到全球范围，并正酝酿签署协议，进入美英等西方国家的有线电视网络。而本次新华社拍摄的报道我校援肯项目的专题片是其宣传我国援非政策和成果的系列专题片“中国人在非洲”中率先制作完成并播出的第一集。同时，新华社记者就此次采访而撰写的专题文字报道也被肯尼亚国内的主流报纸媒体Kenya Today以整版篇幅登载。

title: Eastern Bypass Road connecting Kenya, Ethiopia
description: In August 2008, Chinese engineers began laying down the 530 km of tarmac from Isiolo to Moyale to replace a rock track. China Wu Yi built the road with 4.3 billion Kenya shillings from the African Development Bank and the Kenyan government.The Northern and Eastern Bypasses were inaugurated on August 21, 2009, and cost a total of 8.5 billion shillings.The Chinese government provided 85% of the financing through a concessional loan arrangement, with the Kenyan government providing the balance.

title: Niger River Dam
description: After an initial struggle to find financing, Niger commenced with the construction of a dam in August 2008 with 50 million USD from the Islamic Development Bank. Then, in July 2009, the China Geo-Engineering Corporation was awarded the contract to continue the dam in Kandadji. In july, the total investment required was estimated at 250 million USD. Although it was speculated that the construction would win a loan from China, reports of a Chinese loan have not been found, and the current status of the project remains in implementation. The dam is due online in 2013 and is part of a larger project that will cost 300 billion XAF.

description: On April 12, 2009, Huawei Technologies Co., Ltd. won a contract with Libya Telecom and Technology (LTT) to deply a fiberoptic network in Libya. Phase 1 of the project was to reach 800 homes, and phase 2 would expand that network. In 2011, Huawei was forced to halt it's fiber optic projects. title: Zimbabwe Government Buys 200 Buses From China
description: On August 17, 2007, the Zimbabwean government and state-owned Zimbabwe United Passenger Company (ZUPCO), placed an order for 200 buses and 100 bus engines from an undisclosed Chinese sources to help upgrade and refurbish their existing rural bus fleet of AVM and DAF buses. The deal is to be financed by the Reserve Bank of Zimbabwe (RBZ). The agreement for the purchase of the buses was confirmed by the Zimbabwe Minister of Local Government and operations manager of Zupco, Ignatius Chombo, and the Public Relations Manager of Zupco, Richard Mlambo, acknowledged receipt of the purchase.It is noted that the flow of financial resources for this project is in reverse from Zimbabwe to China; it is neither ODA or OOF.

description: In March of 2005, construction on a waste water plant was started. On December 5, 2007, the Montagne Jacquot Wastewater Treatment Plant build by China International Water and Electric Corp. The financing for this project came from the Japan Bank for International Cooperation and the World Bank.

title: Ghana, China sign contract for modern court complex
description: In 2011, the Judicial Service of Ghana (JSG) and Messrs China State Hualong Limited signed a contract for the construction of 34-courtroom complex in Accra. The project would be supervised by Messrs Avantgarde Design Services, an Accra based Architectural Consultancy firm. The modern court complex, which is expected to be completed in 30 months, would comprise of 18 High Courts, 12 Circuit Courts, 2 Appeal Court, 2 Magistrate Court and 2 District Court buildings. The six-story building would also have facilities such as lawyers consulting rooms, a conference room, a bank, a clinic, restaurants, six lifts, car parking spaces, as well as facilities for physically challenged persons. The complex is estimated at $50 million USD and would be financed by the Social Security and National Insurance Trust and executed by China Hualong Construction Ltd. Work commenced on the project in October of 2011 and is still under construction.

description: On October 28, 2010 the road reconstruction project from Akieni to Akondja, Gabon was officially launched. The 74km road is located in the southeastern region of Gabon. The project was devised under the Gabon National Highway remediation plan by the Islamic Development Bank and the Gabonese government. The road will take 30 months to complete and was contracted to cost € 68,723,500. The Chinese company, Sinohydro Corp, will work with the implementation of the project. Information on the completion of the project is yet to be found.

title: Trains and commuter link plan falls through
description: In July of 2006, the Chinese company, Changchun Railway Vehicle Corporation (CNR) agreed by a Memorandum of Understanding to supply trains to the National Railways of Zimbabwe and help create a commuter train link for the Harare- Chitungwiza Line. In return, the Zimbabwean government would provide joint ventures in copper and iron ore mining. It was reported that plans had already been drawn for the new line, and the Reserve Bank of Zimbabwe already finalized initial down payments. While plans started to come together, in February of 2006, the entire project was put on hold as Zimbabwe could not come up with the deposit in time. There has been no status report on whether or not the project was re-initiated.

title: Initial Cellular Infrastructure Network
description: In 2003, the Libyan National Company for Post and Telecommunications awarded a 40 million USD contract to China's ZTE to build an initial 600,000 mobile phone lines for the newly established Libyana company. The contract included a planned network extension to 3 million lines by 2005. Although only 300,000 lines were reported as being finished in January of 2007, ZTE had provided Libyana with 3.3 million GSM (2G) lines and 1 million WCDMA (3G) lines by August 12, 2009. The exact start and end dates of this project are still unknown.ZTE continued to provide Libyana with network expansions later than 2009 in ID#2423.

title: Lom Pangar hydroelectric dam project contract
description: On May 9, 2011, Cameroon Power Development Corp. announced that the Lom Pangar dam construction contract was awarded to China International Water   Electric Corp. The dam, with a planned investment of  $198 million, intends to triple the power generative capacity from 1000 MW to 3000 MW by 2020. The World Bank is financing this project with a loan of $100 million along with the French Development Agency, and the European Investment Bank. The current status is pipeline.

title: Rehabilitate Monrovia-Buchanan Road (World Bank Funded; implemented by Chinese Company)
description: In September of 2006, the Chinese government began negations with Liberia to rehabilitate the Monrovia-Buchanan Highway. On November 7, 2007 it was reported that the Liberian Ministry of Public Works in collaboration with the World Bank would recondition the Monrovia-Buchanan Highway. The World Bank provided a US$23.4million grant to the government of Liberia for this undertaking. On November 16, 2007 the World Bank Sponsered project began and was undertaken by China Henan International Cooperation Group (Chico). In July of 2012, Liberian President Ellen Johnson-Sirleaf condemned some of the finished roads as substandard. The President announced that some of roads and streets constructed by the Ministry of Public Works and the World Bank sponsored Chinese company, CHICO, will have to be rebuilt during the dry season.

description: The China Tianchen Engineering Corporation serves as the general contractor for the construction of a manganese and silico-manganese plant. A French company, Compagnie Miniere de l’Ogooue - COMILOG, developed the project. The origination of this project is represented in Project # 684. The plant will be in the Moanda City Industrial Zone and will include a silico-manganese workshop, electrolytic manganese plant, sulfuric acid plat, and some other buildings. It was contracted for 120 million CNY and should take 14 months to complete.

title: Zimbabwe purchases buses from China
description: From a deal first struck in 2004, the Zimbabwe United Passenger Company (Zupco) bought 50 buses from China in March of 2005; they would purchase 400 total in the following year including 100 kits to refurbish old ones. These original 50 buses cost $2.3 million US dollars, which was financed through the Reserve Bank of Zimbabwe (RBZ). The Chinese company producing them (First Automative Works) produced them without the ability to handle the Zimbabwean terrain, and the entire fleet was eventually grounded. Project #18132 is a supplement delivery from the original 50. Project ID#26164 appears to be a duplicate.

title: Zimbabwe to buy 6 more Chinese aircraft
description: On August 24, 2006, the government of Zimbabwe announced that it had reached an agreement to purchase six military aircraft from China. The aircraft were due to be delivered to the Zimbabwe Air Forces at the end of 2006 for training purposes as well as low intensity attacks. The cost of the aircraft was not disclosed. The purchase was revealed by the Secretary of the Zimbabwe Ministry of Defense, Trust Maposa.It is noted that the flow of financial resources for this project is from Zimbabwe to China; it is neither ODA or OOF.
donor_agency: Ministry of Defense, Government Agency
verified: Ministry of Defense, Government Agency

title: Zimbabwe replaces aging railways with imported Chinese rails
description: On October 26, 2006, the government of Zimbabwe took delivery of 12,000 tons of railroad tracks from China worth a total of US$10.4 million to be used to replace 133 kilometers of aged railroads in the country. The acquisition of the rail took place through the state-owned parastatal National Railways of Zimbabwe (NRZ) with assistance from the private firm North Limpopo Projects Investments, alongside financing aid from the Reserve Bank of Zimbabwe. The 11,000 pieces of rail, of a grand total of 15,000, were delivered to Rutgena Railway Station after shipment from China through Mozambique. The rail replacement was due to begin on Monday, October 23, 2006 with the tracks running from Bulawayo to Victoria Falls and Harare to Bulawayo getting top priority for replacement. However, a Zimbabwean media report from May 2011 indicated that track was still being welded and laid across Zimbabwe in North, Southeast, Dabuka-Harare, and Mutare Provinces. The Zimbabwean government was represented by the Minister of Transport and Communications, Christopher Mushowe; NRZ spokesperson Fanuel Masikati, and the president of the National Railways of Zimbabwe, Mike Karakadzai. It is noted that the flow of money for this project is in reverse, with Zimbabwean money, US$3 million provided by the Reserve Bank of ZImbabwe, and US$7.4 million provided by the National Railways of Zimbabwe and North Limpopo, being spent directly on Chinese goods.

title: Zim signs MoU with China National Railways for railway equipment
description: On June 17, 2004, the Zimbabwean government and the state-owned National Railways of Zimbabwe announced the signing of a memorandum of understanding with Chinese government-owned China National Railways, officially known as China CNR Corporation for the purchase of locomotives, train wagons, and commuter trains. The Zimbabwean government was represented by the Minister of Transport and Communications, Christopher Mushohwe.It is noted that the flow of financial resources in this project is in reverse with Zimbabwe using government funds to purchase equipment directly from China.

title: China to build Ghana Defense Ministry offices
description: In 2007, the Chinese government agreed to help build a four story Ministry of Defense office complex. Construction began in 2007At the sod-cutting ceremony which was highly patronized by officials from China, Members of Parliament, with Hon. Ebenezer Begyina Sekyi-Hughes, the Speaker of Parliament serving as the Chairman for the occasion and his Deputy, Hon. Freddy Blay also in attendance, most political observers believed that it showed the magnanimity and the potential of the Minister on what he could do in the interest of the nation at a point in time.Dr. Addo-Kufuor in his opening address, recounted how he first visited China in October 2003 and had interactions with H.E. Chi Hao Cian, his contemporary Minister of Defence, which germinated style='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFF00'>the four-storey building for the MoD.He disclosed that the project would cost US$6.75m of which the Chinese government is providing US$5m grant whilst this country provides US$1.75m, adding that the project would be completed within 18 months.Dr. Addo-Kufuor, who noted that the current MoD building in Burma Camp is an old single storey building, which does not befit the international standing and image of the Ghana Armed Forces (GAF), said, 'I therefore, consider the sod-cutting for this project as very timely and appropriate.' He said the new building would provide an appropriate, conducive and befitting working environment for the MoD and the top hierarchy of the GAF.He said that an important hallmark in the recent history of MoD has been the construction of significant structures on the military landscape, which he underscored include the Kofi Annan Centre, the second Phase of 37 Military Hospital, Beijing Barracks, Burma Camp Computer Centre and Commercial Complex, Burma Hall and others.To him, his Ministry will continue to do its best within the budgetary constraints to provide the needed physical infrastructure, logistic support and other needs of the GAF to enable service personnel perform the roles of defending the nation, the constitution and national institutions.He commended the Chinese government for demonstrating their commitment to helping this nation. He also commended Beijing Institute of Architectural designs for their beautiful design as well as the contractors of the project, Quingdao Construction cooperation Group of China.The Minister noted that the organizations have proven track records and that 'we have no doubt that the project will be executed to specification within the allotted time.'Dr. Kwame Addo Kufuor was of the opinion that this sod-cutting ceremony marks another positive step in the relations between the MoD and China.He also mentioned the assistance that his led Ministry has got from the China government which included Beijing barracks, the Donfeng Chinese trucks which he explained are currently in use in the GAF, and the K-8 Jet fighters from the CATIC Company.On his part, Mr. Wei Jianguo, Chinese Deputy Minister for Defence, hinted at his government's preparedness to cement the friendship between Ghana and China.In attendance were the La Mantse, Nii Tetteh Kpobi Tsuru and the Mayor of Accra, Nii Agyiri Blankson, Hon. William Ofori-Boafo, Deputy Minister of Defence and a host of others.Document AFNWS00020070424e34o001bw
donor_agency_count: Qingdao Construction Group Ltd.
verified: Ministry of Defense, Government Agency

title: Strengthening Military Ties
description: A delegation of six senior officers led by the chief of staff of the Togo Armed Forces, Gen Ayé a Essofa went on a working mission to China in November of 2009. The soldiers were received by the Chinese minister of defence, Min Lyang Guanglie. It was reported that 'During its stay, the delegation will sign a 1.2-dollar convention on aid.'

title: Ghana, China sign military grant agreement (duplicate #1497)
description: Conflict with project ID 1497...confused. A 1.25m-dollar grant agreement has been signed between the Ministry of Defence and the Chinese government for the construction of a new Ministry of Defence building at Burma Camp in Accra.The minister of defence, Dr Kwame Addo Kufuor, disclosed this to newsmen when a six-member Chinese military delegation called on him in Accra yesterday. The delegation was led by Maj-Gen Zhang Bangdon, director-general for foreign affairs at [the Chinese] Central Military Commission and the Chinese Ministry of National Defence.Maj-Gen Zhang Bangdon conveyed best wishes from the Chinese minister of defence to his Ghanaian counterpart. He said the visit last October by Dr Addo Kufuor to China has gone a long way to improve the relations between the two countries' armed forces. He said the Chinese government is committed to fostering greater military cooperation with Ghana. Maj-Gen Bangdon indicated Chinese commitment to providing vacancies to Ghanaian military personnel to military institutions in China. He congratulated the Ghana army for its role in regional stability.For his part, Dr Addo Kufuor said the Ghana army has benefited a lot from courses from China since 1977 and hoped the cordial relations will continue. He hoped that the Artillery Garrison at Ho [eastern Ghana] will continue to receive assistance from China to make it more effective. Dr Addo Kufuor said another grant agreement will be used to acquire vehicles for the armed forces for internal use as well as for peacekeeping operations.Source: Radio Ghana, Accra, in English 0600 gmt 9 Mar 04Document BBCAP00020040309e039001e1

title: Deep-sea fishing Agreement
description: CSIS reports that in 2006, Guinea-Bissau become the first country to sign a deep water fisheries agreement with China, opening the door for large numbers of Chinese fishing vessels to operate in its Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ). title: Kaleta Hydroelectric dam on Konkoure River (Duplicate of 13823)
description: A dam is being constructed along Guinea's Konkoure River by Chinese state-owned enterprise China International Water and Electric Corporation. The Guinean government and China International Water and Electric Corporation are both financing its construction. Building began in April of 2012 and its expected completion is in 2015. Because of the uncertainty of the project's commitment year, it is difficult to discern its status as a project in this database. The project is worth approximately $526 million USD, and the dam is expected to be 238 megawatts. The Kaleta dam is located in central Guinea.

title: Hisense investment in South Africa
description: 223 words17 September 2001Xinhua News AgencyXNEWSEnglish(c) Copyright 2001 Xinhua News AgencyJOHANNESBURG, September 17 (Xinhua) - Hisense, a Chinese manufacturer of consumer electronic goods, is planning to increase its investment in South Africa and get a bigger share of the market, a senior member of the company said here on Monday.Yuan Qinglin, general manager of Hisense South Africa, noted that the Chinese company has invested more than 34 million rand ( about 3.95 million U.S. dollars) in South Africa over the past year.'Our current strategy is to grow our business from the 10-percent television market share that we already own,' Yuan said.The company is now gearing up to supply a wider range of products, including children's computers, Internet TVs, 3D TVs, air conditioners and DVD players, he noted.The new initiative is expected to earn a turnover of 100 million rand (about 11.6 million dollars) this year, rendering a positive effect on the South African economy, Yuan predicted.The company has created a number of new jobs for local people over the past year at its factory in Midrand, outside Johannesburg, according to the manager.Hisense has been operating in South Africa since 1993 when it began importing television sets into the country. Following the success of this venture, the company set up its first TV assembly plant in 1996.Document xnews00020010917dx9h000m9
donor_agency: Hisense Group, State-Owned Company
recipient_agencies: Hisense Group, State-Owned Company

title: 560万顶防疟蚊帐
description: To better prevent malaria, in 2010 Madagascar plans todistribute 56,000,000 anti-malaria nets free of charge.   It is understood that malaria is the biggest health concernin Madagascar.  Each year, there are over1 million outpatients, making up 16% of total outpatients.  In accordance with Madagascar’s totalpopulation of 200,000,000, malaria outpatients make up 5% of the totalpopulation.  Each year, Madagascar spendsup to USD 520,000,000 on malaria treatment.

title: PPIAF - Purchase of 85 percent stake in Chambishi copper mine [not a project, before 2000]
description: (PPIAF) In 1998, Zambia Consolidated Copper Mines completed the sale of  85% in Chambishi copper mine to China Nonferrous Metal Industry's Foreign Engineering and Construction Corporation Group. The assets sold have been vested into a newly formed company, NFC Africa Mining. The Chinese company had undertaken to make an investment commitment estimated at $70-mil to develop the mine to achieve a production level of between 5,250mt and 6,000mt/day of ore within four years. Production at Chambishi has been idled since it was placed on care and maintenance in 1987. The buyer paid a cash consideration of $20-mil for 85% of the share capital of NFC Africa; ZCCM has been granted a 15% free carried interest in NFC Africa, which it intends to retain.; Total Project Cost: USD 20 Million; Chinese Commitment: USD 90 Million; PPIAF-ID:451
donor_agency: China Nonferrous Metal Mining (Group) Co., Ltd. (CNMC), State-Owned Company

title: Dam (Duplicate)
description: 'BEIJING, No. 6 (Xinhua) -- China is willing to carry out reciprocal cooperation with Cape Verde in shipping, communications, service and tourism sectors, said Premier Wen Jiabao here Monday.'These industries are crucial for Cape Verde's economic development, while China boasts advantages in these areas,' he told Cape Verde's Prime Minister Jose Maria Neves.Though far apart, the two countries have always maintained close cooperative relations, he said. Throughout the years, China has provided assistance to help Cape Verde build more than 10 projects including a dam and a library, which has yielded good economic and social effects, he said.Stating his country has also sent more than 10 medical teams to Cape Verde, Wen said China is a developing country and is not well- off itself. The assistance we have provided to the best of our ability is therefore sincere and selfless, he added.Cape Verde attaches great importance to enhancing friendly cooperative relations with China, said Neves.The prime minister said his country is greatly inspired by the new moves China has announced to foster Africa's development, adding that Cape Verde wishes to take this opportunity and exert its own geological advantages to play a unique role in promoting Africa-China economic cooperation.Neves arrived here Friday for the Beijing Summit of the Forum on China-Africa Cooperation, a weekend gathering attended by 41 heads of state or government and senior officials from 48 African countries that have diplomatic ties with China.China and Cape Verde forged diplomatic relations on April 25, 1976, and bilateral trade totaled 5.19 million U.S. Dollars in '

title: 11 Mil interest-free loan for Economic houses in Luanda (Duplicate)
description: BDUEnglishCopyright 2003 China Daily Information Company. All rights reserved.China and Angola, despite the long distance between the two countries, have been enjoying good relations especially in the field of economy and trade.The economic cooperation between the Asian and African nations could date back to 1983 when the bilateral diplomatic relationship was established.However, due to the 27-year civil war in Angola, the economic ties have not been fully developed although there were some Chinese companies doing business in Angola before the end of the war in April last year.Since early 1990s, the trade between the two countries began to develop gradually. In 2000, the trade volume reached US$1.876 billion compared with US$150 million in 1995.According to some estimation, the trade volume could stand at US$2 billion this year as the first nine months have seen it reaching US$1.7 billion.In order to accelerate the reconstruction of country after the civil war, the government of President Jose Eduardo dos Santos has put forward an 'economic diplomacy' policy to attract foreign investment and technology and further develop trade with other countries.Two projects funded by the Chinese government on rebuilding the telecommunication network in three Angolan provinces and repairing some parts of Angolan railways have been carried out in October and November this year respectively.Besides, the Chinese government also provided Angola with economic aid in terms of grants and interest-free loans to the African country to help the displaced.The 15,000-sq. meter economic houses in Luanda, capital of Angola, built by a Chinese company with US$11 million of interest-free loan from the Chinese government have been deeply welcomed by the Angolan people.After seeing what the Chinese government companies have done in Angola, President dos Santos more than once expressed his hope that more Chinese businessmen would come to Angola to invest, trade and participate in the reconstruction of the country.Angola, a country with rich natural resources such as oil and diamond, needs assistance from other countries including China for rebuilding, dos Santos said.As the trade between China and Angola is complementary, the bilateral economic cooperation will surely come to a new high in the process of reconstructing Angola.Document BDU0000020031124dzbo0000p

title: China Railway Group 1.833 billion dollars (Duplicate)
description: '世华财讯 中国中铁(601390行情,股吧)与中水电组成的中国企业集团与刚果矿业签署合资协议，各方拟合资设立公司投资开发刚果铜钴矿资源项目及建设基础设施项目。其中，中国中铁有关的金额约为18.33亿美元。　　中国中铁(601390)4月23日发布公告称，公司于2008年4月22日与中国水利水电建设集团公司及刚果民主共和国政府签署《关于刚果民主共和国矿业开发和基础设施建设的合作协议》。根据合作协议，公司的全资附属公司中国中铁（香港）有限公司、中国中铁华刚矿业股份有限公司及中国中铁资源开发股份有限公司与中水电的全资子公司中国水电建设集团国际工程有限公司、中国水电建设集团港航建设有限公司以及LaSino-Congolaisedes Mines（刚果国家矿业总公司）和GILBERTKALAMBABANIKA先生于2008年4月22日就成立合资公司签订了《设立合资公司协议》，各方将以'项目换资源'模式投资开发铜钴矿资源项目及建设刚果（金）基础设施项目。　　投资各方在刚果按刚果法律成立一家股份有限公司，名为Societe par Actions aResponsabiliteLimitee（华刚矿业股份有限公司），注册资本为1亿美元。其中，中铁香港、中铁华刚、中铁资源、中水国际、中水港航、刚果矿业及GILBERTKALAMBABANIKA先生分别持有合资公司20%，9.9%，13.1%，20%，5%，20%及12%的股权。各方出资方式均为现金，其中公司所属投资方将利用内部现金资源提供认购价款所需资金。合资公司设立后将从事矿产开发。　　根据协议，刚果矿业应将其拥有的位于刚果的铜钴矿区的采矿权转让予合资公司。根据初步的可行性研究分析，该矿区已探明的铜储量约680万吨、钴储量约42万吨、铜品位为3.3%，而钴品位为0.24%。根据北京山海天评估咨询公司就相关矿权出具的评估报告，截至2007年12月31日的评估价值约为19亿美元。　　根据公司聘请的专业机构中国恩菲工程技术有限公司进行的初步调研，中国企业集团需负责的前述贷款及融资的总额约为29亿美元，其中公司所属投资方应负责贷款及融资约18.33亿美元，中水电所属投资方应负责贷款及融资约10.67亿美元。公司所属投资方负责的约18.33亿美元的贷款及融资中约有5.5亿美元为无息贷款，其余约12.83亿美元为协助安排提供之融资（适用6.1%的年利率）；中水电所属投资方提供的约10.67亿美元的贷款及融资中约有3.2亿美元为无息贷款，其余约7.47亿美元为协助安排提供之融资（适用6.1%的年利率）。　　公司表示，该项目的实施将使公司既以合理价格获得国外的优质铜钴矿产资源，通过矿产资源开发获得较好的收益；又能以比较简捷的方式获取大额的、非竞争性的基建项目国际工程承包业务，在短期内扩大海外市场份额。公司将可从这两个方面获得战略收益并增加参与国际竞争的实力。 '

title: Preferential Loan to extend port infrastructure (duplicate, see ID: 3)
description: Mauritanian president meets Chinese engineering company chief sikula 153 words 21 January 2010 06:20 AMXinhua News Agency XNEWS English (c) 2010 Xinhua News Agency NOUAKCHOTT, Jan. 21 (Xinhua) -- Mauritanian President Mohamed Ould Abdel Aziz on Wednesday met with visiting Sang Yuanming, director general of China Oerseas Engineering Group Company. COVEC has been involved in several construction projects in Mauritania, including government buildings. Sang told the official news agency after the meeting in Nouakchott that he had expressed to the Mauritanian leader the desire to contribute to the economic development of Mauritania. 'We are interested in culture and education,' he said, adding that 'efforts will be made to reinforce cooperation between the two countries.' Zhong Xun, the Chinese ambassador to Mauritania, and several other officials of COVEC, were also present at the meeting. Mauritania and China have signed an agreement on a preferential loan of 2 billion yuan (about 295 million dollars) for the extension of the Nouakchott Autonomous Port, which is popularly known as 'the port of friendship.'01Document XNEWS00020100121e61l005h9

title: Trade Exhibit in Nigeria - NOT A PROJECT.
description: 'LAGOS, November 1 (Xinhua) - China trade exhibition is to be held here from November 6 to 10 at the invitation of Nigerian Association of Chambers of Commerce, Industry, Mines and Agriculture, said Director of Exhibition Delegation Li Jianning here on Thursday.Organized by China Council for the Promotion of International Trade (CCPIT) and China Chamber of International Commerce, a total of 48 Chinese companies will attend the largest fair yet held by the CCPIT in Africa.Speaking at a news conference, Li said that both China and Nigeria as developing countries have much in common, such as a large population, huge market potential and rapid growth of economy, all of which provide conditions for the two sides to strengthen economic and trade cooperation.He said: 'Nigeria is one of China's important economic and trade cooperation partners. In recent years, propelled by the mutual visit of senior officials and the exchanges of entrepreneurs, substantial progress has been made in bilateral trade, investment and technical cooperation. Chinese enterprises are showing great interest in trade and investment in Nigeria.'In late August this year, Li said, Nigerian President Olusegun Obasanjo visited China and called on Chinese businessmen to invest in Nigeria, saying that the visit has injected strong new impetus into bilateral economic and trade cooperation.According to the director, a wide range of products will be on display, covering motorcycles and parts, auto parts, bicycle parts, tires, agriculture machines, weaving machines, cookware, air conditioners, color TVs, refrigerators, small household electric appliances, electronics, diesel engines and power generators.As the most populous country in Africa with about 120 million people, Nigeria has broad market potential and attracted more and more Chinese firms and individuals to do business with their Nigerian counterparts and seek for investment opportunities.According to the Economic and Commercial Office of the Chinese Embassy in Nigeria, the volume of bilateral trade between China and Nigeria amounted to 850 million U.S. dollars in 2000. While in the first half of 2001, it boosted to more than 530 million dollars. '
sector: Trade, Tourism, Banking and Financial Services
donor_agency_count: China Chamber of International Commerce (CCOIC), Government Agency; China Council for the Promotion of International Trade (CCPIT), Government Agency; Nigerian Association of Chambers of Commerce, Industry, Mines, and Agriculture, Government Agency

title: First Medical Equipment (Duplicate of 19719)
description: '[Xinhua: 'DR Congo Receives Chinese Medical Donation'] KINSHASA, Sept. 16 (Xinhua) - A Chinese medical team in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DR Congo) on Thursday donated medical equipment to the Sino-Congolese hospital in Kinshasa, Xinhua has learnt. The director for the Chinese medical team in DR Congo Wei Jindong noted that this was the second donation that has been given by his team since the time China started sending medical equipment to DR Congo in 2008. With a total cost of 10,000 U.S dollars, this donation is comprized of anti-malaria drugs, antibiotics and other medical equipment. The director general for the Sino-Congolese hospital Innocent Ngwende who represented the Congolese government thanked the Chinese side for their medical aid and declared that Congolese doctors would use the donation to give better medication to the Kinois (the people of Kinshasa). The Sino-Congolese hospital was constructed by China as a form of Chinese government aid. A Chinese medical team was sent here to assist the Congolese medical doctors. The Chinese medical team in DR Congo that is comprized of 18 medical experts is sent from the Chinese province of Hebei. Source: Xinhua news agency, Beijing, in English 1452 gmt 16 Sep 10'

title: Fincha-Amerti-Neshe multi-purpose projects (Duplicate)
description: Text of report in English by state-owned Ethiopian news agency ENA website Addis Ababa, 24 September: A loan agreement amounting to 208m US dollar was signed here on Monday [24 September] between the Commercial Bank of Ethiopia (CBE) and the Export Import Bank of China.President of CBE, Abie Sano [both elements as published] and president of China Export Import Bank, Li Ruogu signed the agreement. During the agreement signing ceremony it was disclosed that the loan will be used to finance the expansion of Muger Cement Enterprise and the construction of Fincha-Amerti-Neshe multi-purpose projects that include hydro-power generation and irrigation. As stipulated in the agreement, the loan will be utilized for the implementation of the delivery, supply and installation of Muger Cement Enterprise 3rd Cement Expansion Project and Amerti-Neshe multi-purpose project. The two projects necessitate 276m US dollar, out of which China Export Import Bank will finance 208m US dollar and the remaining 68m US dollar will be covered by the Ethiopian government. Speaking on the occasion, Minister of Finance and Economic Development, Sufyan Ahmed said since the inception of Ethiopia-China relationships, the Chinese government has provided grant assistance, interest free loans and technical assistance to support the country's development efforts. The launching of the 2000 China-Africa Cooperation Forum and the role played by the forum was also quite instrumental in revitalizing the relations between China and Africa, he said. The trade relation between the two countries is showing a steady growth, as part of the over all increase of China-Africa trade. He said currently the trade volume between the two countries has reached more than 500m US dollars. Sufyan said encouraging progress has also been recorded in the areas of investment. President of CBE, Abie Sano said the signing of the agreement would help speed up the construction of the projects that would have a vital importance to the country. President of China Export Import Bank Li Ruogu also said that the cooperation between the two countries will be further strengthened in the future. Source: ENA website, Addis Ababa, in English 24 Sep 07
donor_agency: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency

title: China Builds Airport in Exchange for Iron Ore (duplicate)
description: BBC Monitoring AfricaBBCAPEnglish(c) 2005 The British Broadcasting Corporation. All Rights Reserved. No material may be reproduced except with the express permission of The British Broadcasting Corporation.Excerpt from report by Radio France Internationale on 4 July[Presenter] You will construct an airport for me in exchange for iron ore. This is not a joke but rather the illustration of a daring exchange between Mauritania and China.Mauritania has entrusted the construction of a new international airport at Nouakchott to China; which will disburse 136m dollars as a loan to Mauritania which the latter will repay in raw materials over several years.Marie-Pierre Lafont [phonetic] you are in Nouakchott. This economic exchange is rather favourable to Mauritania.[Lafont] Iron, just like fishing is one of Mauritania's main resources. For over two years now, China has been experiencing a serious shortage of the commodity. Peking's very high demand has already allowed the SNIM [National Industrial and Mining Company ] to maintain its production in recent months and reopen some deposits whose quality could satisfy the Chinese. This new large-scale exchange should avail greater support to a sector that has been experiencing difficult years. Precisely, each instalment to be paid will be reimbursed against its exchange value in iron tonnage. The operation should span over 16 years. Several hundred Chinese workers will work on the construction site which will be located some 20km north of the capital. The present airport is situated in the city centre. It cannot be expanded as there is no space to do so. As Mauritania prepares for its petroleum future, it expects an increase in air traffic in the coming years.Source: Radio France Internationale, Paris, in French 1230 gmt 4 Jul 05Document BBCAP00020050704e1740025t

title: CDB deal partnership with United Bank for Africa (NOT A PROJECT)
description: 'China's drive into Africa's financial services sector has taken a fresh turn, with China Development Bank entering a partnership with United Bank for Africa, one of Nigeria's biggest lenders.The deal, sealed last month but not yet officially announced, expands the Chinese bank's ability to finance infrastructure projects in Africa.News of the agreement follows last week's announcement that Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, another state bank, was buying a 20 per cent stake in South Africa's Standard Bank for $5.56bn.CDB has not bought equity in UBA, which is listed on the Nigerian stock exchange, though the deal will help it expand in Africa.The two deals mark the start of a transformation in Africa's banking industry, opening fresh channels for Chinese finance in a region which has previously been largely dependent on western companies and donors.Chinese banks are seeking local operators to channel billions of dollars into African projects, in part to secure the oil and minerals needed to fuel China's fast-growing economy.CDB, which provides much of the financial muscle for infrastructure developments in China, refused to comment on Tuesday. Tony Elumelu, UBA's chief executive, told the Financial Times: 'It provides us [with] an almost infinite amount of capital to execute projects.' He added: 'They will invest in any credit that we recommend.'By the CDB agreement, a copy of which has been seen by the Financial Times, Chinese staff from the bank will work with their counterparts at UBA's headquarters in Lagos to fund projects in West Africa.Mr Elumelu said he hoped by the end of March to strike an agreement with CDB to finance a power project that would help to tackle Nigeria's chronic electricity shortages.UBA, with a balance sheet of about $8bn, hopes to expand into as many as 12 African countries next year.'It is no longer a question of funding capability, but about our ability to identify good projects,' Mr Elumelu said. 'Africa is a huge untapped market - but it takes those who understand African markets and African risks to take advantage.'CDB has more assets than the World Bank and Asian Development Bank combined, with $281bn of loans outstanding by the end of June. '
sector: Trade, Tourism, Banking and Financial Services
recipient_agencies: China Development Bank (CDB), Government Agency
verified: United Bank for Africa Plc (UBA), State-Owned Company

title: Duplicate: 45km road for Belinga ore project through national park
description: Employees of Gabon's Iindo National Park, about 400 kilometers east of the capital of Libreville, are at their wits' end. Their frustration stems from the fact that a Chinese company has built a road for industrial use in the national park. 'It's a presidential project, so no one can oppose it,' one park employee grumbled. Construction of the road began around last July, with no public notification, in the north of the park. The 45-kilometer road opened this month, cutting a swath through the rain forest in the park, in anticipation of construction beginning on a hydraulic power dam set to be built near the park's waterfalls, some of the largest in Africa.

title: Chinese investors to build 'giant' industrial zone (Duplicate)
description: Text of report in English by Ethiopian newspaper The Reporter website on 28 JuneChinese investors are scheduled to receive 200 hectares [ha] of land today for an industrial zone project involving 80 'huge' factories to be built on it, it was learnt by The Reporter.Located in Oromiya region around Dukem [southern Ethiopia], a small town some 35 km south-east of Addis Ababa, the 200 ha of land is part of the 1,000 ha plot which will be handed over to Chinese investors for what is expected to become a 'giant' Chinese industrial zone in Africa, according to some observers.Representatives of the first phase of the Chinese industrial zone will today receive the 200 hectares from the Oromiya regional government president, Abadula Gemeda.The Chinese secured the plot on a lease basis while they are expected to settle a 10 million birr [about 1 million US dollar] payment to compensate dislocated farmers.Expected to consume an initial investment outlay of one billion birr, the first phase industrial zone project is scheduled to commence within two months.Materials and equipment for the construction of the first phase industrial zone project and various machineries are already on their way to the port of Djibouti, according to informed sources.The industrial zone will involve textile, garment, shoe, construction materials, electrical equipment, engineering material equipment manufacturing and food processing factories, among others.The design of the industrial zone is planned to be similar to that found in China. Chinese designers were here earlier on to familiarize themselves with the site and to produce a conceptual design of the first phase of the industrial zone.The first phase project is expected to create job opportunities for over 10,000 people.High government officials and dignitaries from both China and Ethiopia are expected the attend the signing ceremony between the Oromiya regional government and the delegation of the Chinese investors. Following the signing ceremony, the handover of the site will take place.The plan for what is expected to become a giant Chinese industrial zone in the continent of Africa was initiated and conceived after Prime Minister Meles Zenawi's grand visit to China some two years ago, according to reliable sources.Source: The Reporter website, Addis Ababa, in English 28 Jun 08
recipient_agencies: Oromiya Regional Government, Government Agency

title: 中国商务部副部长魏建国:互利共赢的中非合作 [not cleaned] ［Too Vague］
description: 中国与非洲国家是情同手足的好兄弟。为帮助非洲国家更好发展，五十多年来，中国在自身还不富裕的情况下，帮助非洲实施了近900个项目，为非洲培训1.5万人，向1.8万名非洲学生赴华留学提供奖学金，派出1.6万名医疗队员赴非洲。中国单方面给予非洲最不发达国家部分输华商品零关税待遇，免除非洲重债穷国和最不发达国家109亿元人民币债务。中国重视发展社会事业和改善民生。截至2006年底，中国为非洲援建了38所医院、76万人座的体育场馆、19所学校、18个农场和18座电站，打了700多口井，修建了2000多公里铁路和3000多公里公路。未来三年，中国还将为非洲援建30所医院、100所农村学校、30所抗疟中心和10个农业技术示范中心，并将进一步扩大援助规模、减免债务、开放市场。    中国与非洲国家是平等互利的好伙伴。中非经贸合作快速发展，已成为推动非洲经济增长的重要动力。据测算，目前中国对非贸易对于非洲经济增长的贡献率达20%左右。中国产品质优价廉，打破了高价垄断，让非洲人民得到了实惠；中国技术适合非洲需求，降低了经营成本。2006年，中非贸易额已达555亿美元。中国成为非洲的第3大贸易伙伴。截至2006年底，中国累计对非各类投资117亿美元。农业开发、加工制造、交通、通讯、水利、电力等基础设施领域是中国投资的重点领域。

title: Chinese company constructing Ugandan fibre-optic infrastructure (Duplicate)
description: Country to Get Cheap Computersby Dorothy Nakaweesi393 words10 December 200705:18 PMAll AfricaAFNWSEnglish(c) 2007 AllAfrica, All Rights ReservedKampala, Dec 10, 2007 (The Monitor/All Africa Global Media via COMTEX) -- IN an effort to increase the use and distribution of computers in the country, the government and the United Nations Industrial Development Organisation are in talks to form a public-private partnership to set up a computer refurbishing plant that will substantially reduce the cost of a computer.'In a few months Ugandans will have access to PC at a cheaper target price of only $100 (Shs170, 000) and some of these PCs have already reached in the country,' Mr Patrick Bitature, the chairman of Uganda Investments, said.He said the plant is expected to have a refurbishing capacity of 10,000 PCs per year.Mr Bitature said if the project materialises it will be beneficial to all Ugandans including those in the rural area. 'Information and Communication Technology is probably the single most important tool one can embrace other than education, for development. Poverty is rooted in ignorance,' he said.One of the avenues is to see the price of a single computer go down to about $100 (Shs170, 000). Currently the market price of a brand new PC is rated at Shs1.5 million ($882) and Shs800, 000 ($470) depending on the type and durability.In Uganda there about with a population close to 30 million people, about 120,000 people can get access to a PC but only 25,000 are registered by the subscribers with all the Internet Service Providers (ISPs).Mr Bitature said: 'Uganda still has the opportunity to exploit the ICTs fully to reduce on the over dependency on agriculture to at least 50 percent'.The government recently scrapped off Value Added Tax on computer imports to increase computer availability in the country.Currently the national fibre-optic backbone infrastructure is being rolled out at a cost of more than $106 million (Shs175 billion). This followed the Uganda's signing of a deal with the government of China. A Chinese company, Huaiwei Technologies was assigned to do the job slated to be complete in less than or a year's time.The East African Submarine Cable System (EASSy), the landmark fibre-optic cable project that will connect 22 coastal and land-locked African countries to each other and the rest of the world with high-quality Internet.Document AFNWS00020071210e3ca0026t
donor_agency_count: Huawei Technologies Co., Ltd., Private Sector
recipient_agencies: Huawei Technologies Co., Ltd., Private Sector

title: $5m aid for development to Gabon (Duplicate of 583)
description: Beijing grants $5 million in aid as President Bongo continues his one-week visit to China. Chinese President Hu Jintao has put forward proposals for developing sustainable relationship between China and Gabon. The Chinese leader held talks Wednesday in Beijing with visiting Gabonese President El Hadj Omar Bongo Ondimba. He said China is ready to work with Gabon to maintain the good momentum of the development of bilateral relations. In order to promote these relations, Hu proposed that the two countries push forward political communications and people-to-people exchanges, saying the two sides should further exchange mutual understanding and friendship so as to lay a solid foundation for the long-term development of bilateral relations. Secondly, President Hu said the two countries should further tap into the potential of trade and economic cooperation and expand the scale of cooperation. He said China will continue to encourage strong and prestigious Chinese enterprises to invest and do business in Gabon. He hoped the two sides will reinforce cooperation in such resources development areas as oil, mining and reforestation. Also he hoped that both sides explore such cooperative areas as agriculture, water conservation and fishing. Thirdly, President Hu said the two countries should deepen exchanges and cooperation in such fields as education, culture and public health; and step up collaboration in human resources development under the framework of the China-Africa Forum. Finally, Hu insisted that the two countries should give a bigger role to the political consultation mechanism between their foreign ministries so as to maintain sound cooperation and coordination on international affairs. President Bongo agreed with Hu on his comments on bilateral relations. He reiterated Gabon's stance on firmly sticking to the one-China policy and its support to China's cause of reunification. President Bongo briefed Hu about the current situation of Africa and the existing hot issues. Noting that China is a true friend of Africa, he said Gabon and other African states wish to deepen cooperation with China and hope that China will play a bigger role in resolving the hot issues in Africa. After the talks, the two presidents attended the signing ceremony of some documents between their governments, including the agreement on economic, technological cooperation and an aid package of $ 5 million (about CFA 2.7 billion) granted by Beijing for for development projects in Gabon.

title: 11 million dollar interest-free loan for economic houses in Luanda (Duplicate)
description: BDU English Copyright 2003 China Daily Information Company. All rights reserved. China and Angola, despite the long distance between the two countries, have been enjoying good relations especially in the field of economy and trade. The economic cooperation between the Asian and African nations could date back to 1983 when the bilateral diplomatic relationship was established. However, due to the 27-year civil war in Angola, the economic ties have not been fully developed although there were some Chinese companies doing business in Angola before the end of the war in April last year. Since early 1990s, the trade between the two countries began to develop gradually. In 2000, the trade volume reached US$1.876 billion compared with US$150 million in 1995. According to some estimation, the trade volume could stand at US$2 billion this year as the first nine months have seen it reaching US$1.7 billion. In order to accelerate the reconstruction of country after the civil war, the government of President Jose Eduardo dos Santos has put forward an 'economic diplomacy' policy to attract foreign investment and technology and further develop trade with other countries. Two projects funded by the Chinese government on rebuilding the telecommunication network in three Angolan provinces and repairing some parts of Angolan railways have been carried out in October and November this year respectively. Besides, the Chinese government also provided Angola with economic aid in terms of grants and interest-free loans to the African country to help the displaced. The 15,000-sq. meter economic houses in Luanda, capital of Angola, built by a Chinese company with US$11 million of interest-free loan from the Chinese government have been deeply welcomed by the Angolan people. After seeing what the Chinese government companies have done in Angola, President dos Santos more than once expressed his hope that more Chinese businessmen would come to Angola to invest, trade and participate in the reconstruction of the country. Angola, a country with rich natural resources such as oil and diamond, needs assistance from other countries including China for rebuilding, dos Santos said. As the trade between China and Angola is complementary, the bilateral economic cooperation will surely come to a new high in the process of reconstructing Angola. Document BDU0000020031124dzbo0000p

title: Children's Day Care Centre, low-cost houses and a pumping station at Aussenkehr.
description: Q: How would you characterize relations between China and Namibia?A: The two countries share an 'all-weather' friendship, which is tested by history. While Namibia was struggling for independence, China rendered help to Namibia within its capacity, despite its own underdevelopment. After Namibia gained independence, China has continued to support Namibia in its nation-building.Last year witnessed President Pohamba's visit to China and Chinese Communist Party Politburo member Li Changchun's visit to Namibia. This Year, Founding President Sam Nujoma paid his thirteenth visit to China and President Pohamba will attend the Forum on China-Africa Cooperation Beijing Summit. These visits have been a big driving force for the development of the friendly cooperation between China and Namibia.Secondly, bilateral economic cooperation and trade have been developing steadily with fruitful results. Since the two countries established diplomatic ties, China has undertaken projects like the Children's Day Care Centre, low-cost houses and a pumping station at Aussenkehr.In April this year, China handed over the two regional council buildings, constructed with Chinese grants, to Namibia. Work on the new State House residence is to start soon.

title: $200m loan for Telecom project
description: In 2004, the Nigerian government launched a $200 million rural telephone program. The project was funded by a loan package guarantee from Chinese government, while the Nigerian government provided counterpart funding of N2.8 billion. The rural telephony programme will be delivered in three projects spread across 343 local government areas of the country. The three projects include Rural Radio Systems (RRS), which will be provided in 125 local government areas, Alcatel Shangai Bell (ASB) covering 108 local governments, and the ZTE, which will be provided in 110 local government areas.The ceremony, in the Kwali Area Council of the Federal Capital Territory (FCT) was attended by Minister of Communications Chief Cornelius Adebayo, Minister FCT Mallam Nasir el-Rufai, Executive Vice Chairman of the National Communications Commission (NCC) Engr. Ernest Ndukwe, Chairman of the Kwali Area Council Alhaji Mohammed Gimba, and other operators.  Might be duplicate, see ID# 1420, 1705

title: Construction of airport terminal in Algiers
description:
In January of 2003, China State Construction & Engineering was awarded a contract for the construction of an airport terminal in Houari Boumedienne airport in Algiers. It was reported that company has been making good progress, and the work was scheduled for completion in mid-2005. The new terminal will encompass 81,800 square meters, will accommodate 1,000 people per hour or 3,000,000 per year. The contract value was $230 million. An updated status on this project cannot be found.

title: Chinese Assistance for Ho Artillery Garrison [duplicate with #1497]
description: A 1.25m-dollar grant agreement has been signed between the Ministry of Defence and the Chinese government for the construction of a new Ministry of Defence building at Burma Camp in Accra.The minister of defence, Dr Kwame Addo Kufuor, disclosed this to newsmen when a six-member Chinese military delegation called on him in Accra yesterday. The delegation was led by Maj-Gen Zhang Bangdon, director-general for foreign affairs at [the Chinese] Central Military Commission and the Chinese Ministry of National Defence.Maj-Gen Zhang Bangdon conveyed best wishes from the Chinese minister of defence to his Ghanaian counterpart. He said the visit last October by Dr Addo Kufuor to China has gone a long way to improve the relations between the two countries' armed forces. He said the Chinese government is committed to fostering greater military cooperation with Ghana. Maj-Gen Bangdon indicated Chinese commitment to providing vacancies to Ghanaian military personnel to military institutions in China. He congratulated the Ghana army for its role in regional stability.For his part, Dr Addo Kufuor said the Ghana army has benefited a lot from courses from China since 1977 and hoped the cordial relations will continue. He hoped that the Artillery Garrison at Ho [eastern Ghana] will continue to receive assistance from China to make it more effective. Dr Addo Kufuor said another grant agreement will be used to acquire vehicles for the armed forces for internal use as well as for peacekeeping operations.Source: Radio Ghana, Accra, in English 0600 gmt 9 Mar 04Document BBCAP00020040309e039001e1

title: China sends 13th peacekeeping mission to Liberia
description: On March 14 2012, China sent its 13th peacekeeping medical team to Liberia. The members’ average age is 36 and among them 12 hold Ph.Ds or Master’s degrees and3 have participated in a peacekeeping mission in the past. The first 23 members will depart on the 14th and the second group of 20 members will depart on the 26th.  The two groups will stay for 8 months to carry out the UN peace keeping mission.According to the President of the Bethune International Peace Hospital, China’s 13th batch pays strict accordance to standard set forth by the UN.  China has participated in peacekeeping operations in Liberia since December 2003 and each batch of peacekeepers stays for eight months.

description: On December 24, 2007, China Oilfield Services Limited announced it would join with a yet unidentified Libyan drilling company to secure a service contract to provide a number of onshore drilling rigs. In addition to the rigs, they agreed to provide tens of senior technical workers for implementation and management of the project. title: $7B Export Credit Insurance for Multiple Sectors
description: In October 2004, the China Export and Credit Insurance Corporation (SINOSURE) pledged $7 billion in export credit insurance in the area of power generation, crude oil and exploration, coal processing, setting up of an export refinery and a petrochemical plant as well as in agriculture. A 15-person steering committee was set up by the Nigerian government to work out the details of the project. The committee is headed by Special Advisor to the President on Manufacturing and Private Sector, Alhaji Abdulkadir Ahmed, with other members drawn from both the public and private sectors, including the Special Advisor to the President on Petroleum, Dr. Edmund Daukoru, and four other ministers.The status of the projects is uncertain.STAFF_NOTES: This commitment by SINOSURE may be connected to two CNPC/CNOOC oil deals signed at later dates, ID# 1844 and ID#262. Export credit insurance (or export credit guarantees") are not considered projects of development finance and so this record has been deactivated. "

title: China offers Nigeria $50bn export credit
description: In March 2008, Sinosure appeared to have offered up to $50 billion USD in export guarantees to help fund infrastructure development projects in Nigeria over the following three years. The validity and status of this credit is uncertain.STAFF_NOTES:The project is doubted by Deborah Brautigam, who blogged, 'Does it seem likely that after providing $39.6 billion in 2007 across the world, Sinosure would offer to provide $50 billion, just for Nigeria, in 2008? When I was in Nigeria in May 2009, I asked at the Nigerian Ministry of Finance, the IMF resident office, and the Nigerian embassy about this '$50 billion' Sinosure 'pledge', only to be met by bafflement. None of them had even heard about this tale.' This project is marked as suspicious for those reasons.Export credit guarantees are not considered development finance, and so this record has been deactivated.

title: Instatement of a zero tariff on items exported to China
description: In 2006, China and Eritrea signed agreements regarding the instatement of a zero tariff on items exported to China, as well as extending China’s technical assistance to the country. Eritrea was one of 32 developing countries to sign a zero tariff agreement with China. Starting form 1 July 2010, China will render zero tariff treatment to 4762 products originated from Bangladesh and other 32 Least Developed Countries (in accordance with 2010 China Customs Nomenclature), accounting for 60% of all Chinese taxable items.The 33 countries that will enjoy zero tariff treatments are: Bangladesh, Ethiopia, Benin, Burundi, Equatorial, Guinea, Eritrea, Djibouti, Democratic Republic of Congo, Guinea, Guinea Bissau, Comoros, Liberia, Madagascar, Mali, Malawi, Mauritania, Mozambique, Rwanda, Sierra Leone, Sudan, Tanzania, Togo, Uganda, Zambia, Lesotho, Chad, Central Africa, Afghanistan, Nepal, East Timor, Yemen, Samoa, Vanuatu. STAFF_NOTES: Preferential trade agreements are not counted as official or unofficial development finance, and so this record has been deactivated.

title: Tariff-free and quota-free trade agreement
description: On September 21, 2007, China's Assistant minister for commerce, Fu Ziying, and Uganda's Finance minister, Dr. Ezra Suruma, signed an agreement for China to grant tariff-free and quota-free treatment to more than 400 commodities from Uganda, with preferential treatment for Ugandan coffee. The amount and end date are unknown.  STAFF_NOTES: Preferential tariff agreements are not counted as official or unofficial development finance, and so this record has been deactivated.

title: Zero tariff treatment
description: A delegation including the Deputy Minister of Commerce of the People's Republic of China, Fu Ziying carried out a four-day official visit from April 22 to 25, 2010. Followng Bilateral Discussions a signing ceremony between the Governments of the Republic of Liberia and the People's Republic of China where six agreements were signed. One of the agreements was for a zero tariff treatment. Import duties of sixty percent (60%) of commodities originated from Liberia to China were totally exempted. Her Excellency Madam Olubanke King-Akerele, Minister of Foreign Affairs signed for the Republic of Liberia while Honorable Fu Ziying, Deputy Minister of Commence of China signed on behalf of his government. title: Easing Customs Duty
description: In 2010, the Chinese Ministry of Finance decided to remove customs duties from 4,000 goods coming from 33 developing countries, including Togo, in order to achieve the UN's Millenium Development Goals. This project affects all 26 African countries. In addition to Togo, Benin, Mali and Central Africa will benefit from the decision. It is unclear if the agreement has been implemented. title: 'Studying setting up' Sinopec company to provide oil services
description: 'CAIRO, Sept 7 (Reuters) - Egypt is studying setting up a company with China Petroleum   Chemical Corp (Sinopec) to provide oil services in Egypt, the Middle East and Africa, Egypt's state news agency cited its oil minister as saying.Drilling has been an important area of cooperation between Egypt and China, which jointly established the SinoTharwa Drilling Company in 2005, the Middle East News Agency (MENA) reported on Tuesday. China has invested heavily in some African states, but contributed just $60 million of the $8.1 billion in foreign direct investment Egypt attracted in the year to the end of June 2009, according to Egypt's central bank.There have been some signs this may shift. Egypt's investment minister said in June the chairman of China's sovereign wealth fund would visit Egypt to discuss infrastructure and other possible investments. [ID:nLDE65E1EJ]Oil Minister Sameh Fahmy met Sinopec President Su Shulin on Monday to discuss possible ways of boosting cooperation, MENA said. (Reporting by Alexander Dziadosz; editing by Keiron Henderson))'
donor_agency_count: China Petroleum & Chemical Corporation (Sinopec Ltd.), State-Owned Company
recipient_agencies: China Petroleum & Chemical Corporation (Sinopec Ltd.), State-Owned Company

title: Comprehensive hydropower project with powerlines- duplicate with 1043
description: 'China's Exim bank is expected to provide 1.4 billion Kenyan shillings (US$19 million)impl finance to the Kenya Power   Lighting Company (KPLC) in China's first loan for the country. The Nation Reporter said that the money will be channelled to supply projects, including a 61-km 132kV line from Chemosit in Kericho to Kisii, where a substation will be constructed, and several distribution lines and a 122-km, 132kV line from Kamburu hydropower substation to Meru. China's CAMMC Engineering Company will carry out the projects. The first phase of the CAMMC loan is expected to reach US$25 million, with a further US$35 million expected for the second phase of the project, the report said.
donor_agency: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
donor_agency_count: Kenya Power and Light Company (KPLC), State-Owned Company
recipient_agencies: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
verified: Kenya Power and Light Company (KPLC), State-Owned Company

title: China’s Sinosure backs loan for Ghana Telecom imports NEEDS CONFIRMATION
description: Ghana Telecom has signed a Sinosure-supported buyer credit agreement with Société Générale Corporate   Investment Banking (SG CIB).The facility is worth $67 million and carries a maturity of six years. Funds will be used to upgrade and expand Ghana Telecom’s networks, financing the import of equipment from Alcatel Shanghai Bell. The loan is insured by Sinosure, the Chinese export credit agency. SG CIB acted as sole arranger, hedging bank and lender.Ghana Telecom was represented by Cadwalader, Wickersham and Taft, while Afrinvest, a management-owned investment banking firm based in London, provided financial advice.Ghana Telecom is 70% owned by the government of Ghana and is a key client of SG-SSB, SG CIB’s subsidiary in Ghana. The remaining 30% is owned by G-Com, a consortium headed by Telekom Malaysia. Ghana Telecom is operated by Telenor Management Partners, a subsidiary of the Norwegian telecommunications firm, which agreed a management services agreement with the government of Ghana.The company also completed a $60 million receivables-backed syndicated term loan facility in late 2003. Cadwalader provided legal advice on the deal, with funds provided by a syndicate of international and domestic banks led by Barclays Bank and Standard Chartered Bank. Ghana Telecom was at the time also planning a Sinosure facility, but this was delayed while the telecom operator was forced to settle a dispute with Telekom Malaysia and G-Com. An out-of-court settlement was reached earlier this year, allowing the financing to go ahead.This rare transaction is not the first time Sinosure has guaranteed exports to Africa. SG CIB and Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC) jointly arranged a buyer credit supporting Chinese telecoms exports to Africa in a deal for Algérie Télécom in late 2003 (see Trade Finance March 2004 page 29). The Chinese exporter in that $40 million, 6.5-year transaction was ZTE. Banque Nationale d’Algérie also supported the transaction.Document TRAFIN0020050131e11900010
donor_agency: China Export & Credit Insurance Corporation (Sinosure), State-Owned Company; Société Générale Corporate & Investment Bank, Private Sector
donor_agency_count: Vodafone Ghana (Ghana Telecom), Private Sector
recipient_agencies: China Export & Credit Insurance Corporation (Sinosure), State-Owned Company
verified: Vodafone Ghana (Ghana Telecom), Private Sector

title: Not bilateral: African Minerals in $1.5 billion deal with Shandong
description: See 'awkoko.org' source.On July 16, 2010, African Minerals Ltd signed a binding MoU for a second $1.5 billion investment deal with Shandong Iron   Steal for a 25% stake in the Tonkolili project, African Minerals' flagship iron ore project. The deal involves a three-stage investment and an agreement for Shandong to buy 10 million tonnes of iron ore per year at discounted prices, which sent shares soaring by 19.5%. The deal should enable African Minerals Ltd to accelerate the development of Tonkolili by boosting production, according to Executive Chairman Rank Timis. The new funds should also allow an improvement in the planned infrastructure so that all transport will be on rail, instead of a mix with road haulage.African Minerals said the proceeds from the deal will be used to build a railway line linking the mine and the port. The railway will be completed in the fall of 2011, and the first delivery of iron ore will take place in the fourth quarter of the same year.In February 2012, China's National Development and Reform Committee (NDRC) approved Shandong Iron and Steel's proposed $1.5 billion investment in African Minerals' Tonkolili project.

title: Bui Dam Construction
description: In 2008, China's SinoHydro signed a financing agreement with the government of Ghana to construct the Bui Dam located in the Black Volta River worth $562 million USD. This sum includes a concessional loan for $270 million USD between the two governments while there was another agreement worth $292 million USD between Ghana and the Export-Import Bank of China. Ghana will contribute $22 million USD to the construction of the facility. In September of 2008, President John Agyekum Kufour launched the construction of the dam, which is expected to be completed in five years. It is currently under construction, according to International Rivers. The project appears to be untied.
